text:
Good.……………;tast like beer we like it a lot. Hhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjj

 via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.355l bottle thanks to Cristobal37. Vintage 2015. Hazy dark ruby body with an orangish light brown head. Aroma of whiskey, vanilla, raisins, wood, cloves and burnt sugar. Taste of toast, whiskey, raisins, chocolate, wood and a nice amount of floral hops. Great beer.

12 ounce bottle into snifter, bottled on 9/22/2016. Pours hazy very dark reddish brown color with a 1-2 finger dense and rocky light khaki head with awesome retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of caramel, brown sugar, toffee, molasses, vanilla, bourbon, toasted oak, coconut, brown bread, raisin, plum, fig, cherry, and date; with lighter notes of chocolate, leather, tobacco, smoke, herbal, and yeast/oak/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/bready/light roasted malt, bourbon barrel, and fruity yeast notes; with good strength. Taste of big caramel, brown sugar, toffee, molasses, vanilla, bourbon, toasted oak, coconut, brown bread, raisin, plum, fig, cherry, and date; with lighter notes of chocolate, leather, tobacco, smoke, herbal, and yeast/oak/toasted earthiness. Light herbal bitterness and bourbon/oak spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of caramel, brown sugar, toffee, molasses, vanilla, bourbon, toasted oak, coconut, brown bread, leather, tobacco, light smoke, herbal, and yeast/oak/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready/light roasted malt, bourbon barrel, and fruity yeast flavors; with a great malt/bitter/spiciness balance, and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light dryness from bitter/spiciness, lightly increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and medium-full body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/silky, and lightly sticky/chalky/tannic balanced mouthfeel that is great. Minimal warming alcohol for 11.2%, with no barrel booziness. Overall this is an incredible barrel aged scotch ale. All around fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready/light roasted malt, bourbon barrel, and fruity yeast flavors; very smooth and dangerously easy to sip on for the big ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

Bottle, 355 ml. Pours dark reddish-brown, very cloudy, thin sheen of soapy light tan head, patchy lacing, no visible carb. Aroma is rich, sweet, malty; lots of sugary stuff; mollasses, fruitcake, cooked pineapple, dark toffee, salted caramel, vanilla, bourbon, little hint of oak, earth, really nice. Taste is sweet, malty, cakey, with dried fruits, muscavado sugar, candied orange, blood orange around the edges, dark chocolate, cinnamon, dark caramel malts, very rich. Hefty malty bitterness on the back end, dry, medicinal, bitter finish. Full body, thick texture, negligible carb. Everything I expected, definitely somewhat reminiscent of a highland or speyside malt!

Mörkt rödbrun med litet beiget skum. Kraftig doft av torkade fikon, dadlar, mandelmassa, vanilj och bourbon. Smaken är eldig med Anton Bergs plommon i konjak, dadlar och fikon, tydliga bourbontoner, en liten alkoholhetta. En häftig old ale, smakrik och välbalanserad trots den stora sötman.

Bottle. Reddish-amber color, very good yellowish foam. Aroma: barrel, vanilla, bourbon, a little butter, oak, nectar, sweetness, caramel. Taste: creamy toffee, bourbon, maple syrup, oak, caramel, very soft. Excellent!

Beczka po bourbonie wywindowała aromatycznie to piwo na niebotyczne poziomy, oj ten kokos wręcz zabija. W smaku na początku też tak jest, no ale za chwilę wchodzi raczej chamski alkohol i mam ambiwalentne odczucia. Za pierwszym razem smakowało mi o niebo lepiej.

Bottle from Stanislaus Brewkovitch, Zwolle. Aroma is caramel malt, toffee, Bourbon, oak, dried fruits, figs, some vanilla, heavy butterscotch, touch of tobacco and light booze. Flavour is sweet with a light bitterness in the finish. Body is full with a little alcohol. Pretty daunting beer, rich and sweet, I can understand why this is regarded an elite Scotch Ale, I am just not generally drawn to this butterscotch-heavy profile.

Big and delicious for your perty mouth. Expect lovely, warm smells of single malt scotch, oaky bourbon barrels, smoke, sweet caramel and roasted malts. A bit of earthy spice and a scintilla of dark cherries. Its a kick-back sipper made to excite the palate.

W aromacie trochę wędzonki, słodkiej karmelowej wędzonki ładnie komponującej się ze słodyczą z beczki (wanilia, kokos). W smaku z początku bardzo mocno kokosowe, po chwili niestety do akcji wkracza niezbyt przyjemny alkohol który zabija tą słodycz i tak mamy tu do czynienia z kokosanką zamoczoną w alkoholu. Czas może mu zrobić dobrze.
From Saveur Biere. In Teku glass. Watching Narcos 2x10. A bit of a letdown given the hype. Plenty of bourbon, wood and alcohol here, too much for my liking, causing it to require slow drinking.
Scott ale in Bourbon barrel. Drink tap at founder. Smell and taste go well together. more can I say?

Bottle. Pours a dark auburn red with not much of a head. Aroma has a strong whiff of vanilla and oak, somewhat wooden. Caramel is there as well. Taste follows along the same lines really. Vanilla is stronger, but backed by the caramel malt base. Pretty one-dimensional.

Deep ruby to brown colour, foggy. One finger tall ivory head. The aroma is fairly sweet yet extremely complex. Nuts, figs, dates, prunes, oak, whisky. Full body. The taste is medium sweet, rich malty with powerful tart oak wood to balance the sweetness. This ale deserves highest marks.

Piana drobna, kremowa, obfita. Kolor mocnej herbaty, klarowne. W aromacie sporo wanilii, toffi, karmelu, whisky i orzechów laskowych. Smak słodki, generalnie powtórka z zapachu z dominującym toffi, melasą, wanilią i rozgrzewającym bourbonem, w posmakach nutki kakaowe, miodowe i słonawo popcornowe... Niska, tytoniowo herbaciana goryczka, nieduże, drobne nagazowanie, fajnie oleiste, wyklejające i nieco popiołowe w odbiorze.

Jak zwykle beczki po bourbonie to strzał w dziesiątkę - może aromat nie powala intensywnością, za to bardzo przyjemny, dużo wanilii i dębiny za to w smaku. Przydałaby się nieco gęściejsza faktura jak dla mnie...
At the taproom in Grand Rapids. This ale is nice and heavy, take your time and enjoy. Aroma has loads of caramel and bourbon. .
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.
Mooi donker amberkleurig bier met fijne crèmekleurige schuimkraag. Aroma en smaken van pruimen, dadels, eik, bourbon, donker fruit. Fluweelzacht in de mond en perfect in balans. Wat een topper !!
Flaske: Masser af malt og whisky i duften. Smagen sider også lige i skabet. Meget tung maltet i smagen, men masser af friskhed fra alkoholen, fadlagringen og humlen. Super øl.
Mörkbrun ö med beige skum. Intensiv doft av bourbon, söt mörk kola och mjuk kolakaka. Detsamma återkommer i smaken. Sammetslen, mjuk munkänsla. Bättre än en efterrätt / kaka.

35,5cl Bottle @ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
Reddish brown colour with a frothy white head.
Aroma is roasted malt, oats, vanilla, oak, raisins, bourbon.
Taste is malt, raisins, bourbon, vanilla, molasses.
Full body, average carbonation.

Vermelho escuro quase marrom, turva, espuma bege de aspecto cremoso, boa formação e longa persistência.
No aroma Bourbon e madeira antiga, malte, leve caramelado e defumado, complexa.
Paladar de dulçor intenso e médio amargor lupulado muitissimo bem inserido. 
Corpo denso/cremoso, média carbonatação.
Final aumenta a sensação do amadeirado, ameixas e cerejas maduras, Bourbon sempre presente e bem dosado.

Rami Rami is drinking a Backwoods Bastard (2016) by Founders Brewing Co. at Powiśle

Super profil beczki, waniliowo-migdalowy, do tego sporo karmelowo-chlebowych klimatow, bardzo slodkie choc niewiele ciala. klasa. Przy [...]
Rami Rami: [...] czym to jakas dziwna wersja: 11.1%, warka do 04/06/17. Aaa, jeszcze troche kandyzowanych i suszonych owocow jest.
Rami Rami: Migdalow wiecej niz wanilii

Rami Rami: A moze nie :)

Bottle from beer4u, são paulo, brazil. Appearance is light hazy. Color is dark red brown black. Thin beige head. Taste is medium bitter, light to medium sweet. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Aroma and flavour is caramel, bubblegum, chocolate, roasted, chili, vanilla, alcohol, licorice, dark red fruits.

Dark brown pour with medium thick, dense beige head with moderate retention and nice lacing. Notes of whisky, butterscotch, spices (vanilla, cloves), dried prunes, figs. Taste is abundantly malty, but skillfully balanced by the barrel oak, slightly smoked whisky texture and spiciness. Warm, spicy and boozy kick in the aftertaste. Low carbonation, full bodied. An amazing beer.
Fantastic Scotch Ale. Ages very well. Even more interesting after sitting in the cellar for 6 months. Actually, much better than when released. Lets go Founders, I need more!!
12oz bottle, 2015 vintage. Dark caramel brown pour. Nice strong whiskey, chocolate pour. Taste pretty much follows, full bodied, well balanced. Really well done in this style.

(Founders Backwoods Bastard) Bottle 355ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 11.6%
Dark brown colour on the body, almost a full finger of beige head on top, with good density and retention.
Aroma of caramel, dark fruits, bourbon, toasted malts, toffee.
Taste follows, caramel and toffee, red fruits, plenty of bourbon, alcohol.
Medium thick body, soft carbonation.
Nice one.

Bottled. 35cl sample. Enjoyed during the second quarter final battle between Schalke 04 and lucky Ajax. The aroma has vanilla, bourbon, dried fruit, caramel/butterscotch. Clear, copper-brown coloured beer with a thin head. The taste is moderate sweet, light bitter, boozy, has butterscotch and vanilla. Medium bodied beer due to barrel aging. Nice, but for me a bit too much bourbon there.

Bottle 330ml (BB 04.06.2017 11.1 ABV). Brown-red colour with huge, beige head with good lacing. Aroma is great, malty with sweet vanilla and dry wood notes, very good balanced, intense, really nice. Sweet, malty, vanilla at the beginning and dry, wood, alcohol finish plus very gentle spicy note in aftertaste. Really good with oil texture, quite drinkable but warms inside very well. Rather dry than sweet with great aroma, very good taste, Im really surprised because I didnt expect so much but the beer is rich, great balanced and its really top level.

Bottled 9/30/2015, drunk 3/14/17.Pours a clear, dark amber with bright auburn highlights and a good-sized, dark beige head showing moderate retention.Spicy whiskey notes mix with even oak showing light vanilla, sweet maple and toffee as well as lots of pepper. Light on the alcohol and nicely malty yet not overly so/cloying. Not much oxidation, if any, either, which is surprising, given this is 18 months old. Light brown bread, bits of fig and date-like notes, though this is pretty low on the fruitiness/English aspects, overall.In the mouth its nicely attenuated though still provides ample malt texture as well as notes of caramel, toffee, fig, date, vanilla and honey. The barrel adds spicy whiskey, very dry prunes and lots of pepper character which balances the malt character nicely. Low carbonation, fairly engaging with very low alcohol for this high an abv. Some warmth and light esters, but otherwise well-controlled. Good expression/flavor on the barrel-aging and thankfully the beer is pretty well-attenuated.  I think a lot of this has come from letting the beer sit.  Its still a bit devoid of overall personality and retains some alcohol and sharpness (inevitable at this level of abv), as well as being a bit dominant in the barrel character.

Other than Watneys Cream Stout, the best beer Ive ever tasted.
My only problem is that, this year only, some bottles from the same four packs were indifferently blended resulting in a less than perfect experience. I have bought three cases of this each year, a significant outlay of cash. It is that good. Too bad they released a bad batch with the others. Booooo to Founders.
I wasnt expecting such a sweetness off the first sip. This ale is nice and heavy, so careful not to drink it too fast. Caramel sweetness and bourbon notes describe this brew spot on.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2017 Couleur rubis intense, très joli, mousse légèrement colorée. Nez qui sent clairement la bière vieillie en fût, ainsi que la vanille. Très intense en bouche avec des notes de chocolat, de caramel, et de Bourbon, forcément. C?est assez bourrin, assez fat et assez sucré, mais c?est bien bon.

Bottle @ home. Aroma is oaky, vanilla, bourbon, sweet caramel. Clear dark reddish brown with tan head. Taste is moderate sweet and light bitter. Full body, sweet oily feel and sweet oaky bourbon finish.
Awesome, awesome, awesome beer. Beautiful barrel notes, lot of vanilla, coconut. Definitely best scotch ale Ive ever had.

Bottle - Pours a deep ruby brown. Aroma of fermented dark bread and dark fruits... figs, raisins, plums, spices. Flavors of figs, raisins, licorice, maple syrup, HOPS, and a hint of laissez le bon temps rouler.

One of the finest Scotch Ales Ive had. Murky dark brown color that leaves behind a beautiful lacing around the glass and a stickiness on the lips. 
Aroma: Barley, roasted malts, oats, coconut and vanilla. 
The first sip assaults your taste buds with a rich bourbon flavor, that is quickly subsided by waves of dark fruits, vanilla and molasses.
Wee bit on the pricey side (paid $22 for a four pack) but far from disappointed.

Little head. Mild-ish for a dark beer many layers of flavor. Surprisingly sweet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap, @BBF 2017, Barcelona 26/03/17 
Color marron, buenos aromas a bourbon, madera, el sabor es maltoso, seguido de notas dulce, con buenas notas a madera, el alcohol esta bien integrado, cuerpo denso, gran cerveza
Dark brown with creamy head. Aroma has loads of caramel and bourbon. Flavour is sweet with vanilla and malt sugars.
Strong bourbon and caramel notes. Excellent blend of sweet and the boozy bourbon. Finish is very smooth. Exceptional.

Pours dark brown copper with small fluffy light brown head. Aroma is molasses, raisin, nuts, toast. Some resin, some grass. Heavy sweet, medium bitter, salt. Butterscotch, whiskey. Almost syrupy texture, low carbonation, creamy oily finish. A solid Founders beer, too sweet for my taste though.

Bottle shared @Pułapka, Gdańsk
Butterscotch! Very strong and clean taste of butterscotch, vanilla and a bit of nice milky sweetness. Pleasant alcoholic warming in the finish.

335cl bottle from local Alko, Viikki. This effort of brewing in its style reminds me of saying: Dont join an easy crowd. You wont grow. Go where the expectations and the demands to perform and achieve are high. Jim Rohn. Skilfully made brew as always from Founders.

Pours ruby red with nice reflexes and medium head. Aroma: rich aroma of wood, vanilla, dried fruit, bread crust. Taste: woody with nice vanilla, a bit bready and earthy, dried fruit definitely present. Palate is a bit warming from alcohol. Nice sipper.

Taster at Euston tap East. Pours thick brown with tan head. Massive bourbon, molasses and prune aroma. A bit sweet and sickly for me to have drunk a half of it. But big smoky, date and dark fruit taste with dry whisky in the back. Possibly a good example of taking barrel aging too far but its fun.

Bottle 355ml, a dark amber beer with medium copper head. Nose is intense on blond caramel, caramel and vanilla. Aroma is on caramel, toasted caramel, lot of oak notes, smooth body, alcohol well hidden, quite sweet, robust and pleasant scotch ale. Finish on butter caramel, blond caramel and still vanilla / oak notes, medium to low bitterness.

Dark brown with reddish tinge pour and small buttery beige head. Aroma of caramel malts, bourbon, molasses, slight smoke, oak and toffee. Taste of caramel, roasted malts. molasses, toffee, fruits, vanilla, smoke, bourbon and cherries. Full bodied, medium carbonation, chewy syrupy mouthfeel, nicely balanced, delicious and bold!
small bottle @ lions. Barley wine-ish some dust and wine notes, oak and nutty.

Deep ruby-brown body, medium beige head. Aroma of dried plum, dried raisin in rum, caramel, wood, vanilla, alcohol. Flavours of dried fruits, raisin, plum, caramel, molasse (lots if caramelly complexity) wood, vanilla, alcohol fusel, light bitter backbone. Long warm caramely, vanilla finish. Full body, low carbo. I loved it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle poured into a snifter. A dark ruby brown color. Frothy tan head settles to a thick lace. I let this warm a while before I opened it. Aroma is very sweet and slightly off-putting. Texture is soft and smooth. Flavor comes around nicely after a while. Complex dark chocolate malts, sweet cherries and booze. Vanilla and oak. Long earthy-wood spice bittersweet finish.
This is the best beer Ive ever tasted! Super strong and mindblowing taste, leaves me speechless. No more words. This is the one

On draft at State Fare, Houston. Snifter glass. Deep, deep ruby. Creamy head deflated rapidly to thin foam layer. Aroma to me is whiskey, sherry and cherry, Black Forest. Taste is strongly Christmas cake, with flaming brandy alcoholic warmth. Could have stood less carbonation. Dark Caramel finish. Excellent strong Ale.
Bottle. Brown color with off-white head. Aroma has caramel, malt, oak. Taste is malty with long a bit sweet aftertaste. Flavors of oak, malt, dark fruits, raisins and caramel.

Bottle at home (bb 04 june 17). Pours a clear reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma has lots of sweet bourbon, wood, vanilla, caramel, toffee. Taste is over moderate sweet and bitter, aftertaste of more bourbonny alcohol, wood and vanilla goodness. Full mouthfeel and lots of warming alcohol. Very nice.

Ich rieche Whiskey, Melasse und Holz. Gaul!! Und hart am Limit. Knospenspalter der harten "Komm jetzt endlich an den Kamin und rauch mit mir ne Zigarre" Fraktion. Ungestüm fordernd und kratzig alkoholisch. Das alles auf höchsten Toffee/Lakritz und HarzhopIBU Niveau. Kantig und doch so unfassbar ausgewogen. Das kriegen nur die Amis hin. 355ml for Life. 5,5. CBS HH. Fläschgen.

Red brown medium bodied beer. Contains oak, whiskey, a bit of smoke, sweet fruits and red fruits, caramel, a bit of roast and coffee. Sweet at the start, bitter in the finish. not highly complex but well balanced and very enjoyable. Drink it slowly to enjoy all the flavors.

Oud flesje.
Fenomenaal aroma met massas bourbon. In de smaak noten, kruiden, hout en een zekere scherpte van rode vrucht. Mondgevoel beetje vet.
355ml bottle. Pours dark brown with tanned head. Bourbon, oak, vanilla and malts. Bit boozy, sweet. Really good.

thanks sinH4, a stunning beer to look at and marvel its appearance. Very true to the style as Founders so often does. Sweet burbon nose, lots of vanilla embedded into some damp-basement smell that I often get from Scotch Ales. No burnt aromas whatsoever. Overall pretty perfect.
Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Pours clear dark ruby. Aroma is strong barrel and booze, vanilla. Body is heavy, strongly boozy, also sweet, barrel. One dimensional, but does exactly what it wants. Good.

butelka. brązowe, z rubinowymi refleksami, beżowa, żołtawa drobnopęcherzykowa piana, utrzymująca się do końca picia w postaci niewielkiego krążka. aromat zdominowany przez wpływ beczki - drewno, vanilia, miód, po ogrzaniu również rodzynki, szlachetny alkohol. w smaku pełne, nisko nasycone, wytrawne, z niewielką słodką kontrą, alkohol doskonale ułożony i zakamuflowany, przyjemnie rozgrzewający przełyk.

Elegáns, mély tartalmat előrevetítő küllem, sejtelmesen sötét réz szín, tört fehér, röpke habkarikával. A sokat ígérő jelleg illatai által is felerősödik, ekkor ugyanis krémes állagú karamella, mogyorós színezetű édesség, ázott fahordó érett, nemes aromákat megfogalmazó karaktere tölti be a teret, s ízében remekül visszaköszönnek majd ezek az elemek. Szerkezete telt, ám visszafogottan édes jegyek szövete, a karamellesen malátás bevezető után a bourbon vaníliás, kókuszos hangulata rajzolódik ki, ez adja a zamatát a kortyoknak is, majd a kompozíció egy erőteljes, közepesen száraz levezetéssel, s számottevő kesernyés játékkal zárul. Az alkohol eközben az ital stílusához mért eleganciával, de jól kivehető módon munkálkodik, felerősítve az ízjegyek intenzitását. Feltehetően az egyik legjobb scotch ale került most kipipálásra.
Rich caramel and super smooth bourbon and oak aromas and flavors. Definitely an enjoyable supper by the fire on the chillier nights. Founders best beer beside their breakfast stout.

Warm, complex and a phenomenal variety of malts, sweetness, smoke, and wood, without any of those notes overwhelming. I only had a taster but even from that small sample this was a brew meant to be sipped and savored. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home. Pours really dark amber with a tiny beige head. Aroma is strong dried fruits, caramel, whiskey and cherries in a quite nice balance. Taste is really smooth smoky oak, dried fruits, malt whiskey and caramel. Really nice and warming beer.
Draft from HopCat into a mini-snifter. Aroma of caramel, bourbon, and cherries.

Bottle from Hopt.nl, 11.1% ABV BB 04/06/17, 35 cl sample. Clear dark copper color, medium frothy head. Aroma of lots of cookie and vanilla from bourbon whisky, some caramel and toffee maltiness and slight dark red fruit to finish it off. Full bodied. Quite some sweetness, mixing in toffee, vanilla and butterscotch cookie. Smooth, soft carbonation, wonderful complexity. Barrel aging done to perfection.

Best beer Ive ever tasted and had!!
I would really like to know where I can buy Backwwods Bastard.
Draft. Pours dark with a reddish tent. The palate is juicy and wet. Not what I was expecting. The taste is big bourbon. Malty sweetness of the scotch ale. Decent beer

Bottle. Dark mahogny ruby in color with a tan head. Sweetness, bourbon and vanilla in aroma. Heavy and nice. Very smooth mouthfeel. Ripe dark fruits, raisins and plums, some bourbon vinous notes too in taste. Some malty notes and mild, almost burnt barrel-y vibes later on. Bit on the sweeter side, but drinkable still. A sipper.

Tap. Pours dark reddish amber with beige head. Aroma has malt, biscuit, caramel, prune, raisins and a hint of mold. Taste is complex malty with biscuit, caramel, mold, dried fruits, raisins and vanilla notes. Finish is complex and sweet and dry in balance.

Clear dark amber pour with a thin tan head. Notes of bourbon, dried fruit, caramel, toffee, prunes, raisins, dried apricots, vanilla and a bit of scotch. Smooth texture, full body, low carbonation and a bitter-sweet finish. A very well-made scotch ale.

Pours brown with a ruby tinge. The finger thick head is deliciously creamy and only very slowly subsides. The aroma promises bourbon, and lots of it, but there are also hints of dark chocolate and caramel. Taste is bourbon, oak, and kind of bittersweet in a very alcoholic way. Finishes warm with a strong whiskey aftertaste. Not so fond of the palate, which was oily but at the same time rather thin and empty. Very alcoholic. I think Ive left the ground now. If you want to get drunk, this is the way to do it with class.

Brown, small but steady head. Aroma: caramel, toffee, coconut, vanilla, oranges, bread. Medium to light body, heavy to medium sweetness. Surprisingly lack of body, its almost watery. Sweet malty body, in flavour again great barrel notes. Very noticeable alcohol.
Bottle pour at home, got this before they made it over here. Black carmal pour. Thin head, aroma bourbon and sweet, thick body little sweet carmal miled rosted coffee with oak.

This is awesome! Dark brown, small cream head, sticky lacing. Beautiful aroma of whisky, caramel, vanilla and wood. Taste is very warm and moderately boozy besides the 11.6%. Ripe fruits, whisky, oak, caramel, molasses, cherries. Full body, mostly sweet with some bitter in the finish. Fantastic ale!

2016 version. Dark brown with a tinge of ruby. Moderate tan head that recedes quickly. Excellent aroma of bourbon and dark fruit. Moderate to thick mouth feel, little carbonation. Mild bittering and very nice fruity taste, with the outstanding bourbon taste at the forefront. Very, very nice, indeed. Little bittering, but what there is shows up in the finish. No alcohol warmth despite the 11+% ABV. Very smooth. Outstanding beer, Founders.

Mahogany brown colour with beige nice head on top. Beautiful beer. Aroma has caramel malts, toffee, Bourbon, oak. Taste has Bourbon notes, oak barrel, caramel malts, toffee, bitter ending with pines and grass hops. Some alcohol comes up in the after taste. Full body and medium carbonation. Exceptional beer.

Aroma is of tons of bourbon and sticking toffee/ fruit pudding. Nice dark fruits in the background. Flavor has tons of bourbon that pairs seamlessly with fig and plum. Finishes slightly tannic with mild warming. Hides the high abv really well.

Bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. Pours dark brown with a little head. The aroma features rich and ripe dark fruitiness, sweet maltiness and a wooden, vanilla-themed touch indicating aging. Taste is medium sweet, richly malty with pronounced touches of yeast and fruits. Flavours of ripe fruitiness - especially raisin - toffee, vanilla and caramel. The palate is medium to full bodied, smooth and low in carbonation. Rich in flavour but also very balanced, warming but still drinkable; high abv does not affect the flavours.

Pours fantastic deep amber mahogany colour with beige frothy head. Aroma of bourbon soaked oak, very powerful, caramel, toffee, booze, so sweet. Flavour is caramel malts, soaked raisins, wood, booze and bourbon for days. As it warms a little bit it lacks of something, so better to drink it quite cold. Full body with almost oily texture. Sweet and semi-dry finish. Love this stuff!

355 ml bottle at abv 11.1% bought at HK Brewcraft in central.
Looks: Clear, deep burgundy colour; Less than one-quarter finger head with residual soapy light beige foam which fades in 15 seconds; Very good sticky lacing with near zero carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant and intense Bourbon which can be smelt as soon as it was popped, with dark malt, strong vanilla, strong oak barrel, liquorices, strong caramel and toffee, steamed crab meat, strong roasted barley, dark fruits, light butter scotch, strong brown sugar and light grass. Wow! 

Taste: Strong sweet full dark malt, with strong roastyness, strong smooth vanilla, Bourbon, strong liquorices, strong caramel, toffee, strong oak barrel, dark fruits, floral, sugar, strong spices, biscuits, lemon, strong bitter hops and grass. Excellent!

Body: Full body. Very slick and oily palate.

Mouth Feel: Full dark malt in a thick and quite oily background. Fine oak barrels with incredibly silky vanilla, strong but nice Bourbon with sharp liquorices, complemented by good roastyness, strong caramel, dark fruits, floral and strong spices. Sugary but balanced the strong booze pretty well. Biscuity with strong lemon to round. Complex and nice!

Alcohol: the 11% booze seems daunting with that sake-like stream crab aroma. It still means business in taste but the hard liquor element is somewhat mellowed by smooth vanilla to grind out any harshness. Great stuff! 

Hoppiness: Light grass in nose. Floral, strong spices, lemon and grass in taste; Bitterness - liquorices and hops - is strong and shrap for a lasting, high astringent sweet boozy malty finish.

After taste: Fairly dry. Sweet bitter and very boozy to mouth.

Comments: A powered-up version of Dirty Bastard, this ones barrels enhance the Ale with smooth, lively vanilla and tasty oaks. Bourbon is assertive but not as overbearing as most barreled Ales. Fruity, spicy and malty at all fronts, a great sipper for cold winter nights. Cheers!

Rubyish brown, big beige frothy head, ok lacing. Great aroma, whisky on top, caramel, mocca. Really inviting. Full, rich and smooth, sweet, packed with flavor. I hvae trouble defining the nuances here but this tastes really good to me. Glad it has a long long finish. Port wine was noticed before so I add it here..makes lot of nice combos that one. Damn good stuff.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with red notes and with tan head. Aroma and taste have malts, licorice, dark fruits, raisins, caramel, bourbon and also some notes of oak and vanilla. Nicely sweet, bitter and also boozy, but definitely not too much. Incredible beer!

Bottled. Served in a red wine glass. Almost black body with slight red notes. Thick and even light brown head. The aroma is thick with melasses, alcohol, scotch, smoke and raisins. The taste is overwhelming with some initial sourness which dissolves into notes of port wine, whisky, oak and a lovely bitter finish. Thick body, no alcohol in the taste itself. Beautiful.
On tap. Pours a very dark mahogany/brown with light head. Aromas of sugary sweet malts and bourbon. Flavors of buttery oaky bourbon, dry dark fruit, candy sugar, and toasty sweet malts.
0,355l bottle from Alko. Pours dark ruby color with good amount of head. Aroma of heavy malts, strong sweetness and caramel, dark fruits, bourbon. Warm malty, sweet and alcoholy taste, thick body.

Appearance: Somewhat Hazy Red Brown. Thin ring of white tiny bubbles.
Nose: Sweet caramel, bourbon, booze, vanilla and oak.
Taste: Sweet malt, caramel, bourbon and molassess
Body: medium to fuller, a touch viscous
Parting thoughts: A very nice bourbon bomb showing off the best that aging in barrels can achieve. excellent
Black color with creamy brown head. Smell of sweet caramels, lots of oak, and bourbon. Taste of dried fruits, mixed with malts, vanilla and lots of bourbon. Very rich and tasty beer from founders

Bottle. Sensoric. Brown with moderate, semi-thick, dirty white head. Poor to moderate head retention and moderate lacing. Moderate malty aroma, caramel, milky, lightly smokey (wood). The barrel notes are quite noticeable, but bourbon is due to specific scotch ale malty profile is not really up front. Taste is moderately sweet and light to moderately bitter. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation, finish is malty, light to moderate ABV. Lightly ABV warming. In summery good brew pretending to be very good, but IMO it should age for a little bit more to be very good. The ABV warming is above average here.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
On tap at Elizabeth Station. Pours an almost opaque copper with a tan head. Aroma is bourbon, dark fruits. Taste is sweet, similar to aroma, very smooth. Creamy aftertaste. Wow, amazing!
Draft at the Casual Pint, Omaha. Poured dark amber with an off white head. Aroma was malt, light roast, booze . Taste was malty, caramel, light smoke, alcohol.
Rich caramel and super smooth bourbon and oak aromas and flavors. Definitely an enjoyable supper by the fire on the chillier nights. Founders best beer beside their breakfast stout.
caramel, toffee, bourbon, sweetness, like this better as it ages each year
355ml bottle. Dark ruby thin white head. Aroma has black currant, toffee and alcohol. Taste has more toffee with whisky. Very well balanced and awesome beer indeed.

A very dark brown beer with notes of red. A head is quite small and beige. Aroma has riped and rich fruitness with raisins and dates, some dark breadyness, less barrel, bourbon and chocolate. Taste has riped and dried fruitness, raisins, richness of malts, nice vanilla, some chocolate and strenght of bourbon in the end. Almost full bodied, not stickyness, nice and easy to drink. Complex and at the same time also balanced, just so greatly as the Founders can do it. The great and powerful beer.

Bottle in Seattle. Thanks to Chris! Sorry/happy to say that we can get this in Seattle as of yesterday. Thin, dissipating ring head. Darkest malty amber, dark brown. Gorgeous red depths. Deep roasty nose, plenty of sweet barrel too. Smooth weight. Bourbon-scotch richness. Lovely depths of flavor. Vanilla edge, raisins, strong cookies, lovely flavor. A small burn from the alcohol. Smooth and tasty. Nice beer.

Bottle from Alko. Dark brown color, beige head. Bittersweet taste with toffee, malts, caramel, nuts, oak, ripe fruits, raisins, spices and bourbon. Bittersweet finish with toffee, malts, caramel, oak, raisins, bourbon and a bit whisky. Exquisite scotch ale.

A 355ml bottle with a best by date of 6th April 2017. Poured into a snifter glass. It poured a clear deep amber brown colour with a one finger tanned head that had decent retention and left nice spotty lacing. Aromas of caramel, toffee, vanilla, oak, bourbon and booze with perhaps a hint of sweet dark fruit. Taste is what you expect from the aroma with sweet melted caramel, toffee, vanilla, raisins, oak and bourbon with a light nuttiness on the finish. Creamy, full bodied with low carbonation. Alcohol is well hidden yet there is a nice lasting alcohol warmth. Overall, just great! A really nice sipper with wonderful aromas and great taste.
Big flavors of scotch and bourbon with an oak sweetness. Roasty and a hint of dark fruit tartness. Nice dark caramel color. Aromas were molasses and booze. Weighty and smooth.

Pours a clear light brown. Nosebis very smoky - can get the alcohol on the smell. Taste is really boozy - some bourbon, and it has a chewiness to it. It's good - but I cannot seeing having more than one in a sitting.



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Not my style of beer, but interesting. Pours with a thin head, a dark caramel with a bit of haze. Intense aromas of caramel, chocolate, coffee, licorice and soy sauce. On the palate smooth and round- big, unctuous and fat. Mouth filling. Alcoholic for sure. Although aged in bourbon barrels, I am failing to find the oak/bourbon axis here although with a stretch I get a little smoke on the nose.
Dark brown ruby of color with a beige head. An aroma of prunes, sweets, candy and no hops. A flavor prunes, sweets, candy and malty
UPDATED: MAY 9, 2017 Very good to excellent beer. However be careful... very high alcohol, without the boozy taste. Its extremely smooth and goes down easy.
355ml bottle from House of Belgium, Xiamen. Pours dark ruby with an off white head. Aroma of vanilla and whisky with dried fruit. Sweet taste. 8

Bottle. Pours a dark ruby red with a lasting thin lacy light brown head. Aroma is of bourbon, vanilla, toffee, plum. Taste is of vanilla, toffee, dark fruits, plums, brown sugar. Sticky oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.
Scotch ale envejecida en baricas de bourbon, alcohol muy bien integrado, una cerveza espectacular.

Home. Bottle shared with big ups to Maakun. Clear cola brown with light tan head. Big bourbon notes. Butterscotch, barley and caramel. Light cherry fruity, some pine, hazelnut and big vanilla allover. Big sweet and light bitter. Over medium body, creamy and smooth. Nut cream. Nut butter. Just some random words that come to mind. Theres hoppiness in the finish, which is just perfect. Very nice surprise.

Bottle shared. Almost clear deep mahogany with creamy beige head that leaves a thick film. Looks nice. Lots of bourbon, toffee, vanilla, caramel, fudge, sweet malts, light milk chocolate and alcohol. Theres some dried apple and stone fruits in the background, and some bitter herbs with the alcohol, but mostly its strong malt and bourbon notes. Full bodied. Nice!

Une bière brune, plutôt claire, avec une bonne effervescence, et peu de carbonatation. Au nez, sucre dorge et épices, classique dune scotch ale. En bouche, les saveurs diffèrent beaucoup de lodorat, avec un gros goût dalcool et de sirop dérable. Le caramel est également assez présent, ce qui donne une bière fort sucrée, et fort alcoolisée. Le corps est un tout petit peu mince, faisant une bière qui est bien faite, certes, mais qui manque dun petit quelque chose.
Nice flavore, exelent taste. Perfect example of style. Alcohole very goode hide.

Total Wine & More, St Petersburg. Somewhere between cola brown and mahogany. Clear with a little bit of whitish head. Chestnuts, peaty whisk(e)y, and a touch of sweet spice. Not impressive, but the taste is nigh on incredible: sweet, strong, bourbon-laden yet gentle. Two of my beefs with BA beers are the lack of balance (beers that taste only of whiskey, sherry, etc) and the extremely strong boozy feel. This has neither of these properties. Well-balanced and delicious.

Bottle. Lots of white oak - coconut, vanilla, malts, dried fruit, light caramel, light esters. Nice aroma with a flavour that disappoints. Lots of barrel notes but unfortunately also a lot of astringency, with the alcohol being out of bounds in this one. Gets a bit better after it warms up but remains very disappointing.

Dark, cola like colour, some tan lacing. Bready aroma, some smoke and malts. Rich flavours, caramel, cherries, roasted malts, light bitterness. Above medium body, smooth and light carbonation, oily mouthfeel. Very good.
Provada al Club de Cata Olut Sabadell Una Scotch Ale molt bona però alcohòlica
On Tap, this beer shows us how to make a drinkable bourbon, full flavor and aroma, wood and only 11,6%, the beast.l

2016 bottle. Pours a clear dark toffee, almost black with a quickly shrinking beige head that has fair lacing. Aroma is bourbon, oak, vanilla, lots of malts, and hints of scotch. Taste is oak, bourbon, vanilla, sticky smokey malts, toffee, and caramel. Somewhat thick and sticky with a lingering mild sweetness.

Beautiful pour, dark mahogany, thick but wispy beige head. Aroma of chocolate covered cherry, oak, a little chat. Full bodied, a tad oily and slick. Chocolate, caramel, booze, whiskey, dark ripened fruits.. Very rich and a great take on the style.
A typical Scottish style, the taste of the barrel, a lot of alcohol and oil.

12oz bottle - pours very dark and thick with a medium greyish tan head. Big chewey aroma of molasses, dates, smoke, licorice, cola and some brandy. A lot going on in a mouthful - caramel, bourbon, molasses, vanilla, oak, a hint of smoke and booziness.

12 ounce bottle from The Davis Beer Shoppe. Bottled 10/06/2015. The aroma on this is nice with some vanilla and charred bourbon character. There might be a little peat or smoke present, as well. Transparent garnet-amber body with a small, quickly dissipating yellow-orange head. Starts with a bit of a caramel character, before some vanilla and woody bourbon notes come through fairly strong in the middle. Finishes with a bit of a maple character, before a warming woodiness comes through. This was good, but a little rough around the edges. I wanted to like this more.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2017 This beer is amazing, its got a lovely amount of booziness to it, but only adds a nice flavor to the sweet caramel malt. There is a fair amount of roasted malt, and perhaps a hint of maple. The dark cherry notes come when the beer hits the back of your mouth and lingers in the after finish. Overall, sipping this beer for a nice night in with maybe rain drizzling or snow falling, very pleasant.

12oz bottle to tulip. Pours clear dark mahogany, beige sticky head. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, candied pecan, brown sugar, raisin, pancake batter. Taste of same with creamy oak and booze. So smooth!.
On tap at Pinocchios. Dark chestnut color, nice lacing. Bourbon aroma. Peaty, caramel, roast and a nice sweet bourbon finish. Very nice.
Tap @Fox, Sønderborg. Clear brown, small light beige head. Aroma has bourbon-like notes, vanilla. Sweet flavour, dark sugar, warming booze. Fruit and barrel notes and dark caramel. Very nice.

Pours an amber/brown color with a sweet scotch/bourbon aroma. Taste is boozy, with a vanilla, and spice flavor. Sweet caramel and dark cherry flavor as advertised. A nice sipping beer that finishes dry and with an alcohol burn.
шикарны& скотч, аромат насыщен& вкус первона& довольн& нежный, но потом...сm

Dark amber with low off white head - Heavy barrel aroma with bourbon and vanilla - Good malt body with a sweet barrel, vanilla flavour with bourbon and some nice heat from alcohol in the back - The sweet vanilla , bourbon and wood flavours goes into a long finish - This was real good
Club de Cata Olut, botella. Espectacular. Ale tostada con aroma a bourbon, alcohólica.

the aroma: caramel, vanilla, toffee, coconut, scotch, dried berries with some oak and spicy shades... the taste: caramel and roasted malt, scotch, toffee, vanilla, garden berries, brown chocolate and some spices... sweet, dry and warming aftertaste... excellent one...

Tap; pours clear amber with a white head; aroma caramel, scotch, roast malt with some oak and vanilla hints; taste is sweet with caramel, vanilla, scotch, and roast malts; finish is dry and boozy; very nice beer

Color is dark granet, its almost opaque. Foam is white and inconsistent. Intense and amazing aroma, which is roasted malts, sugars, dark fruits, cinnamon and liquor. Also some smoke notes are present. Taste is great, a good mix of sweet and bitter. Full body, pretty dense, low carbonation, oily texture. Overall, an excellent ale.

Pours black and translucent amber with a two finger head, with a nose of caramel and malt. Tastes of caramel, malt, bourbon/whiskey with alcohol upfront per 11.2% ABV with a sweet, very mild bitter finish.

Type: 12-oz. bottle
Glass: AleSmith Barrel-Aged Reserve snifter glass 
From: Bine & Vine Bottles Sop in Normal Heights (San Diego), Calif.
Price: $14.99 for a 4-pack
Purchased: Oct. 25, 2016 
Consumed: Oct. 30, 2016
Reviewed as: Scotch / Wee Heavy
Misc.: 2016 release; Bottled Sept. 22, 2016 at 5:56 p.m. ET

Had been wanting to try this one for a long time. Finally saw it in stores for the first time at Bine & Vine. Wanted to get just a 12-oz. bottle, but they only had them in 4-packs. Ended up pulling the trigger for $14.99, picking up the last one. The label says it all - Scotch-Style Aged in Oak Bourbon Barrels.

Poured a dark brown-to-light-black color with two fingers of khaki-tan frothy head. A few bubble streams coming up at various points on the glass. World-class spiderweb foamy lacing. Excellent retention. (Sight - 4.50)

Smelled a mix of boozy bourbon and deep oaky notes. Wow, very appealing. Digging deeper got vanilla, caramel, toffee, leathery tobacco, raisins, dates, oak chips, cocoa, sticky dark fruits and Whoppers candy. Cooled down on the nose as it went down. Really had me wanting to try it. (Smell - 4.50) 

Tasted very similar to the nose, but maybe not quite as good. Getting woody oak chips, smooth bourbon, subdued vanilla, raisins, dates, some earthy tobacco, cocoa, bitter dark chocolate, roasty malts, more dark fruits (plum?), caramel malts, touch of brown sugar, still getting Whoppers candy, maybe the malted chocolate, and toasted toffee. Wow, feeling that 11.2 pct. warming down my stomach. This is wonderful. (Taste - 4.25)

Full body. Creamy-to-sticky texture. Average carbonation. Long, warming finish. (Feel - 4.50)

This was just awesome. Even better than I thought it was going to be. (Overall - 4.50)

4.40 98 A
light malt and bourbon aromas. color is dark red/black with thin brown head. taste is initially of roasted malts followed by strong oak/bourbon flavors. slight hints of vanilla.

Founders Backwoods Bastard has a thin, khaki head, a red-amber-brown appearance, some bubbles, and a bit of spider web lacing left on the glass. The aroma is of oak, vanilla, liquor, and grain. Taste is of those elements, along with dried fruit and noticeable, balancing hop bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium, and Backwoods Bastard finishes semi-dry. RJT

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2016 Bottle from Specs in Corpus Christi. Dark clear reddish brown with a creamy cream colored head. Aroma of raisins, toast, caramel, a hint of red wine, and whisky barrel. Tastes lightly sweet and boozy, woody, and a touch bitter. Medium-full bodied and a tiny bit dry.

12 oz bottle from Hawthorne Cellars. Pours ruby red with small to medium tan head. Boozey, slightly sweet aroma. Flavours are toasted/smoked malt, cherries, and maybe caramel. Barrel aging is perfect and has completely merged with the base beer. Very well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Damn good. A Scottish-Christmas hug. Yum. Nose is a wonderful tease, and the taste delivers. Caramel, booze, oak. Excellence.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2017 Bottle, Vintage 2014. Reddish amber color, with ruby highlight and a with beige head. Aroma is raisins, chocolate, figs, booze. Taste is more raisins, sirupy, sweetish booze, warming finish. Fine-bubbled, low-to-medium carbonation. Very nice Barleywine!
Bottle. Dark golden brown, dark brown lace. Soy sauce nose. Full body, dry nutty, spy salty, spices.

Dark brown with little beige head. Aroma is vanilla, oak, dark chocolate, dried fruit. Taste is intense sweetness and dark chocolate bitterness. Oily, not much carbonation, complex, some spicyness while swallowing. Boomtown!

(bottle) hazy deep ruby-amber colour with a frothy beige head. aroma of brown sugar, gently peated malts and marzipan, with lots of caramel, cherry schnaps and hazelnuts. flavour is more of the same, brown sugar, caramel and nougat, with lots of ethanol, some treacle and some furnace smoke in the semi-dry finish. heavy-bodied with soft carbonation.

Draft @AllInBeerFesttival2016 APPEARANCE: clear amber with a off-white head. NOSE: strong aroma of bourbon, wood, caramel, fudge, brown sugar. TASTE: very sweet, long and moderately bitter aftertaste. Well hidden alcohol. MOUTH: full body, with a smoth texture. Earlier Rating: 11/5/2016 Total Score: 4.4Draft @AllInBeerFesttival2016
APPEARANCE: clear amber with a off-white head. NOSE: strong aroma of bourbon, wood, caramel, fudge, brown sugar. TASTE: very sweet, long and moderately bitter aftertaste. Well hidden alcohol. MOUTH: full body, with a smoth texture.

Bottle from Whole Foods Market Fair Lakes (VA)
Aroma: oak, vanilla, caramel, earthy, bourbon
Appearance: black with a tan head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Perfect

On tap at Crunchys. Beautiful dark pour. Vanilla and bourbon with maltybsweetness 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from World Beer Market. Pours a dark reddish-brown, low light tan head, lacing. Forward bourbon aroma, oaky, nice blend of vanilla and dark fruit. Let it warm, and the oak and malt flavour really shines, a touch of caramel sweetness, plum. Smooth full body, booze from front to back, but no acridity, silky and warming. Very nice.
Rich and boozy. So good. Aroma is great, burbon with malt. Taste is top notch, more bourbon with a rich malty backbone. Will get again. Cant wait.
Growler from ODarbys. Aroma of bourbon, malt and oak. Dirty mahogany with lacing. Tasting bourbon, malt, vanilla, booze, oak, spice, banana. Great drinkability - as long as you sip. Good stuff..
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Bottle from Brewcraft at home. Translucent deep dark cherry amber pour with off white head. Aroma is huge warm vanilla oak booze, some ginger snap biscuit. Nice. Taste is rich warm caramel biscuit with sharp hoppy boozy bite and lasting warmth. Deliciously rich but finely carbonated palate. Not a huge scotch ale fan, but this is really good.
bottle poured a hazy brown with a light brown head that diminished slowly with good lacing. caramel aroma. Flavors of carmel, vanilla, bourbon, sweet malt and a hint of chocolate medium to full body.

Fat på All In Beer Fest, Göteborg. Mörkbrun, lite kastanj och mahogny, litet beiget skum. Bourbon i doften med både lite råg- och sötsyrlighet jämte en annars stor maltsötma med torkad frukt, kola, russin, toffee. Samma i smak; stor maltsötma och bourbon jämte en del rågsyrliga inslag. Fin fatkaraktär. Riktigt tjusig öl. Bör dock tjäna på att lagras några år.

Appearance: Bottled 3/10-2016. Dark redish brown. Some creamy tan head.
Aroma: Wood, barrel, dark malt, prunes?
Taste: Strong barrel flavour, dark malt. Some sweetness. Barrel a bit overpowering.
Bought: Total Wine & More (Sterling), 355 ml, $3.99
Info: 6/11-2016

Dark, dark brown in color (near black) with a thin cream-colored head that leaves a lot of lace. Its got a caramel & dark fruit party going on in the nose; oaky barrel notes & tiny bit of alcohol behind that. Taste is similarly sweet with caramel & dark fruit combo upon arrival (raisins, black grapes, candied cherries, figs). Solid malt middle with some earthy, soft smoky, and spicy notes to make the flavors close to a fruit pastry. Finishes with a balanced showing off its boozy strength and bourbon barrel characters (vanilla & roasted nuts). The end notes stand out over time. Smooth texture & a heavy body; no carbonation, dry finish, & astringent with booze after it warms up. Complex and delicious, one of the best to come out of Founders for sure. Initially everything balanced out really well in this vinous brew, but the booze became a bit distracting towards the very end.

On tap at Skúli - Craft Bar in Iceland. Brown reddish color, not much head. Nose is sweet notes of caramel, wood. Mindblowing taste, well balanced wooden whisky taste, great warm at the end in the throat. Bitter, sweet very very good!

Bottle-2016 vintage; enjoyed from a tulip snifter. Appearance: dark black/brown ale, thin head. Aroma: caramel, bourbon. Taste: sweet caramel, nice bourbon undertones. I prefer this ale fresh as I had a cellar-aged 2012 vintage earlier this year --too sweet & boozy. The fresh vintage was definitely more balanced for me.

Dates, toffee, bourbon. Dark brown/purple with a lot of sediment. Medium tan thinnish foamy head. Not a lot of residue on the glass but a bubbly film on top of the beer. Sweet. Syrupy soft mouthfeel. Full bodied. Toffee. Vanilla. Dates. Other dark fruit. Smooth. A hint of earth. A hint of bourbon and a nice ester warmth on the finish. Fantastic.

Pours a very dark red/brown, half inch of meringue-like tan/brown foam, just beautiful. Aroma is malty and bready. Flavor is sweet and malty, some chocolate and vanilla, maybe fruits like dates and raisins, then the bourbon hits with a bit of an alcohol burn. This is just lovely.

12 oz bottle pours a dark brown color with a nice white head. Aromas of bourbon, caramel, roasted malt. Full bodied a great beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

My contribution to the share is severely underwhelming. However this beer is awesome and i love it. Aroma is malty, maple, and bourbon. Flavor is rich sweet malt and maple, a bit of almost nuttyness. Love this beer.

12oz bottle poured at home - bottled about 3 weeks ago.

Definitely can smell and taste the bourbon - a very good scotch ale.

Worthy of the rankings.
Отличны& напиток, сильный приятны& винно висково бренди бурбонн& аромат :), мощный вкус с горечью, карамел& во вкусе, согрева& продолж& послевк& Срок годност& до 04.01.18. (Bottle 0,355/ 11,6%)

Aroma: bourbon, vanilla, woody, scotch malt.
Appearance: clear amber color and creamy head.
Taste: low bitterness, woody, vanilla, melanoidins, rough alcohol, semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, vanilla, finish.
Overall: Decent beer, rough alcohol, should wait a little bit longer.

Wow, epic...
Nice bottle with a cool label, clear red-brown beer with a short beige head, smell is after oak bourbon barrels, light sweet, flat carbonation, good drinkability, you can not feel the alcohol, in total I need more from this
(I have 0.355l bottle with best-before 04.06.2017)

Bottle from Stone in Asagaya. Pours a pretty, chestnut brown with a finger of foam. Lots of cacao, caramel, and a touch of peated whisky and vanilla. Easy drinking on the palate. Very smooth with a touch of oaky bourbon, almost silky on the palate. Nice coating finish that lingers. Not overly sweet with a lingering bourbon character. Awesome.
Pour is a very beautiful mahogany color with a tan head. Aroma is full of caramel, vanilla, toffee, some slight cocoa. Taste is bourbon, vanilla, caramel, oak. Lovely beer.
I really enjoyed it. Mahogany color, head disapating quickly, ton of barrel , oak, scotch, vanilla.. Touch of milk chocolate... 11.2 abv.. Bottled 9/29/16,, Bevmo San Jose, $20.00 a 4 pac.

Pours deep mahogany with nice lacy head, a really pretty beer. Aroma is straight bourbon - vanilla, charred oakiness, maple syrup, raisins, caramel. Flavors are another bourbon punch of vanilla, smokiness, sweet malt, and a little bitterness to round out the finish. A really nice sipper.

12 oz. bottle. Bottle dated 10/8/10, originally reviewed 10/24/2011.

Its got nearly no head and a dark brown body with flecks of ruby. A few bubbles and a ring around the surface show the only signs of life.

Smells of Bourbon and lots of it. When its cold, it only smells of bourbon and charred oak. As it warms, it smells significantly better. The malt character comes through as caramel and burnt sugar. 

Bourbon and oak again in the flavor. Bitterness, too. Maybe from the oak or maybe from the hops, not sure. Again, the malt profile doesnt shine until it warms. When it does, its a lot of rich sugars. Not complex, but good.

Hot for sure. You taste all of the 10.2%. The carbonation keeps it from being syrupy. Still slow drinking from the booze.

Its barrel-aged sugar. Apparently, back in 2011, I still liked barrel aged sugar.

11.1%ABV. Strong ale.

Poured out brown, black. 26ºSRM.

Nose has molasses, nuttiness suggesting pecans and raw brazil nuts, toasted almonds. Scents of vanilla and marzipan and toasted coconut.

Mouthfeel is syrupy. Palate has a collage of dessert flavors: toasted coconut, vanilla sauce, macaroons, dark chocolate, sweet coffee, cafe au lait. The front of the palate is full and broad with sweet, bready, and light salt, almost like a caramel seasalt chessecake.

Finish is woody bitter and a little lingering.

Goes on Favorites List!

Pours dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is rich with fruit notes, raisin, barrels, strong wooden, old boat, rum, fruits, light smoke, cream, old furniture. Taste is also very rich, soft, creamy, old barrels, raisin, rum, dried fruits, creamy pie, chocolate cake, old wood, overriped berries, sweetness, bitter. It is too good to describe that. Enormously good beer!

De la micro cervecera Founders(USA) esta Strong Scotch Ale o Wee Heavy envejecida en barricas de Bourbon de nombre Backwoods Bastard con 11.6% ABV y 50 IBUs de amargor, ligeramente pasada de alcohol ya que el estándar que marca el Beer Judge Certification Program(BJCP) es de 6.5% a 10% de alcohol, siempre muy generosos los Brewmaster de la cervecería de Grand Rapids, Michigan en la potencia etílica, en Ratebeer esta cerveza tiene una calificación en estilo de 100/100 y en general tambien 100/100, veamos por que tiene calificación perfecta.
http://www.ratebeer.com/beer/founders-b aspecto es una cerveza de corona de espuma mediana, color crema, perlas de tamaño compacto y mediana retención, carbonatación escasa, el liquido es un cobrizo rojizo profundo con destellos mas claros en color rojizo, turbiedad considerable y cuerpo pleno.
En aroma la lista de las notas que desarrolla es la siguiente; puedo detectar aroma a grano, ligeramente tostada, galletas, dulzor de caramelo, notas a pasas y nuez, olor un poco terroso, muy rica en olfato y enfocada hacia la variedad de maltas, el aroma es intenso y tambien licorosa, hay nula presencia de el lúpulo.
El sabor es fuerte y persistente, abre con una buena cantidad de dulzor que es equilibrado con ligeros toques tostados y carácter ahumado, un amargor tambien tímido ayuda a acabar de balancear la malta, a lo largo del trago se puede percibir granos de cereal, caramelo, galletas o corteza de pan con tintes tostados, frutos secos difíciles de identificar; detecto principalmente nuez y pasas, humo, amaderada, el nivel etílico aporta mucho al sabor dando tibieza en garganta y formando parte del carácter general del trago, muy buena Founders a sido de las mejores cervezas que e probado, no escatiman en potencia de sus sabores, no dudan en agregar el alcohol que ellos quieren y dotan a sus productos de carácter propio que los hace altamente identificables.

Bottle. Pours dark mahogany with thin head. Aroma is sweet malty bourbon. Taste is sweet bourbon malt up front with a bourbon toffee finish. The alcohol to me is well hidden. I like it better than i though i would.

2014 bottle. Pours a murky toffee brown color. Light tan head. Smells like caramel, raisin, cardboard, medoum mouthfeel low carbonation. Hints of oxidation through mouthfeel and the cardboard flavors.

Quand tu veux une scotch ale, cest ÇA que tu veux! Un scotch ale vieilli en fût de bourbon qui a tout pour être un excellent représentant du style. Liquide brun et trouble drapé dune mousse jaunâtre, onctueuse te persistante. Arômes dérable (même si cet ingrédient nest jamais intervenu dans le brassage), de malts chauffés et suintant leur sucre, de caramel chauffé et de baril vineux. Beaucoup de sucres en bouche. En parfaite cohérence avec le style, ça demeure toutefois très sucré. Absence totale de houblon et damertume en général, je suis à 200% dans le fruit confit, encore lérable, le bourbon en quantité ainsi quune touche de réglisse rouge. La mousse étant tombée et le liquide réchauffé, je suis complètement sous lemprise de cette bombe sucrée. Aucun arrière goût si ce nest quun sucre dorge persistant sur mes lèvres collées, cette bière commande une dégustation lente et réfléchie.
Stellar. Not much sweetness at all. Very tasty. A hint of malt. Nothing wrong here at all.

Bottle. Best by 24/08/2014. Pours brown/orange, a bit cloudy and almost no head. Wonderful aroma of fudge and bourbon. Taste is sticky toffee pudding, bourbon, salt, liquorice and hints of dry wood.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from utobeer. Great drop. Solid bourbon flavour but not heavy alcohol. Pretty smooth actually

Big'N beefy.
No head, no lacing.
Wonderful malty aroma, typical mellow barley.
Golden red hue with chunks of bottle yeast.
Sophisticated taste with a lot of liqurice in the aftertaste.
Bourbon barrels lurking in the background.
Thick mouthfeel, fainting.
Brilliant brew.
Thanks Óli for the sample.

Wersja:  2015 
 Data butelkowania:  24.09.2015 
 Kolor:  Brązowy z rubinowymi refleksami pod światło. Piwo jest czyściutkie jak łza.
 Piana:  Żółto-kremowa, delikatna, ciężka do obserwacji, ponieważ szybko ulatni się.
Przy przechylaniu szkła pozostają liczne smugi na ściankach.
Piana kurczy się do smukłego kożuszka.
Przez cały czas degustacji pojawiają się jej ślady na szkle. 
 Zapach: Potężna, gigantyczna nuta wanili z lekkim kokosem w tle. Wanilia wydaje się początkowo być wszechobecna i przykrywać swoim aromatem piwo bazowe.
Po chwilowym zaklimatyzowaniu się kubków smakowych powoli do nosa zaczynają docierać kolejne składowe takie jak: karmel, toffi, nuty przypieczonego chleba, ciasteczek z kawałkami karmelu, czy ciastek Piegusek z cząstkami czekolady.
Aromat jest wybitnie słodowy i bardzo głęboki.
Piwo pachnie jak słodki deser polany karmelem! 
 Smak: Bardzo podobnie jak w aromacie. Niekończąca się eksplozja wanilii, nuty dębowej beczki, orzechów, toffi i ciemnego pieczywa.
Dalej odrobina ciemnych owoców: suszone śliwki i rodzynki.
Można też odnieść wrażenie, że pojawia się sugestia słodów palonych.
Ogromna porcja karmelu wspaniale komponuje się z wanilią tworząc wrażenie słodkiego płynnego deseru. Goryczka jest średniej maści, jest krótka i tylko delikatnie poszczypuje w język. Finisz jest słodko-gorzki. Zero posmaków alkoholowych. Delikatne rozgrzewanie balansuje słodową słodycz. 
Faktura pełna, ale nie ulepkowata. Piwo jest gęste, zbite i oleiste. Idelany balans poszczególnych składowych.
Wzorowe Scotch Ale, bez najmniejszych wątpliwości. 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie.
 Podsumowanie:  

Najlepsze Scotch Ale jakie miałem okazję pić w swoim życiu. 

Piwo jest po ponad rocznym leżakowaniu. Dało to wszechobecne, GIGANTYCZNE (muszę to podkreślić) nuty wanilii, mokrego drewna, dębiny i dosłownie szczyptę kokosu.
Wanilia chwilami dominuje piwo bazowe, ale w żadnym wypadku mi to nie przeszkadza.
Backwoods Bastards jest zdecydownie piwem słodowym z akcentami: ciemnych owoców (śliwki, rodzynki), toffi, ciemnego pieczywa, delikatnymi słodami palonymi.
Karmel jest pierwszym po wanilii i dębinie najmocniej wyczuwalnym składnikiem.
Arcymistrzowskie ukrycie prawie 12% alkoholu.
Bogate smakowo i zapachowo o solidnej pełnej fakturze.

Pamiętam, że zapłaciłem za to piwo w UK £5.7, przy obecnym kursie funta koszt jednej buteleczki wychodzi poniżej 30 zł.
Piwo zdecydowanie warte jest znacznie wyższej ceny.
Draught at steampunk bar. Bourbon, Syrup, raisins, Caramel, fudge, hints of vanilla. Lovely Dark Brown color.

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013. A lovely deep bloodred colored thing, light blurry and it has a thin sidesticking little top. Light sweet fruity on the nose, some toffee, a little bit of wood perhaps. Its quite dry in the taste this. Lots of battering nuts. Tastes a bit English style barley wine imo. Its just below average on the carbonation and light oily on the mouthfeel. Your get some nice sweet vanillaish alcohol in the finish, some fermented honey melon also comes to mind. Woody and sweet long tail. Really good! 04.05.2013

0.355l bottle from the amazing generous Secret Santa 2013, Bytemensis. Huge thanks Mike! In the glass this is a kinda cloudy looking one, in color its both really deep and dark bronze and a little brown as well. It also has a medium sized dark grey/beige head that turns in to a islandy and sidesticking thing after a while in the glass. Smells lovely sweet, nutty and malty with loads of vanilla. I get a dark rye bread sweetness with deep caramel and some burned sugar in here as well. It also has a light trace of warming a sweet alcohol. Smells lovely. Rich deep sweet and melting on the tongue is a good way to describe how this tastes. Its thick and oily, a tad sticky as well in the mouth while its gently carbonated with those small prickling bubbles. There is a good amount of burned caramelly sugars, a malt toffee sweetness with tones of both coffee, vanilla, a ton of bourbon, nut essens and rye bread. Definitely on the sweet side of the scale but not over the top in any way. Love the punchy and warming bourbon theme this one has. Ends off in a warming melting on the tongue finish. A beauty. 20.02.2014
This ale has a big mouth feel. Sweet, with a slightly bitter finish, well balanced. Very boozy at 11.6 abv. Not for the faint of heart.
Clear amber red. Caramel aromas, wood, alcohol, bourbon. Taste is barley malt, alcohol, bourbon, caramel, vanilla, sweet dried fruit. Finish is heavy and sweet - but balanced. An all time favorite.
Bottle, Buddys, Uppsala. Decent ale, clear features of chocolate. Warming.
Had a sample at WOBFest 2016. Ran to this booth first, and Founders did not disappoint. Nice coffee flavor offset by notes of scotch and some cherries. Started the day on a high note.
Bottle 33 cl. Dark brown with a small lightbrown head. Aroma of licorice, dried fruit and alc. Bitter taste with a warm dark fruit end.

Keg at RB Best, 31/01/16. ... yeah yeah ... had this a few times years back but no rake ... no queue at the bar so scoped !
Chestnut brown with a decent beige head.
Nose is nutty, brown bread, spice, subtle bourbon, caramel, dark fruits.
Taste comprises dark fruit rinds, bourbon oak, dark malts, spice, earthy.
Medium + body, fine carbonation, warming alcohol in the close.
Decent for style ... good boost leve.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Draft- Poured burgundy with a smooth tan head. Strong caramel smell with a hint of bourbon barrel. Full body with complex aromas of marshmellow and caramel.
Saveurs de caramel, malt rôtie et fruits séchés. Une belle présence de sucre et dalcool qui ne sont toute fois pas envahissants. Tres bien.

bottle. Poured clear red-amber with a thick creamy beige head. Aroma of roasted malt with alcohol. Full body, oily mouthfeel with warning finish. Flavour of burnt grains, smoke, molasses, alcohol, pepper.

Dark brown nearly black body with nearly no head. Aroma is caramel, roasted malts, dried fruit and chocolate. Taste is creamy caramel malts with nuts and some cocoa. Aftertaste is nice caramel roasted sweetness with some bitterness and also some alcohol.
外观：深棕色
Pours a dark red/brown. Aromas of dark roasted malt and fruity aroma(cherries?). Sweet, malty flavors with a hint of smoke. Finishes with a touch of hop bite.
Poured from bottle 2012 thanks Willrunforbeer dark ruby with a beige head. Aromas of caramel dark fruit bourbon and vanilla. Taste is nice creamy mouth feel fruit alcohol vanilla and caramel. Wow.

Holy fuck balls. This beer right here is something special. Smells very strongly of caramel with a hint of bourbon. Not a very strong head. Very full body with many complex aromas of marshmellow and caramel. An absolute treat for anyone.

BOTTLE 12 OZ. Clear dark ruby, beige head. The aroma is full-on, caramel and dried fruit, vanilla and toasted coconut, creamy milk chocolate and toffee sweetness - all sprinkled with a little bourbon. The taste is just as big - caramel (not overly sweet or sticky), balanced by some dark bread and alcohol spice right from the start. The bourbon is there, but not too in your face. Smooth velvety finish with notes of chocolate liqueur and alcohol infused candies. Some spicy hops too. A kick-back sipper indeed. Excellent.

Dark red color with tan head. Aroma has really nice mellow bourbon, butterscotch, caramel, toffee and raisins. Taste starts slightly sweet and nutty with dark malts and raisins. In the middletaste you start to get the bourbon, caramel and fudge. Finishes with butterscotch and caramel and lingers on the aftertaste. Medium body and carbonation. Really good barrel aging on this one. Lots of fudge and caramel. Excellent overall.

355 ml bottle from BeerLovers Vienna, bottled 09/24/15
Dark copper body, with a small, fluffy, moderately lacing, beige head.
Aroma of bourbon, chocolate, caramel, cocoa, dried fruits, barrel, some alcohol.
Tastes of dried fruits, dark berries, cocoa, bourbon, wood, black tea, chocolate, liquorice, booze.
Medium to full, creamy mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes warm, medium boozy, a bit dry, medium sweet, a bit roasty, astringent, wooden, with bitter chocolate, some fruits, some bourbon.

Really tasty. Quite boozy, but not too overpowering, pleasantly warm. Very well integrated bourbon notes, not too dominant, adding another smooth layer. Overall a lovely, complex sipper and also a unique style example for those like me, who arent the biggest Scotch Ale fans normally.

Dark red brown appearance with little head. Complex tastes of caramel, brown sugar, knekk, bourbon and alcohol. Full body, smooth carbonation and a lasting aftertaste of fruity caramel. Fantastic fruity, dark sweet scotch ale

0,355l bottle at home. Bottled 09/24/2015. ABV 11.6%. dark brown / redish color, small off-white / orange head. smells of dried fruits, raisins, plums, marzipan, spices, alcohol, some wood. good smell, rather alcoholic though. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes alcoholic, some wood, marzipan, light coconut, light dried fruits, raisins, spices. finishes rather alcoholic with notes of raisins, spices and coconut. overall good one with nice coconut notes but very boozy. Probably 2 years in the cellar would cut down the alcohol (if no oxidation notes creep in).

Keg pour 2014 vintage at Cask and Vine. Aroma is dark fruit, apple, boozy/oak. Appearance is dark brown with nice sparkle, no head but small off-white ring with trace lacing. Taste is moderately sweet caramel, dark fruits, oak/booze. Palate is medium bodied with creamy smooth texture, soft carbonation with sweet caramel/booze finish. Mild warming feeling. Overall, this is one smooth delight. Barrel aging is done to perfection with complements to the beer without dominating. Nice sipper.

Clearish deep black brown, some light reddish notes. Light vanilla, caramel, roasted grains. Light chocolate. Lightly bittered. Mainly sweet. Heavier body, some oiliness, very carbonation. Great.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The beer I rate other beers. Superb strong vanilla and sugar sweetness cuts the high abv. Complexity from bourbon barrels and whisky make this a fine product that is many imitated but never replicated
Boozy aroma. Great copper color with small beige head. Not quite as sweet as Dirty Bastard. Nutty and caramel tastes. You can definitely tell this is a boozy beer. Great stuff!

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2016 Bottle 355ml. Served at cellar temperature. Pours a burnt mahogany. Head is lightly tanned, average sized and lasts well. Aroma is rich and malty with notes of bourbon, smoked vanilla/oak, burnt toffee, golden syrup, chocolate, muscatels, caramelized/stewed figs and sap. Flavour is a light to medium earthy hop bitterness with toasted barley, sultanas, dates, bourbon, oak/vanilla, burnt toffee, rum chocolate, smoke and a touch of resin. Full bodied with an oily texture and a good length warming finish.
Vom fass in perth WA, Dunkles braun schöner schaum, Geruch malzig Rosinen Vanille bourbon, Geschmack Rosinen bourbon Vanille dunkler karamell leichte säure leichte frucht, wow!

Draught at Akkurat Stockholm. Semi lasting beige head. Clear red brown color. Complex aroma with almonds, vanilla,nougat finnish with a strong wine aroma. Sweet chocolate and caramell taste with clearly present alcohole. Firm bitterness and body.
Bottle split a few ways. Dirty brownish pour with a small head, Notes of coconut, caramel, vanilla, some light smoke, tar and some roast. Nice and smooth!

2016/03/26 - Pours an opaque mahogany colour with a thick, frothy, cream coloured head that slowly reduces to a lingering film and leaves moderate, patchy lacing. Aroma is amazing: vanilla, oak, bourbon, rich chocolate mousse, caramel, toasted malt, coconut, and a touch of dark fruits. Taste is caramel, toasted malt, vanilla, oak, light coconut and a bourbon finish. Mouthfeel is medium and slick with creamy carbonation and a boozy, warming finish. A really enjoyable sipper.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Aroma of bourbon, oak and vanilla. Taste is malt, vanilla, oak and toffee. Alcohol is hidden until the end. Sweet. Nice body. Very, very good!

0,33 bottle from vinmonopolet - Pours a dark brown with a nice brown head. Aroma is heavy on the bourbon and vanilla. Flavor is simply amazing. Smiith vanilla, whisky, dark malt and fruit. This beer took me by surprise, and was really, really amazing!

Bottle at home, 20th March 16. Pours dark caramel. Aroma is toffee, caramel, vanilla, liquor. Taste is burnt caramel, toffee, malts, slight smoke, vanilla, wood barrel. Sweet but balanced, hard work towards the end.

Vom Fass in Perth. Sehr dunkle braune Farbe, cremiger Schaum. Äusserst komplexer Duft. Orangenschale, Rhum, Rosine, Röstmalz, Toffee und Bourbon Fass. Weicher Geschmack. vanille, Malz, Bourbon, getrocknete Pflaume. Langer Abgang. Großartiges Bier!!

Bottle from Vinmonopolet in Valkendorfsgate, Bergen. Ive actually had this on several occasions over the past couple of years, so I was surprised to find an empty slot in my ratings here. Oh well, lets remedy the situation. Pours a beautiful copper-hued clear deep amber body with a medium creamy off-white head. Aroma is vanilla, bourbon, caramel, toffee, Norwegian brown cheese and hints of muscovado sugars, peppery spices, wood and toasted bread. Taste is caramel, vanilla, red berries, toffee, deep malty notes, toasted bread and hints of alcohol, wood, black pepper and burnt sugar in the back. Full body, medium carbonation. Lovely stuff; sweet but not overpowering, complex and heavy and yet somehow accessible at the same time. Perhaps a tad bit too bitter in the finish, but overall very, very good. Founders once again strikes out with a beer that might not be rare at all but certainly matches a lot of the one-offs from smaller U.S. breweries in composition and complexity. Splendid.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak! Pours a hazy orangy brown with a small, oily, off white head. Aroma has loots of caramel, bourbon, light old hops, toffee, toasted malts, light cherry-like fruityness. Tate is sweet, lots of creamy caramel, light toasty dryness, light salty. Smooth, sweet vanilla-bourbon-boozy finish. Average carbonation and a sticky, creamy body.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Thanks buddy. Pours hazy dark brown with a medium light brown head. Aromas of bourbon, vanilla, dark fruits, malt, fudge, yeasty, earthy, light spice. Taste is bourbony sweet, coconuts, sweet fruits, dark sugar, caramel, malt, yeasty, sweet fudge, light savory. Light boozy. Probably the best scotch ale Ive had!

Pours a deep and warm brown with a creamy tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, oak and dark berries. Full body, oily feel, soft carbonation. Rich and complex taste of whisky, spices, coffee and some vanilla with smoky aftertones. The alcohol is well hidden in the long and warming finish.

On tap @ HO1K Beers. Pours a dark caramel brown with a thin off white head. Aroma is of sweet caramel and vanilla. Taste has a light whiskey flavor up front with hints of woody oak. The is some sweetness and alcohol warmth. Whiskey flavor isnt too overpowering but the sweetness detracts from the rest of the flavors. Not one of my favorite styles.

Aroma of bourban and oak. Evocative. Pours deep golden brown with dense honeycomb head. Tastes like a crunchie bar, with honecomb and chocolate. But there is more, with oak, christmas pudding (inclusive of brandy zing) and a warm soft palate. The finish is sweet oak and creaminess which fades eventually leaving a warm glow from all that alcohol.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2016 Delicious! The sweetness caught me off guard, quite unexpected. A very nice evening, after dinner sipper. I fall more in love with Founders each time I experience a different brew from them! 
New release for 2016. Absolutely a brew I will continue to follow. I upped my rating from last year...It seems to be a bit smoother drinking if memory serves. Mine was bottled 9/28/16 and has ABV as 11.2% Im not getting the sweetness as much but its a smooth sipper still.
Ruby brown, cloudy, just a ring of foam. Malty and only slightly sweet. Dry oak on the palate and finish.

Simply great! Taste of oak and vanilla. Smooth but can still taste the booze. A really good one!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sample, 1-ounce, draught, during the Great American Beer Festival, savoured on September 25 2015; eye: coppery, clear, no effervescence, tiny ring of beige head, no lacing; nose: roasted barley, molasses, chocolate milk, light pepper, molasses; mouth: roasted barley, molasses, chocolate milk, light pepper, molasses, finale in roasted barley with light presence of spices, full body, average carbonation, slightly bitter, lightly sweet, silky texture; overall: correct
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Échantillon, 1 once, en fût, durant le Great American Beer Festival, savourée le 25 septembre 2015; il : cuivrée, limpide, pas deffervescence, petit anneau de mousse beige, pas de dentelle; nez : orge torréfiée, mélasse, lait au chocolat, léger piment, mélasse; bouche : orge torréfiée, mélasse, lait au chocolat, léger piment, mélasse, finale en orge torréfiée avec légère présence dépices, corsée, carbonatation moyenne, très légèrement amère, légèrement sucrée, texture soyeuse; en résumé : correct

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2016 12 oz. bottle. Pours ruby-brown with a small beige head. Aroma of bourbon, oak, caramel, and faint vanilla notes. Taste is malt, and lots of bourbon and oak. The bourbon/oak combination is overpowering and drowns out the other flavors. Has a bitter alcohol/bourbon finish. Low carbonation. Full-bodied. Had higher hopes for this, but its still decent. Definitely feeling this one after drinking the whole bottle. If you like booze bombs, this would be an excellent choice.

Bottle from We brought Beer, London - UK. Color: dark brown beer with no carbonation and medium brownish foam. Smell: sweet caramel malt, oak notes. Toffee and alcohol finish. Taste: full body with creamy sensation. Caramel malt, toffee and balanced with oak barrel aged taste. Finish strong alcohol with bitterness and sweet caramel. Really superb beer but also strongly boozy beer! Aftertaste: dry alcohol with toffee.

Bottle at Cafe Sara, december 23rd 2014. Dark brown body with a small tanned head. Aroma of dark malts, plums, dried fruit, vanilla and hints of oak. Taste is massive, toffee and bourbon with dark fruit, slight alcohol notes with a warm oak, chocolate and vanilla finish. A really nice one!

Bottle. Cola coloured, thin cappuccino coloured head. Huge malt aromas combined with bourbon, vanilla, cherry hazelnut and chocolate. Initial alcohol flavour that doesn't detract, leading into bourbon, vanilla, cherry, spice, hazelnuts and a lick of smoke. The sweetness is bought back in check by spicy hops. Beautifully smooth. Great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from tap into tulip. Pours a clear dark brown wig minimal head. Aroma is typical scotch ale, but somehow richer and more vibrant while still being reserved. Taste follows in the same vein. Very nice and warming on a winters night.
At Ratebeer Best. Pours Reddish brown with a thick tan head and a treacle and bourbon aroma. There is a full-bodied dark molasses flavor with a dry bourbon and vanilla finish.
Boozy aroma and a flavor of Scotch Ale smothered in oak and bourbon. For the alcohol content this is a very smooth ale. Excellent choice to kick off the Blizzard of 16.

Aroma: sweet bourbon with some underlying maltiness; Appearance: dark ruby/amber with off white head that billows and then dissipates quickly; Taste: lots of bourbon but more sweet than boozy; almost egg nog-like with its taste and richness; Palate: heavy with long, very sweet finish; Overall: delicious; would definitely buy again - many times.

Draft. Ruby/mahogany beer with a tan head. Scotch and oak aroma. Caramel and scotch flavor with light frutiness and light caramel. Medium-plus bodied. Caramel and scotch lingers with light fruitiness.
Taster. Deep Amber brown with tan head. Vanilla toffee and bourbon notes. It dances around on the tongue then has a sweet bourbon lingering finish... Delicious!!!

Aromas of caramel, oak, vanilla, smoke, deep malts, nougat, and subtle peanut butter. Pours a very dark hazy brown with large lacing. Taste is big caramel, bourbon, nougat, peanut butter and leather upfront. Mid palate brings notes of oak, peanut brittle, toffee, candied molasses, slight smoke, sticky malts and a slight aged wort malt characteristic. Finishes smooth with vanilla, oak, latte and bourbon notes. Overall, very impressive rendition of a scotch ale with a pleasant bourbon twist.
Oaky and liquor smell fades quickly, appearance is reddish, taste is very oaky, smooth even with high alcohol which you can def taste....slightly sweet...

355ml bottle from Good Spirits Co, Glasgow (£4.80):
Another excellent Founders beer, one of their best yet. Tonnes of complexity with good roasted malts, dark fruits & sweetness apparent throughout. Easy to drink despite the strong abv., the balance is excellent too & its definitely a beer Ill be on the look out for again.
