Draft at Moes in Lee, MA. Pours a melded brown gray chocolate. Aroma of booze, bourbon type, dark fruits, toffee, licorice, dates. Taste of plum based booze explosion. Then rum, then dates, then booze, then dry hayseed, sunflower seed as well. A nice frontal scotch right to the dome. Dry cracker bitters in the end turn it all around. Solid through and through.

Scotch ale plus actual scotch or at least it tastes like that. Too strong for my palate. I am a. Big fan on dirty bastard but the addition of the strong scotch taste doesn't do anything for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours mildly dark with a healthy head. Malty with caramel, toasted oak and bourbon. Full and pleasant with subtle warmth. Very tastey and direct in a beer world full of hype and junk.

New Years Eve with a 2014 vintage. Pours a red brown with a tan head. Aromas of oak, bourbon, caramel, and booze. Flavors of toffee, caramel, toasted sugar, bourbon, earth, dates, figs, and plums.  Very smooth mouthfeel, velvety, oily. Slightly more mellow than fresh.

On tap at Boonies in Muscatine. Rich and malty aroma with notes of toasted oak, caramel, light smoke, roasted grain, toffee, earth, a touch of bourbon and a hint of dark fruits. Similar flavor, a complex and well-rounded sipper with a full body. Pretty tasty, but not as good as I remember.

Bottle at Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is cherry / raisins soaked in bourbon. Taste is dark fruits, warm bourbon....slightly creamy and tangy. Extremely drinkable for 11.6%. He will cut you.
Pours dark caramel with small white head. Aroma and taste are overwhelming of bourbon. Very nicely balanced, though I wish there were some extra flavors. Overall, this is quite unique brew.

Scotch Ales tend to be big, but Founders Backwoods Bastard may be the biggest of them all. Weighing in at 11.6% ABV (the 2015 edition, that is) and aged in bourbon barrels; its safe to say this is a beastly brew. Though for such a behemoth, its remarkably tame. The palette is delicious and the deliver is smooth and warming. In a world obsessed with imperial stouts and IPAs, this is a hidden gem in your beer store.

I poured a 12oz bottle into a tulip glass. It was bottled on 9/26/15 and cost $4.39 ($0.37 per ounce).

Appearance: Gorgeous cherry red hue; looks almost like red wine. Body is fairly clear but dark. Initially pours to a large, dark tan, foamy head but it mostly fades and leaves only minor lacing.

Smell: Lovely sweetness of maraschino cherries and bourbon. Theres a strong malt presence as well. Alcohol is noticeable, but not distracting.

Taste: Every once in a while Ill have a beer from a style I dont usually think of as being among my favorites and itll amaze me. This is one of those beers. The palette is simply delicious: sweet to be sure, but nothing artificial or even remotely cloying about it. Much like the nose, the taste is largely dark fruit: rum-soaked raisin, cherries and figs along with confectionery sweetness of caramel and toffee. The bourbon emerges on the finish in the form of both a sweet, oaky, vanilla sensation as well as alcohol. Though not especially bitter, it doesnt come off as unbalanced or hot. This may be the best Scotch Ale Ive ever had, though it might also be considered an Old Ale since its aged in bourbon barrels. Perhaps its the best of both worlds?

Drinkability: Theres no such thing as cold winters night here in Florida, but Founders Backwoods Bastard definitely is the kind of brew Id recommend for an evening of staying in. The 11.6% ABV potency is apparent, but subtle enough that its part of the natural presentation of the brew. Warm to be sure with a lingering sensation in the throat after the first few swigs. It eventually becomes a smooth, thick, and surprisingly clean-finishing sipper. I couldve drank an entire bomber of this solo. Dont pair this with anything  drink it on a clean palate and savor it.

RATING: 10/10

Aroma caramel, roasty, butterscotch, smoke, vanilla, woody, 
Appearance red, frothy, tan foam, 
Taste medium sweetness, 
Palate medium body, 
Overall a very nice barrel aged ale that I would suggest to a friend.

Holy barrel aging. This is a celebration of all things bourbon and oak, and the scotch ale that Founders decided to use as the base of it all is well chosen. Thick, full mouthfeel with a ruby coloring and a lot of flavor from the caramel malts, but really this is a showcase of barrel aging, and a mighty good showcase at that.

Pours clear dark ruby with a half finger head. Wow, what a nose. First, your met with a tonne of oak, you can almost smell the charring of the barrels...or maybe you can? So much bourbon, but not overpowering. This plays so well with this wee heavy that we get a beautiful sweet caramel butterscotch nose. Taste is even better. The bitterness balances this super sweet beer and keeps it grounded. Oak, bourbon, caramel, toffee. So good. Make no mistake, this is a sipper. As far as Founders go, this is my favourite Ive tasted from them, even better than KBS in my opinion. A must for barrel aged fans.

Aromas are heavy with barrel attributes such as vanilla, oak, as well as some sweet caramel malts and a faint hint of fruit. A deep ruby/ brown body, the yellow/ tannish cap is starting to receede and leaving some nice lace on the glass. Flavor is the same as the smell, the alcohol is quite noticeable, practically drowning out the other flavors, some of the malts come out long after a sip, the finish is dry from the oak but a tad sticky from the malts.

On tap at Yard of Ale. Great malty flavor with a smooth bourbon taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At DLM. pours caramel color with no head. Aroma of caramel and slight cherries? Taste of sweet roasted malt with an upfront caramel and a hint hint of cherries. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Bottle for $4.59 at Bottles and Bins in Monterey, CA. Aroma is very sweet and includes oak, peat and dark fruit. Flavor is very sweet and includes caramel and dark cherry. Body is medium and mouthfeel is slightly sticky. Level of carbonation is low. Definitely a sipper of a beer. I think 4 to 6 ounces of this is a good amount to drink.

Pours Amber almost bourbon color. Smell is bourbon, and the taste mimics. Since Im a bourbon fan, it is a great sipping beer. Expected a big alcohol finish but it didnt happen. Very nice warming beer.

Bottle. Dark brown pour with a ruby hue and a thin tan head. Aroma is caramel, bread, chocolate, bourbon. Taste is much the same - caramel, chocolate, bread, vanilla, coconut. Dessert-like, yet not too sweet. Absolutely delicious.

At first whiff, I was certain the whiskey would dominate and I would not like this. Im not a fan of whiskey of any kind, so the whole bourbon-barrel-aging craze is something of an anathema to me. 

However... having now got into my 3rd 4-pack of this stuff, I keep coming back for more. Pours a dark mahogany with a thin off-white top and some nice lacing. Aroma is dominated by whiskey, but smoothed out by malt and caramel. Flavor is similar in that whiskey dominates, but even more so the malty goodness rounds things out with a nice sweetness. Above all, this is one of the smoothest-sipping beers Ive ever had. The creamy mouthfeel, and ease with which this swallows is amazing.

I suspect that were this not put in a bourbon barrel, it could possibly be by far my favorite scotch ale.
Tap at Nova. Brown with a thin ring. Bourbon, vanilla, oak, brown sugar and a little alcohol. Medium sweetness with a dry oak flavor. Lighter body with a soft bubbly feel.

Bottle.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, light brown, mostly lasting.
Body is dark amber.

Aroma is moderately malty (caramel, toasted grain), with notes of sawdust, bourbon / corn syrup, brown sugar, alcohol, cardboard, sherry, cherry.

Flavor is heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.

Medium to full body, watery/syrupy texture, lively carbonation, heavily alcoholic.

A rough, clumsy, bruiser of a beer. Lots of raw wood in the nose, like a fresh-sawn 2x4 or a pile of its sawdust. The rest is mostly alcohol, oxidation, and caramel, but its not unpleasant...just very limited and simple. Almost unbearably sweet and syrupy and quite hot in the afterburn. So, yeah, basically Top 50 material by beer bro standards.

100ml draught at Taphouse, many thanks to Ungstrup. Shiny naked black surface. Near-black body. Inviting aromas of dried fruits, liquorice and smoked malts. Jam-like taste of dark and dried fruits, black malts and smoke, Nicely roasted ending with a twist of bourbon warming down the throat. Full bodied. Tasty (Copenhagen 16.11.2015).
On tap at Ale&Hop. Copper colour with off white head. Bourbon and caramel aroma. Sweet, bourbon, wood, vanilla, caramel, malt, nuts taste. Medium to full body.

Tap at local cantina. Nose is all bourbon and vanilla and taste is the same. Strength is good but that's about it. Less of an ale by far than It should be. Won't order again. Feels like my mouth got bill cosby'ed.

Sample at Taphouse. Low but lasting creamy light brown head. Pitch black body. Roasted malt caramel coacoa with weak hints of whisky. Sweet and mild roasted malt caramel with a fair amount of hops bitterness, hints of whisky and spices but not the expected vanilla from the barrels. Low carbonation. Long sweet finish. Alcohol nicely hidden by the sweetniess of the beer. Very well balanced.

Caoba limpio y espuma beis compacta. Aromas dulces intensos de bourbon, nueces, ligeramente achocolatada. Cuerpo denso, sabor dulce, bourbon, achocolatada, frutos secos. final seco de amargor equilibrado.
From Vinmonopolet, 2014 edition. Bourban taste and smell all the way. Very sweet and stickey. Great beer to age but perfect to drink now aswell. Taste of vanilla, oak, bourban.

12 oz bottle. Burnt amber, with a thin tan head, and spotty lace.  Aroma is sticky toffee, caramel, vanilla, oak, bourbon, peat, smoke. Flavor is equally complex. Vanilla, bourbon, creamy chocolate, cherries, smoke, caramel. Never boozy, abv well hidden.
Sticky toffee pudding, mild ashy smoke, very faint peat, cocoa, strong coconut/vanilla from the oak, fig, date, raisin.

From a tap at the Yard House Virginia Beach. Even after carried from the bar it had a decent head remaining. Lacing stays forever. The aroma is alluring, like youre about to do shots of bourbon. Smooth going down like bourbon too.

Pours a translucent mahogany from the tap with a thick off white head. Aroma is straight caramel, which drew me in. Love the smell of this beer. Smells like maple syrup in there as well. Carbonation is high, burns the throat as it goes down. Bourbon is lighter than expected on the tongue and dissipates quickly. Seems to be some scotch flavor there on the backend. I didnt care for the Dirty Bastard but this is really good. Its rich, like caramel amd bourbon melded together. Such a good beer, why did I wait so long to try this?

Poured from 12 oz glass into tulip. Three finger off white head thins a small ring leaving heavy lacing. Beer is dark in color and appears almost black except when held in front of light when it is a mahogany. Aroma is butterscotch and alcohol. Taste is medium sweet and lightly bitter with notes of peat and butterscotch. This is a medium bodied beer with creamy texture and soft carbonation. A long velvety smooth finish. Great beer. Hope I can get my hands on some more.

2015 Poured, dark reddish brown with a thin white head, from 12oz bottle into a glass. Aroma of slight alcohol and butterscotch. Taste of caramel and cherries with a taste of whiskey towards the end. Very nice beer, easy to drink, hides the abv very well.

Dark brown with real smooth and fine white head. Aroma is stong bourbon and not a whole lot more. Flavor is upfront whiskey and butterscotch. Smooth transition from front to back with a medium booze burn on the finish. Complex but a sipper for sure.

Vertical comparison of 2014 and 2015 versions. Both in bottle. 2014 bottle date - 10/7/14. 2015 bottle date - 9/26/15. 
Appearance: Both a deep amber red/ brown, with minimal khaki foam head. 2015 version is almost perfectly clear, while the 2014 is noticeably murky and cloudy. 
Aroma: 2014: Rich oak and cherry dominate, with smoky tobacco and a touch of vanilla. 2015: A strong woody oak aroma with high vanilla and smoky notes. The cherry and tobacco notes picked up on the aged 2014 not present in the fresh 2015 version. 
Taste: 2014: Rich maltiness with strong cherrywood flavor, giving way to a distinct coconut and vanilla. Bitterness barely there. 2015: A strong punch of fresh oak wood and vanilla, with those flavors much stronger than the 2014 version. Fresh version has not developed the dark fruit/cherry flavors found in the 2014 version. 
Mouthfeel: 2014: Medium body with light creaminess and low carbonation and a touch of alcohol warmth. 2015: Medium body with a more syrupy character than 2014. Missing 2014 creaminess. Carbonation low, with a similar alcohol warmth. 
Finish: 2014: Leaves a malty finish with lingering cherry and coconut. 2015: Very malty on the finish with a lingering vanilla bean flavor. 
Overall: Cant go wrong with either, both are amazing, but I prefer the 2014 aged version to the fresh 2015. 2014 has developed a softer melding of all the rich scotch ale and oak barrel flavors, with the development of dark fruit, cherry, coconut, and tobacco notes not found in the 2015. 2015 has a much sharper taste profile with fresh woody and strong vanilla that are present but subdued in the 2014 version. My advice, this is beer that is definitely better with some age on it.
Thick and sweet. Heavy booze flavor. Lots of overly ripe dark fruits. Red brown color. Caramel and toffee notes. Tap

DAA; Bottle 355 ml. Drunk at Cardinal. Pours small to moderate, hazy dark brown with a frothy creamy, lacing and lasting tan head. Nose is moderate to heavy, roasted, smoked malt and whiskey barrel, moderate caramell bread, light dried dark fruit and spice. Taste is moderate sweet and bitter with a lasting sweet malt and alchole finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily to creamy, carbonation is soft.

Pours mahogany color with tan, creamy head. Lovely, warm smells of single malt scotch, oaky bourbon barrels, smoke, sweet caramel and roasted malts, with an earthy, vanilla, cherry finish. Overall, another stellar example of a brewery nailing the Scottish Ale style.

Pours dark brown-black with a one finger tan head with excellent lacing. Aroma is of butterscotch, raisins, oak, sweet malts, scotch, smoke, caramel malts, cherries, coconut, earthy spices, and maybe some light booze has it warms. Taste is scotch whiskey, bourbon, dark fruits (mainly raisins), butterscotch, vanilla, cherries, oak, and some light booze. Has a medium-full body with a creamy, slightly oily mouthfeel, and a slightly bitter, slightly warming, long, lingering finish. Overall,a fantastic scotch ale that has a tons of nice barrel aged notes.
Very nice butterscotch on the nose. Nice bourbon on the palate with butterscotch on the back

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2015 Pours a dark brown with a khaki head. Oak, caramel, toffee, vanilla, plum, cherries, bourbon, smoke, chocolate, molasses and toasty malt aroma. Caramel, vanilla, molasses, toffee, oak, scotch, chocolate, peat, cherry, raisin, smoke, earthy hop and roasty malt flavors. Full body and moderate carbonation. Caramel, oak, peat and molasses finish. 2015.

pours deep copper with an off-white head. nose is vanilla cream and lots of Scotch oak. flavor is similar to the nose with a heavier whiskey emphasis and very rich maltiness. finish is a little thin and very earthy. not my favorite style but definitely an excellent beer.

Dark amber pour, no real head. Nose is oaky bubbling caramel splashed over a backdrop of dark malt. More sweet than bitter. Middle is heaven... butterscotch layered over dark roasted malt, mingled with bourbon soaked wood and earthy hops. Finish is a little boozy & sweet. Ridiculously good.

Taste: big and bold spiced peat and malts, warming bourbon moth feel of alcohol.
Clear deep red copper color.
Big oaked malt nose.
Full body.
Tan refined head with nice lace.
50 IBUs

On tap. Served a dark mahogany color with a nice tan head. Aroma of dark fruit, whiskey, roasted malt and spice. Taste of roasted malt, dark fruit, cherries, spice, scotch and bit of smoke. Subtle bitterness and a boozy finish. Moderate body, smooth and very well crafted. Great beer to kick back and savor at the end of the day.
Smokey, sweet, malty, definite whiskey characters. Very good beer, a face warmer. Had to roll up my sleeves to get through this one.

This is a strong ass ale. Cherries and scotch pop out right away with a strong warmth. The scotch continues to build on the palate but stays mild. This is pretty dang good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Oddbins Beer Shop, Blackheath. Dark brown pour with a beige head. Good rich aromas of bonfire toffee, vanilla, marzipan, icing sugar, burnt caramel, demerara sugar, dark fruits. A lot going on in there. Flavours of toffee, toffee apple, coconut and raisin leading to a dry, sweet, warming boozy finish. Nice.

Bottled: 10/02/2014. Pours dark ruby red whith a brown hue and a small khaki head. Head retention is good. AROMA: rich malt, caramel, raisin, dates, oak barrel char, chocolate bitterness, brown sugar, vanilla, coffee oil, molasses, butterscotch, herbs, alcohol, earthy, peat, bourbon, sweet, spices, lemon zest, toffee, slight chili pepper and soy sauce. TASTE: rich malt, caramel, roasty, chocolate bitterness, raisin, dates, lemon zest, butterscotch, smoke, vanilla, earthy, bourbon/scotch, coffee oil, oak, brown sugar, molasses, herbs, toffee, soy sauce, slight chili pepper, spices and herbal hops. AFTER TASTE: malty, hop spice, caramel, molasses, bourbon/scotch and herbal hops with a rich medium silky finish.

Bottle, thnx to a trade of which I forgot the name. Pours a hazy light brown beer with a very minimal amount of off white head. Aroma has massive amount of bourbon, booze, loads of oak and sweet vanilla and caramel. Flavor is strong and sweet, loads of bourbon again, boozy and sugary. Slight peppery burn with booze in the aftertaste. Strong and sweet, complex and pretty awesome. Nice.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2016 Cellared 2012 bottle served in a St. Bernardus snifter at a temperature of about 58F.  (repeated in April 2016). 

Dark red-brown body with a small head that quickly reduces to a thin ring. 
Slightly under-carbonated but very smooth body with only a bit of warmth from the alcohol. 
Boozy and sweet aroma with notes of prunes, vanilla, bourbon and toffee. 
The flavor also carries a bit of bourbon and faint wood (barrel), and is lightly sweet. 

O: Ive now had this both fairly fresh and aged for nearly 3 years: excellent on both occasions.

파운더스 브루잉 - 백 우드 바스타드 10.2% 오크 버본 베럴에 에이징된 근성있는 스카치 에일. 연유나 우유 필의 밀키한 맛과 향에 위스키 특유의 향이 굵직하게 피어오른다.그& 목적으로 출시된 근성의 맥주 

아무런 정보 없이 첫입에 훅 털어 넣으면 무언가를 마신다는 행위라기 보단 갑작스레 누군가에게 인중을 강하게 가격당하는 것에 가까운 경험을 할 수 있다. 
그만큼 진득허니 베럴에 묵혀 진을 뽑아낼대로 뽑아낸 맥주. 강하고 확실한 캐릭터가 마음에 든다.

https://twitter.com/MaekJuBot

12 oz bottle thanks to Willrunforbeer for this. Somehow I havent rated this?? Wow, 2014 vintage, bottled 9/26/2014. Deep ruby color almost no head. Aroma is nice, mild bourbon over dark fruits (layers of plum, figs and raisins)

If you open this fresh I feel like the bourbon will help balance this. Right now this is crazy sweet. Almost to the point of cloying but not quite. I guess I needed to have a fresh sample and then a year old vintage. Right this second the dark fruit over powers the bourbon and gives this a "barley wine " like flavor. But dont get me wrong... This is still wonderful. Bourbon and sweetness provides a ton of flavor. Another big plus in this brew is the alcohol is totally hidden. No hype here straight old school rate.
35 cl Bishop Sthlm. Sjukt god Stout med massor av smaker. En hel lördagsgodispåse! Grymt!

Bottle from the Dram Shop. Pours deep ruby with a fairly thin beige head. Nice smoky caramel aroma. A little pear drop too. The taste starts spicy before caramel, light smoke, wood and bourbon. Quite evident alcohol giving a warming glow. The alcohol lingers a little too much in the finish for me. Otherwise excellent.

Deepest ruby with a short tan head. Big peaty, whisky aromas. Its pretty sweet, but somehow avoids being cloying and is remarkably drinkable. Sweet malts and dried fruit, oak, toffee, bourbon. Slightly boozy and really warming. Absolutely delicious.
Pours very dark brown with an off white head. Aroma is a strong peat smell. The taste is very peaty too, its like a proper Island whisky. Very nice.

12 oz bottle from De Bierkoning. Clear dark brown color with a red hue. Light beige head, not too much, with a thin layer retention. Aromas: sweet, toffee, treacle, bourbon, vanilla, hints of red fruit. Retronasal also sweetness, toffee, some alcohol, some hops, bourbon. Flavor is moderate to full sweet, toffee, bourbon. Alcohol feel is strong, warming mouth & throat. Fairly full bodied. Toffee and light bitterness in the finish.

Bottle dated 9/26/2014 enjoyed September 4, 2015 at World of Beer Front Street Columbus Ohio in a pint glass. 

Look -Murky clay with thin white head. Fine bubbles. Blotchy lacing.

Smell - Bourbon. 90s Kroger tobacco aisle. Little fruit.

Taste - Bourbon. Raisin. Very plain and straight forward but good.

Feel - Smooth. No bomb. 50 IBU? Couldnt tell.

Overall - 2014 Josh couldnt choke this down but 2015 Josh is begging for more.

Pours a very deep red to copper body, with a beige head that laces the glass well. Complex, sweet, fruity and very strong aroma of overripe generic and tropical fruits, dark dried fruits, bourbon, slightly roasted malt, sweet caramel and chocolate. Strong flavour of alcohol, overripe generic fruits, red berries, wood, vanilla, bourbon, burnt sugar and caramel. Tropical fruits and dark dried fruits in the back. Moderate sweet taste with a moderate bitter and long-lasting finish. Close to full body, but still feels a bit thinner than expected, also far too boozy and dry, all of which I assume is caused by the barrel ageing. But of course, a nice one. 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 1 year after bottling, from Vinmonopolet Aker Brygge, Oslo]

341ml January 2014 Bottle from trade. Aroma: bourbon, sweet caramel, molasses, vanilla, woody. Quite earthy. App: brown as coca cola, small beige head, ok retention, nice lacing. Taste and palate: full body, really smooth, medium sweetness, dark red fruits in mouth, alcohol and light bitter finish. Overall: wow! Wasnt expecting much from this one as Im not a great fan of scotch ale. By its aroma, I expected something overly sweet but this is so well balance that we can easily accept the sweetness. Wow! Awesome! Scotch ale at its best.

Remarkable. Decided to chill a bottle from the ?cellar? (low 60s) waiting since Nov (9mo) and enjoyed this evening. (previous bottle from the same purchase ?fresh?, and draft last year, unrated)Aroma mostly malt and barrel, beautifully blended, draws you into the dark with . Appearance is perfect imho, deepest ruby red needing significant backlight to detect anything but darkness. Flavor is remarkable, imho (again) one of the best examples of a perfect blend of ale and bourbon barrel.Ten minutes after finishing and I?m wishing I?d chilled the rest of my supply - this is dangerous good... I might buy out supply when it resurfaces this fall...

Draught on tap @ Søernes Ølbar. Pour deep ruby/mahogany with a small but fairly long lasting tan head. Aroma is caramel, wood, brown sugar, earthy, herbal, vanilla and bourbon. Taste is sweet and light bitter. Medium to full bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Finish is long and woody with balanced bourbon dominating.
UPDATED: DEC 5, 2016 Caramel,  oak, peated scotch aroma, rye too. Taste is slight oak and barrel aged scotch, vanillan, brown sugar and caramel, raisin skin, berries and some peat.

Bottle from Tim, thanks man! Bottle date on the neck says 09/26/2014. Appearance is maroon black with a nice layer of head that has good retention. Aroma is oak, pete, vanilla, and brown sugar. Tast is oak, smoke, bourbon, vanilla, velvet mouthfeel, with a caramel smokey finish. Great beer, love the smoke and the barrel treatment!

Dark brown, with a head that is almost yellow while it lasts, which isnt long. Nice and thick mouthfeel with soft carbonation. The barrels have added a very pronounced whisky nose, and its a good one, with wood, vanilla and a bit of smokiness. Dried fruit too, which carries into the taste, alongside lots of deep malt, syrup and some smoky spice. Finish is great - lingering pepper and tar. Best scotch ale Ive had.

355ml bottle.
Deep mahogany brown, with a thin beige head.
Spicy, complex, oaky aroma, vanilla, caramel, dried fruit, Bourbon, hops, light smoke, cinnamon, earth, apricot, leather.
Semi-sweet, full bodied, mid to high bitterness, creamy CO2.
Complex, matured, spicy taste, caramel, toffee, oak, vanilla, apricot, smoke, earth, tannins, hops.
Long, rich, balanced finish, with ever evolving flavours. Extremely well balanced, although maybe a tiny bit sweet. (2015-07-22)
2014 Vintage. 12oz bottle pours a brown color without much head. Malty and prominent bourbon flavors. A little harsh.
How : bottle Appearance : dark red with a small off-white head. Aroma : rye bread, syrup, caramel, dried fruits. Palate : medium to full body, soft carbonation.
Odense ratebeer summer gathering 2015. Pours brown with an off white head. Aroma deep malts, sweet, syrup, brown sugar. Taste is sugar, brown sugar, sweet malts, alcohol.
Bottle @ Odense Summer Gathering, 2015. Pours hazy amber with a small white head. Rye, caramel, wood, sugar dark fruit. Full bodied. Warming and soft..
Ratebeer Odense Summer Gathering 2015. Amber with a tiny white head. Sweet malty flavour, with loads of caramel.
Awesome beer, tastes very strongly of bourbon and lovely dark fruits, very nice.

(From tap @ basementbeerbar) A very dark scotch ale -appears almost black in the glas with a small off white head. The nose has raisins, sirup some spice and vanilla. The taste is full with lots of caramel, wood, spice and especially bourbony notes. Like it lots. The mouthfeel is creamy with soft carbonation. The finish is long with primarily the bourbon notes hanging on.

Bouteille avec une date de péremption au 17/08/2014, bue en 2015. Vieillissement dau moins 2 ans. Robe brune foncée aux reflets rubis avec une tonne de gros grumeaux en suspension. Arômes de sucre dorge , mélasse, caramel, bourbon subtil. En bouche, explosion de saveurs. Gros sucre caramélisé avec le bourbon qui contrairement au nez, est ici beaucoup plus présent. Des saveurs de fruits confits se dégagent, ainsi quon côté plus amer de café et de bois. La rondeur du liquide est incroyable. Le bourbon boisé semble vouloir semparer de chaque parcelle du palais. Lamertume laisse percer un peu de chocolat et de lanis. Une petite astringeance nous suit tout le long de la dégustation mais on sy habitue. Très bonne bière.
I dont really like scotch so not really liking this shouldnt have been a huge surprise.
Very peppery smells, kind of sweet. Very dark and thick looking. Tastes of pepper and other complex flavors
Pours semi thick with a nice malty colored head. Aroma of a caramelized scotch. The flavor explosion is amazing. Like a scotch laced cinnamon bun minus the icing. This is a sipping beer!

330ml bottle from Glug, Grainger Market Newcastle. Poured into an English half pint. Lustrous deep red with a firm lasting off-white head. Whiskey and vanilla aroma. Aromas are present in the flavour, with caramel, sweet cherry and dried fruit. Warming alcohol. Full bodied, long chewy finish. Simply delicious.
Tap. Dark red brown pour with a thin mocha head. Cherry, vanilla, American oak, whisky, caramel and spice. Wow. Fruity and oaky with high alcohol. Really nice
Bottle bought at Malt Attacks. Hazlenut brown, with little head. Nose is heavy bourbon, vanilla, malts. Taste is bourbon, caramel, vanilla. Light watery mouthfeel. Very nice.

Deep brown colour with small off white head. Immediate aroma of bourbon and vanilla which gives way to chocolate and raisin. Smooth mouthfeel with a light bourbon flavour, chocolate in the mid palate before dark dried fruit and light alcohol warmth. Quite sweet but well balanced with a just present earthy bitterness. Been a few years since I tried this and Im very impressed. Great winter warmer.
Draught at KØ15. Really good vanilla aroma. Cloudy chestnut colour. Small stable off-white head. The flavour is sweet with a great vanilla note, bordering on coconut. A great beer.

Bottle shared. Pours dark brown with a ring tan head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, bourbon, vanilla, sweet malt, light spice, wood and molasses. Flavour is heavy sweet with a boozy bourbon palate. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

35cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Almost no head. Clear dark amber pour. Very good.

Aroma of bourbon and malts, taste or caramel and bourbon with some sweet fruit, so good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught, KØ15. Pours hazy dark ruby with small off-white head. Clear aroma of malt, vanilla and barrel, with some fruity notes. Sweetish flavour of vanilla and malt, with notes of fruit and bitetr, hoppy touches. Lingering but non-aggressive aftertaste of vanilla. Cool, sweetish belches. Decent stuff, indeed.
355ml bottle at home, from AleselA, nutty aroma with bourbon, clear deep chestnut brown, lot of bubbles, thin beige head, some vanilla, bourbon, malty, viscous, sweet and smooth

2014 bottle on 5/23/15. Pours a hazy dark brown with minimal head. Nose is bourbon, dark fruit, vanilla, yellow cake, almond extract, cherries. Taste is the same. Caramel, dark fruit, vanilla, bourbon, damn this tastes good. Superb.

Poured from a 12oz bottle into a tulip: Pours dark brown with a thin tan head. Aroma is bourbon, caramel, and lots of sweet roasted malts. Taste is almost like drinking bourbon with some roasted notes. Bit of leaves, earth, and just sweet enough. Heavy body, definitely a sipping beer, try it at different temperatures. Founder barrel ages well.

On tap at Triangle Wine (Founders tap takeover). Pours brown with a dark amber hue. Aroma is huge caramel, bourbon, vanilla, some malt backing as well. Taste is slightly sweet, but tolerable, with malts, bourbon, oak and vanilla on the end. Creamy texture, thick bodied. Very filling. Overall an excellent scotch ale. One of the finest.

Bottle, dark Amber, slightly orange, creamy head. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, raisin, sweet cherries. Taste is bourbon, vanilla cream, raisin, sweet cherry pie filling. Very malty and rich. Palate is rich, carbonation slightly subdued.

Beautiful bourbon aroma with notes of caramel and sour cherries. Pours hazy deep brown with a very short head that laces slightly. Tastes wonderfully, sweet damn! Starts with a bourbon kick thats wrapped in caramel and oak, then finishes with a profound chocolate finish. Weak medium body with decent carbonation and a brandy finish to it. One of the best brews Ive had!
On tap. Red in color with small off-white head. Earthy, boozy aroma. Somewhat sweet, a bit smoky. Full bodied. Very good.

Appearance is murky brown, no head at all really. Fairly opaque. Aroma- vanilla, bourbon, barrel sweetness, caramel, treacle toffee, chocolate, hint of raisin, woody, brandy. Taste- lots of barrel character- vanilla sweetness, marzipan, nutty, treacle, caramel, hint of smoke, coffee, slight milk chocolate quality, cherry brandy, bitterness towards the end. Quite sticky and smooth mouthfeel. Really nice.
Nearly clear auburn with a small tan head. Caramel, brown sugar and dark fruit, yet not overly sweet. Doesnt really say "whisky" to me but still mighty fine.

33cl bottle served in a snifter. Aroma is buttery bourbon, oak, sweet malts and rich dried fruits (Christmas pudding). Taste is amazingly accurate to the aroma with just a little too much sweetness although it is well balanced and for a wee heavy to be getting marks anywhere near this level from me is unheard of. The mouthfeel is thick and silky smooth as you would expect. I could not imagine a better example as wee heavies are always a little too sweet for my liking. This, though has so much depth it is constantly evolving was you sip. This is a proper American beer and one I will buy whenever the opportunity arises.
Full on scotch whiskey notes. very strong taste of alcohol.. too heavy for my liking.
bottle from beer hawk dark in colour with a strong malty aroma very strong alcohol on the taste with a slight sweet aftertaste sadly not for me though

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen (12/02/2015) - reddish brown pour with beige head. Sweet malty aroma and taste, lots of caramel, some toffee, brown sugar, some dark fruits, lovely brew.
Bottle from ship in a bottle. Chestnut colour with a med beige head. Aroma is strong vanilla and wood. Taste is very sweet with nuts marzipan and more sweetness to finish.

2012, 13, 14 on tap. 12 has very raisin aroma with toffee caramel backgtound. 13 is saffron, toffee, faint raisin and spice. 14 is cardemom, clove, saffron, toffee, hint of cherry and pear. 14 tastes of spicy oak, toffee, caramel. Tastes of mellowed oak, rich caramel, some clove. Tastes of very mellow caramel, hints of oak and spice. 12 & 14 have swirls of foam, 13 has none. Overall, very nice, aged 1.5-2.5 years are the best, aged past to 3 years is too late.

Tap. 2012, 2013 and 2014. 2012 was a nice body but just too raisiny for me. 2013 was the best, with a perfect balance of sweet fruit, malt, scotch notes, mild hopping. 2014 was second best and good; rich malts balanced between rich caramel and a sharp burnt wood quality.
I really never expected to like this beer so much!! So well balanced. Caramel, oak, malt, chocolate, raisins, bourbon! Killer beer

35,5cl bottle (2014) probably from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo. Pours close to clear copper, but with some sediments, and a modest off-white head. Aroma of bourbon, oak and vanilla, quite massive at first. Sweet dried fruits, caramel, mild spices and some earthy and roasty notes. Massive, complex and very sweet. Certainly a sipper. A bit to sweet and heavy for my taste, but also a quite delicious winter warmer. Hmmm, maybe Ill try it again next winter.
Bottle at home. Sweet caramel and dried dark fruit on the nose. Dark, rich and full of flavour. Superb.

Bottle @SB. Deep brown and red color. Light brown foam, not long lasting. A very nice aroma, touch of burned sugar, vanilla. Taste is good, medium sweet and nice small bitterness. Old fruits. Really nice beer.

12 oz bottle, thanks bytemesis! Aroma consists of coconut, vanilla, wood, peat, cashew brittle, raisins. Pours muddy brown with a dissipating beige head. Taste is sweet, slightly oxidized, earthy, oaky, boozy, dark fruits. Texture is oily, body full. Nice beer, but its a bit hot and not quite what I was expecting.

Dark reddish brown colour; aroma is sweet malt vanilla, woody notes; the same taste of whiskey barrel, roasty dark chocolate and caramel. 
Complex winter beer.
UPDATED: MAR 9, 2017 Geweldig bier ! Vanille, zoet, licht bittere smaak die lang blijft hangen. Ruikt ook heel erg lekker.

Deep ruby brown with rimming beige head; aroma is sweet malt vanilla coconut notes; Flava is rich sweet malt scotch whiskey notes hints of roasty chocolate; feels medium and semi fizzy; finishes malty woody
Caramel, toffee, massive vanilla tones an a little bitter oak. I love bourbon aged ales. Not a typical scottish ale, which is probably why its better than most! Extremely good with aged cheeses!
A little too boozy for what I was hoping for. Some nice sweet caramel flavors sit amongst some dark fruit. Good, not worth the hype though.
The hype out weighs this beer. A solid B to Low B+ beer but not a A beer. I really wanted this beer to blow me away but compared Wulver its just does not hold up on any level.

Flaska systembolaget. Brunfärgad med kopparton. Maltig och fuktigt jordig doft med russin och vanilj. Knäckig och härlig maltsötma i smaken. Romrussin, örter, sirap och lite kaffe. Fyllig kropp med rejäl beska.

From 345 ml bottle. Pours a deep dark brown with some brick red highlights at the edge and a thin but lasting off-white head. Aromas of raisins, prunes, macerated cherries, bourbon, vanilla and a touch of cocoa. Taste starts of with sweet biscuits and brown sugar, before some vanilla kicks in then some deep dark fruit flavours. Theres a little alcohol burn at the end but thats quite minimal. Full creamy mouthfeel. Lingering malty aftertaste. Excellent barleywine.

On tap at Mackeys Hideout. Pours a deep dark copper, with a minimal thin beige ring of foam. Aroma of dark fruit, malt. Tastes of dark fruit and malt. Very easy to drink, and to get in trouble with. 
You wont find many beers better than this.

Klar rødbrun med lavt beige skum. Vanilje, eik og noe karamellukt. Fyldig alkoholsødme. Kjenner at den har ligget på gode fat. Noe brent karamell. kort bitter avsluttning. Sticky, søtlig ettersmak. Lillestrøm ølfestival - Klimt

355 ml bottle. Clear copper with thin white head. Smell is sweet with raisin, dried fruit, syrup and vanilla bourbon. Taste is sweet dried fruit, jam, syrup with light bitterness with hints of earth and hay. Some peat smoke and warming alcohol in the finish. Semi sweet with low bitterness and low carbonation.

Aroma of black cherry, bourbon, vanilla and oak. Tastes like everything in the aroma but has less cherry and more vanilla. Reminds me of a barleywine. Very good, glad I was able to try this one. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very good. Very malty. No hops to speak of, but I like it. Not sure if Id get a six pack, but at a bar its good.
5.4.2014. Oaky, sweet whiskey-like aroma. In taste syrup, vanilla, brown sugar, dry fruits. Full-bodied, alcohol warms. Heavy stuff.
Brun/röd med mellanstort ljusbrunt skum. Doftar och smakar massor med bourbon och vanilj! Väldigt rund och ingen alkoholsmak. Riktigt bra öl! !

Flaska från SB ca 2 år gammal. Stor och fantastisk fin söt doft av romrussin, vanilj, bourbon, marspan, brända mandlar. Söt, mjuk vätska med väl integrerad alkohol. Kanske lagrad lite för länge, lite kraft och spänst har försvunnit men smakbilden är riktigt fin med en touch bourbon som inte blir för mycket. Väldigt gott.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with thin white head that dissipates. Caramel aroma over light carbonation. Nice caramel flavor with a boozy bourbon tones and mouthfeel. Very enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled. Pours clear, deep amber with a small, beige head. Aroma of caramel, pesty notes, dried fruit, wood and bourbon. Sweet flavor that ends up slightly more dry with some alcohol. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Barley.

Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av russin, fikon, plommon, ekfat, bourbon, marzipan, karamell med toner av vanilj, choklad och lönnsirap. Lagom sötma, fina smaker, välbalanserad, kraftfull, fruktig och smakrik. Mycket gott!
On tap. Extremely smooth mouth feel. Definitely on the sweet side with some bourbon coming through. Not meant to drink quickly. Really enjoyable late evening sipper.
Flaska från SB. Russin, torkade aprikoser och ekfat i doften. Smakar rejält av choklad och torkad frukt. Otippat god. Me like it!

355ml bottle. Ruby dark with medium high white head. The aroma is wonderful, explosive, candies, caramel, vanilla, tea. Taste is intensely smooth, vanilla, hard candy, caramel, Jack Daniels, Ginger ale, malt, sweet. Perfectly balanced with many flavors, every sip is exciting. Great, just great!

Wow you can really smell the oak in this bottle! Sticky sweet and the bourbon barrel really comes through. Probably the best scotch ale Ive had but not a style I am a fan of. Dont like the extreme sweetness of the style to start with. It this one I can enjoy.
@ Agards väg 5/3-15. Caramely and woody (oak) with bourbon, vanilla and dried fruits (for example notes of raisins), quite sweet. Body is medium, bourbon, vanilla and alcoholic notes in the finish.

@ Havregatan 150304. Bottle (355 ml) from Systembolaget. Malty and caramelly, woody and quite sweet with bourbon notes, dried fruits and vanilla, medium to full body with an oily texture. The finish is sweet with bourbon and vanilla and some alcoholic notes.

Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget. Clear chestnut,medium beiige head. Vanilla bourbon barrel aromas dominating with some caramelly and nutty malt in the background. Medium bodied, low carbonation. Semi dry, low bitterness. Messy.

Great beer! The deep amber/brown color and light brown head, intense sweet aroma of figgs, caramel, honey and raisins, and a rich and delicious sweet taste, with notes of raisins and rom among others, adds up to a really great beer. I am becoming increasingly fond of this beer style!

Bottle at home. Pours a very dark clear red brown with a one finger off white head. Nose hits you right away with bourbon, oak, plums, raisins, caramel. Flavour is very good with sweet malts, some smoke, dark fruits and on the end you get the bourbon. Mouthfeel is medium and ends a bit dry. The flavour doesnt really linger that long.

God och mycket kryddig doft. Mycket karaktär. Även smaken var väldigt god med tydlig fatlagring och kryddor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice big bold tasting beer had in bottle at the Arboreal Inn in Spring Lake Michigan! Going to age a couple of bottles to see how well it ages

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaska från SB. Mörkt brun med beige skum. Tydlig bourbon doft med lite kola och choklad. Smaken präglas av bourbon och den är ganska torr och lite spritig.
Bottle at home. Aroma of wood, butterscotch, vanilla, pine, bourbon, dates, raisins, leather, chocolate, toffee. Alcohol is very noticeable. Sweet taste, bitter finish. Kinda harsh yet very tasty.

Pours a dark red with a white lacy head. Insanely strong malt aroma. Taste is a very sweet intense malt made more complex with the barrel flavors. with a slightly bitter finish.No taste of alcohol?maybe too sweet? Very thick low on bubbles.

Dark brown color , thin beige head. Aroma of vanilla , malt and bourbon Unbelievable complex taste of caramel malt , chocolate , vanilla , bourbon , dried fruits . Full body , decent sweetness ,which didn't bother me at all. Perfect !

Dark brown with a thin white head. Aroma is rich dark fruit with a bit of vanilla. Flavor is big vanilla up front with dark fruit and a touch of smokiness. Finishes a bit bittersweet.

Wife: 4.5

Aroma: intense caramel, toffee, sugary syrups, wood, oak barrels, bourbon. Appearance: clear, dark amber, light, off-white head. Taste: heavy sweet. Palate: bourbon flavours, heavy sweets continue, dried, black fruits. Overall: fabulous Scotch Ale, excellent aroma and palate. Bottle at CBR2015, Shoreditch.

Flaska från SB. Lätt svart brun färg med liten gulbrun skumkrona. Komplex doft av bourbon- fat, pumpa och brunt socker. Mediumfyllig kropp. Brännande smak av bourbon- fat, peppar, mörk choklad, brunt socker och pumpa.

I havent had something like this before. It pours dark copper brown with small lacing, the immediate smell is bourbon, vanilla, sweet dark fruit like Christmas pudding, but the alcohol smell is really dominating. I didnt find it that thick or syrupy, thin texture but has a lot of kick which goes great with the bourbon aroma. Complex.

355ml bottle. Pours dark mahogony brown with two finger beige brown head rapidly decreasing to form a small lid. Aroma of dark chocolate, roasted malts, whisky and oak. Sweet yet dry taste with chocolate and oak dominating but also warming whisky and maybe some vanilla. Smooth warming mouthfeel with noticeable prickly carbonation. Lasting sweet aftertaste and whisky warmth.
Mäktig doft med starka inslag av mörkchoklad. Mörk till utseendet. Mäktig smak, även den av främst mörkchoklad. Not to exciting. God men ingen fullpoängare. Lite tråkig faltiskt.
UPDATED: FEB 22, 2015 Drucken på flaska. Inte så spännande som jag hoppats på. Händer inte så mycket. Smak av mörk choklad och dova bourbontoner. Borde passa mig, men gör det inte, tyvärr.
God, smörkola. Tröttnar snabbt. Fyllig.ififjzkfkfkxkfnxkxkxkxnxkkxkxnrkfkfnkfkfkfk
Amber pour. Malty boozy aroma with caramel and vanilla. Taste is vanilla, caramel, plum. Boozy bourbon finish. Very smooth well done beer.
Nice, full aroma, plum... Dark clear looks good... The taste is full, theres plum, malt, a hint of booze, complex...very very nice

Mørk brun med lavt lyst skum. Aroma er søt malt og antydninger til whiskey. Smaken er vanilje, kokos(!), malt, tørket frukt og bourbon/whiskey. Søt, med en antydning til bitterhet. Perfekt balansert. Man kjenner så vidt alkoholen nedover ganen. Medium konsistens. Fløyelsmyk i munnen!

Sampled at tasting. Pours dark copper with low off white head. Aroma is complex and inviting, notes of caramel, dried fruit, whisky and herbs. Taste is full and bitter sweet, very round and comforting, lots of taste developing as you go and a rewarding finish.

40-45 cl på fad, 10.2 % ABV, nydt på Ørsted Ølbar, søndag 15. februar 2015.
Fantastisk aroma af whisky, egetræ, mørk tørret frugt og kokos.
Smagen er ligeså uovertruffen. Bitter, sødlig og med en smule røg i, hvad jeg vil kalde perfekt balance. Medium sødme og medium bitterhed.
Konsistensen er olieret til klæbrig, kroppen fyldig og rund, og eftersmagen lang og bitter.
Jeg er næsegrus i beundring over dette bryg, som overrasker stort og blot virker perfekt. Duft og smag i en klasse for sig!

Caramel and whisky nose. Slightly cloudy brown color. Taste is sweet malt and whiskey. Barrel character is the star of the show. Slight alcohol flavor lingers on the aftertaste. Warm and satisfying finish. Well balanced and enjoyable.
Bottle from Lawson. Pours a medium brown, little to no head. Aroma caramel, vanilla, oak. Body round and large, finish big, oaky, tannic and rich. Nice.

Bottle from Dramshop, Sheffield. Ruby with shortlived off-white head. Aroma of scotch and bourbon, toffee and bread. Taste is strong with alcohol, rich and sweet with a swelling tart bitterness. Thick and oily with a little bit too much carbonation for me. Excellent stuff, I imagine it would be absolutely top drawer on keg.

Minimal beige head. Sweet bready, bakery aromas with a touch of oak and..... canned fruit?. Ridiculously rich with low carbonation. A hint of booze alongside bitter chocolate marrying with hits of bourbon and hints of ripe cherry. Char-bitterness to finish which coats the back half of the mouth-hole wonderfully. Fan-fucking-tastic

Poured into a teku class showing slightly coffee colored foam about half a finger and showing translucent dark caramel brown. 

The first impression aroma shows a lot of alcohol. The nose shows strawberries and dried fruits of cranberries. Upon warming up, the single malt scotch and bourbon notes make an appearance. 

The palate shows a lot of the sweet caramel with the roasted malts in the background. Hints of vanilla sweetness. The scotch and bourbon notes permeate the whole beer to give reminders its still there. All these flavors come together in a complex fashion. Very thick bodied, smooth and evenly carbonated. Whiskey/bourbon finish. The alcohol is incredibly well hidden but will definitely knock you out later. Without a doubt, this is the best Scotch Ale I have ever had.

Rating #500! This has been on my list to drink for a long time so here we go at last: 
Pours dark red/brown with a minimal beige head.
Aroma and taste follow each other; Sweet, chocolatey, woody, bourbon and peppery notes.
Full bodied with soft carbonation, smooth mouth feel.
Warming dry finish with some bourbon.
Not as mind blowing that I expected but a solid Scotch Ale, thats for sure.

The aroma from this old "bastard" is full of caramel, wood, dark fruits and a malty toffee aura. Theres also a touch of vanilla in here. It smells super-delish. Dont have this one too cold, cause the smell gets even better when it warms up. The taste and mouthfeel is sugary and sticky. Bourbon warming sensation together with caramels, full malt flavors and dark fruits. The longer time you take to sip on it, the better it gets. Maybe just a tad too sweet for me to give it a full knockout rating.

Pours a dark deep amber brown color. A light brown bubbly head. A smooth aroma woody bourbon and caramel undertones. Caramel bourbon flavors. Very smooth and sippable. Slight vanilla in the backend along with some tingly spices. Some licorice flavors blend in which I normally dont like but it gives some depth here. Good stuff. Unique.

Bottle at cellar temp. Pours a very dark ruby color with a small off-white head. Aromas of whisky, vanilla, oak, caramel malt, dark cherry. Taste is very smooth and complex. Vanilla, oak, and caramel malt are dominant. Medium+ bodied with minimal carbonation and an astringent finish.

Taste is vanilla, whiskey, and a bit of dried fruit, with an aftertaste that I can only describe as the smell of the woods in the winter, except sweet. A little smoke in there as well. Excellent beer.

Kveldens nest siste på M2 jan-15, og Sigmund vet alltid hvordan man skal avrunde kvelden med noen höjdare: her får vi bærpreget snop i en aroma og smak av "tons and tons of" (som Oz Clarke kanskje ville sagt) skotsk whisky, amerikansk bourbon, eikepreget vanilje, sjokolade og alt annet du måtte ønske deg. Varmende balansekunst av klasse.
Shared bottle at "Mandag i annen", Cardinal. Pours dark copper with small head. Aroma of raisins, coconut, smoke, alcohol. Taste of banana, coconut, alcohol; sweet and slightly bitter. Complex beer!
Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 26.01.15. Nutty brown. Beige head. Aroma of bourbon and vanilla. Similar taste, with evident oak. Well balanced.

355 ml bottle, vintage 2014, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 10.2%, 50 IBU. Deep ruby colour, large to moderate off-white to beige head. Aroma of Scotch whisky and bourbon, vanilla, oak, chocolate, grain and dust. Medium sweet flavour with the same elements as the aroma, also a distinct hoppy bitterness in the finish. Warming mouthfeel. Not bad at all.

Caramel, nuts, dried fruits, wood and vanilla in the aroma. copper with a tan head. Medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter. Medium to full body with a soft carbonation. Overall a really nice Scotch ale, lots of malt sweetness, pleasant vanilla notes and some warming alcohol in the back.

The Bottle Shop. Clear deep ruby lasting tan head. bourbon vanilla aroma. Fruity malt. Then more of the same in mouth. Sweetish. More vanilla on finish. Not overly woody. Its kinda I like it. The alcohol helps but nice.

Wee heavy
アルコール  
全体的につよ&

Ha ha, so the higher the alky the higher % at rate beer? I think not. Big and black. Alarmong sweet volatile aroma. Sweet coying sweet, sweet is the answer. Yes. This is a sweet bastard fer sure. Age me you barleywine MFer. Go hug a root.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: On tap at Acadia with commomshawn. Served up in a tulip glass. Dark brown with plenty of effervescence. Full finger of head with impressive lacing. Powerful aroma pushing a bourbon agenda on the drinker. Almost a Belgian quad smell. Taste has a lot going on. Dark fruit like plum or raisin. Chocolate and espresso notes. Alcohol burn and slightly peat like characteristics intermingled as well. Very rich. Reminds me of beers Ive sampled at beer festivals that have ultimately resulted in my demise. Really good bite at the end with a chocolate residue. Enjoying this beer a lot...probably too much. What a bastard.

Bottle.

A- Bourbon, scotch, dark cherries, vanilla, malty, oak, caramel, strong.

A- Dark mahogany color, clear liquid, tan head.

T- Bourbon, cherries, vanilla, oak, caramel, subtle alcohol burn.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, smooth finish.

O- What a damn fine beer this is. As soon as I popped the cap and started to pour I could smell the strong bourbon aroma from a couple feet away. The head sadly faded fairly quite and took the complex and amazing aroma with it but as I took first sip, it was heaven sent. Rich, complex, and tantalizing the taste buds this beer was spot on. Really nothing to complain about. At all.

Bottle. Nose is vanilla, glacier cherry, pronounced bourbon, cola, caramel - huge nose. Taste is powerful bourbon, vanilla, leading to malt, more whiskey, then caramel, cherry, and then some emerging oak in the finish. Mouthfeel is fine. 

Its a beer that delivers on its bourbon promise, but I felt at the expense of the base beer which is swamped rather than complimented.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2016 on tap at Eulogy in Philadelphia; black color; strong bourbon and sweet malt aroma with vanilla notes; sweet, roasted malt flavor with vanilla and bourbon notes and hints of oak; JUst tried the bottled version - it had a lot more bourbon in both the flavor and aroma; some of the best bourbon notes Ive found in a beer; also nice oak notes - no sense of vanilla in the bottled beer; an outstanding beer

The aroma has caramel/toffee/butterscotch, hops, and whiskey barrel. The taste is like the aroma with lots of butteryness. The appearance is dark amber with no head. The palate is thick. Overall good but the bitterness is way to astringent.

This was pretty excellent. The layering was great, with hops lacing their way through chocolaty malt, vanilla and other bourbon and wood notes, some mild spice, maybe all-spice, and a bit of smokiness a la scotch. Thanks Max!

13.01.2015, 0,35l bottle @ home:
04.05.2013, tap @ CBC:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich and sweet, caramel malts, mild bourbon, vanilla, oak, dark sugar, almond cake, grass, nuts, chocolate. Taste is slightly rich and dry, caramel malts, oak, grass, mild bourbon, vanilla, minerals, nuts, licorice, dark sugar, burnt caramel, chocolate. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Bottle from my Secret Santa, many thanks Brandon. Chestnut brown color with medium beige head. Wonderful chocolate aroma together with caramel, bourbon, coffee, wood. Taste, milk chocolate, coffee, bourbon, vanilla, dark malt. Alcohol is nicely incorporated. Tasty sipper.

Medium-dark brown with a good light beige head and some visible particles in suspension. Aroma is bourbon, brown sugar, honey, dates, caramel, raisins, sweet citrus peel and a hint of Sherry. Full bodied, lightly creamy and slightly sticky mouthfeel, sweet on the palate with a lightly warming finish. Taste is raisins, brown sugar, bourbon, vanilla, dates, hints of Sherry and orange liqueur.
Bottle. Copper brown, small head. Delicious sweet caramel, vanilla, marcipane chocolate aroma. In the mouth dry wood, marcipane, hints of cherries. Addictive.

Bottle. I have been waiting to try this for ages, finally got to and was not disappointed. Poured deep reddish brown with small head which went fairly quickly. You really get the scotch whisky in this with oak, roasted malt and a hint of dark cherries. Smoke and sweet and a nice alcohol warmth to it,quite complex really, enjoyable.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2015 The color is almost black but with some burgundy shades. The foam is one finger high. The aroma is strong with vanilla and bourbon. The taste is sharp and sweet. Lots of vanilla and butterscotch. The finish is a bit smoky, which I personally like. It also cuts of the alcohol well. A very complex and strong ale. What I especially like about this beer is that you can really feel that it has been aged in bourbon barrels, both in taste and in the aroma.
Deep brown with flecks of red and nice ring of head. Scotch, bourbon, oak, sweet caramel malts, cherry, raisin, and booze. Good stuff!

35.5cl aged in bourbon barrels. Aroma of oak aged beer, and is so strong that fills the room immediately. Caramel and vanilla mixture with some decent oak bark and acorns. Pours clear black with thin dense head, that goes rather quickly with some lacing. Tastes like aged beer also. You definitely can feel that bourbon barrel. (recently tried Brewfist Spaghetti Western Grappa Barrel, and I believe that the aging had opposite effect on Brewfist beer, making it worse). A bit of good old ethanol and Vana Tallinn in the taste - actually, if you take any local Estonian porter, and drink it together you will have somewhat remotely similar feeling. Medium bodied, slick and gently carbonated. Does goes quite flat by the end of glass. Some moldy aftertaste in the last sips (lets assume it is aging). A perfect brew nonetheless. Had me say "Wow!" on opening.
On draught, pours syrupy almost no head. Smooth barrel finish. I can see what the fuss is about.

Poured a deep dark ruby red could with thin head. Aroma: oak, chocolate, raisin, cherry. Tastes of raisin, chocolate, brown sugar, toffee, oak, oak, oak. Big whiskey taste in this one. Really fantastic beer. Nice warmth in it. Highly recommend

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2016 (Bottle, Stockholm Beer Festival, 27 Sep 2014) Dark brown colour with frothy, beige head. Malty nose with caramel, dried fruit, raisins, prunes and a touch of oak wood. Malty, fruity taste with notes of caramel, chocolate, oak wood, raisins and a certain alcohol bite in a finish with a balanced bitterness. Full body, quite sweet. Warming and tasty. Quite complex and very nice. Rerate: (Bottle, 20 March 2016) Hazy brown colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, fruity nose with dried fruit, raisins, oak wood, vanilla, toffee, orange peel, chocolate and a touch of liquorice. Malty, fruity taste with notes of dried fruit, raisins, prunes, toffee, oak wood, vanilla, chocolate, orange peel, liquorice and a mild spicy bitterness in a finish with a slight alcohol glow. Full body, quite sweet. Tasty and warming, quite balanced for its strength. Very nice.

Imagine that...a barrel aged beer that actually TASTES like it was aged in a whisk(e)y barrel!? I have had so many that were hyped and then when I drank them I thought, "okay, good beer but where is the real reason I bought this in the first place?? Backwoods Bastard is IT! I have always enjoyed the original Dirty Bastard Scotch Ale and then they add barrel ageing to make it even better.

Lukt: Fin duft av krydder og karamell.
Utseende: Fin rødbrun farge.
Skum/kullsyre: Lite skum, ring langs kant.
Smak: Fin smak av krydder og karamell.
