Bottle. Nice reddish, deep brown pour with head that slides away. Aroma is smooth roasted malt with awesome oak punch. Very smooth on tongue with mellow oak taking over slight hopped malt.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours brown with no head. Nose is, burnt sugar, wood, caramel, smoke/char, chocolate covered cherries, a scotch note? Taste is insane, starts off with a scotch whisky, woody note, then turns into a chocolate note that coats your tongue, cherries, some smoke/char. As someone who doesn't like scotch, this beer is still really good. If I did like scotch whiskey this would be the best thing ever. Still a very complex tasty beer.

Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Pours dark brown with a creamy tanned head. Smell of bourbon, oak, vanilla, caramel and dark delicious malts. Moderate sweet, quite boozy up front, then vanilla, oak, and all the good bourbon flavors you can think of! Blended with some tofffee this ends up as a fantastic balanced harmonic flavor palate. Moderate bitter finish. Excellent stuff!

Bottle from Uba ja Humal in Tallinn ( 3.90 - best price in town?). No BB date anywhere. Pours a murky coppery brown with a mahogany hue. Head tan in colour, retains relatively well. Nose is breathtaking... a big whiff of whisky jumps right out of the glass, with strong notes of oak and vanilla, caramel, spiciness... a slight red berry tartness, its sweet, with a hint of alcohol. Taste is equally good, chocolaty, dusty, woody, quite sweet but also bitter and somewhat dry in the finish. On the palate it is dry, with a soft mouthfeel, and with a medium body and low carbonisation this is a dangerously easy-drinking brew! There is however a tiny alcoholic tingle in the finish but its overall quite well hidden for 10%. Great stuff to sip while warming your toes against the furnace.

Bottle. Pours a clear, dark mahogany color with a thin, tan head. Caramel and brown sugar in the aroma with a strong sense of scotch. Scotch flavor with brown sugar and spices that linger. Very warm beer with the alcohol there as well. Very good.

Getting hints bourbon, wood, and of course scotch in the aroma. Very nice reddish amber hue to the beer and smooth on the finish with a touch of heat. Taste is a fantastic bourbon aged wee heavy and I enjoyed this one!
nose is all scotch.....mouth is malt scotch and caramel....really a beautiful beer a definite sipper...
Bottle. Pours a clear brown with sweetish aroma of malts, whiskey, toffee. Can easily taste the alcohol / whiskey taste but surprisingly mellow.

12 Oz bottle. Pours clear dark brown with a tan head. Aromas of bourbon and vanilla with some cinnamon. Flavor is sweet with lots of vanilla and bourbon. Strong bitterness comes on at the end, leaving a bourbon and roasted malt linger. Medium-full body with a sticky mouthfeel and average carbonation. Overall, not a very subtle beer. Lots of bourbon and sweet malt. Not my cup of tea.
Wow, awesome! One of the best beers of this style out there. IMHO, better than Burbon County Stout.

Medium Amber light bodied with little head and lacing. Malt with hints of caramel aroma. Strong scotch taste with no bite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bourbonsmak i blandad choklad. Söt & maltig karamell. Alkoholen döljs väl. En fantastisk öl! En av mina favoriter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mahogany pour, off white head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, figs, raisins, alcohol. Delicious flavor of chocolate, dark fruit, whiskey, alcohol. Fantastic.
Pours a cloudy reddish color with decent lacing and minimal head retention. Tastes of roasted malt, caramel, and deliciousness. A must have!
Flaske fra vinmonopolet. Mørk rød/brun, klar farget. Moderat karbonert med en lav skumtopp. Smaker whiskey, røyk, eik , bourbon, jord, kirsebær. Fantastisk god
smells like scotch, tastes like scotch... very strong ale. Delicious, very conformed with its style, indeed

Dark red-amber color. Pours a tan, creamy head. Nice, frothy lace patterns. Caramelized sugar, bread, lots of toffee and light Scotch in the nose. Tastes of caramelized sugar, Bourbon, bready malts, peat, warming alcohol, light nuttiness, oak and toffee. Hops show up in the finish as it warms. Tasted back to back with a Dirty Bastard. Less hoppy, notes of the DB, but this has more depth and is better. I don't know if there could be a better Scotch Ale imo. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brown/red with small tan head. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, absinth, spice and some oak. Very slick palate. Aftertaste is rich, bourbon, oak, spice, alcohol, floral hops and a dry finish. Overall: Very nice! bourbon is too dominant.
Bottle at home from drinkstore. Pours brown with dissipating ran head. Aroma is heavy bread malts, prune, toffee, whiskey, wood. Flavour is chewy caramel with prune, alcohol burn finish. Nice.

Once again, Founders managed to blow my mind and bust my nut. (Yes, the results were messy, but totally worthwhile.) If theres a more complex Scotch Ale than Backwoods Bastard, I havent tasted it. Well get to that. This brew is sex in a glass - brown-mahogany color and a lacy head thats impressive for the high ABV. Aroma has plenty of whiskey aromas to keep you occupied. Oak, syrup, peat, smoke, toasted malt, and booze. You taste what you smell, but you also get vanilla, caramel, brown sugar, coffee, dark fruit, and nuts. Mouthfeel has a lot of alcohol warmth. Dont drink this beer early in the afternoon like I did. I was tired for the rest of the day. Worth it. Backwoods Bastard is a masterpiece.

12oz bottle. Nice aroma of oak, not too much. Tannish head that disappears quickly. Very nice reddish-brown color. Awesome flavor! Perfect balance of oak, sweetness, & malt. Full bodied, and carbonation lends it a very creamy mouthfeel. Terrific example of a Scotch Ale, maybe a little strong for style?

12 oz. bottle from Vintage Estates Wine and Beer in Boardman, Ohio, poured into a snifter. Thin, quickly disappearing head, but the beer is a really pretty deep red color. Smells like the kind of bourbon Id never be able to afford: strong whiskey, vanilla, wood. Taste blew me away. Vanilla, lots of caramel, whiskey, cedar. Its so damn smooth! Goes down way too easy for a 10.2% beer. Makes me wish I had bought a whole 4-pack. Ive never ventured too far into the barrel-aged end of craft beer, but if this is any indicator, my bank account is about to take a beating. One of the best beers Ive ever had.

Bottle thanks to Bmoosey. Reddish brown with small beige foamy head, whisky and caramel aroma, medium carbonation, strong bourbon taste, long finish with enduring bourbon aftertaste. The whisky taste is too dominating, it feels like having a bourbon with soda.

Bottle into tulip. Have also had on tap at Unos Hamilton. Beautiful bourbony beer, all the bourbon barrel notes youre expecting. Not a stout so not thick and oily, but the ABV holds up against the BA. A nice, warming sipping beer.
Pours dark brown with an off white head. Aroma is sweet bourbon. Flavor is bourbon, vanilla, and caramel.
Overall: Sherry, nuts, raisins, oak, vanilla. Bitter backbone.Note: Bottle 355 ml at a De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2014-12-13.

Huge nose of bourbon and caramel. Very roasty with vanilla and vinous notes. Amazingly smooth and warming. This malt-bomb is one of my new favorites and possibly my favorite one that I can currently find. I appreciated that the sweetness was mediated by the smoke and char from the barrels. You can taste everything and it leaves you wanting more. I know that it is supposed to be a sipping beer, but it just goes down so easily.

Bottle at porch nite with Peter and the boys. Pours a dark brown amber with a thing tan head. Aroma is slight oak and bourbon. Dark fruits. Flavor follows and is really smooth. Really nice beer. wonderful.

0.33 Pours brown with thin head. Aroma: malts, vanilla, whiskey. Taste: beginning is quite strong burbon, but aftertaste cooles it down making a taste very interesting. One of the beers what you dont want more than one.

On tap at The Local in Saratoga Springs NY. Simply amazing. Dark brown with red hints and a thin white head.....aroma of fruit and wood.....taste.....wow......amazing taste with one overwhelming taste in scotch single malt and a hit of booze, great for a cold winters evening.

Good lord is this good. Color is dark brownish red. Very little off white head. Aroma is tons of coconut from the bourbon barrels, come vanilla and malt. Taste is more of the same, coconut for days mixed with malt and vanilla. Slight warming on this, but not overpowering. This is an amazing beer. A must try!

Bottle at The Old House, Sheffield, 5/3/14. Pours dark brown with ruby highlights, cream/tan head that doesnt last. Nose of bourbon, dried fruit, dark caramel malt, molasses, hint of smoke. Tastes sweet rich layers of malt, prunes, dates, cinder toffee, overlaid with bourbon whiskey richness, buttery vanilla oak, a little smoke, a little roast bitterness, and a little tobacco-y oaky dryness on the finish. Rich and full-bodied, soft carbonation. I was blown away by this to be honest, bloody brilliant. Clearly a big beer with lots going on but never overwhelming, level of whiskey character is just right.
Big boozy and robust, this is one of my all time favorites. Nothing signals the arrival of winter the way a bottle or two of Backwoods Bastard does.

12oz bottle 2014 release pours dark semi clear ruby red brown with a finger of head. Nose is rich fruity caramel, maple spice, bourbony dark fruit, plum, raisin, malt. Taste is nice creamy mouthfeel, semi sweet dark fruits, plum, caramel, touch of dark breads, grape, raisin, light bourbon. Finish is semi sweet dark malty caramel fruit and light booze spice with a touch of oaky vanilla. Great.

Pours a nice deep aber color. Aromas of wood, bourbon, caramel, and roasty sweet malts. Taste of bourbon and woody notes from start to finish with some sweet malts balancing it off nicely. First crack at this brew and wasnt disappointed. Got a few to age and see how they taste in a year.

Bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood. Pours brown with minimum head. Aroma is sweet and strong, burnt honey, caramel, dark berries, alcohol, cherries. Taste is medium sweet,toffee, some bitterness, some spicyness, oak,almonds, riped dark berries, caramel, ABV is well hidden. Actually the best scotch ale I have had. Soft carbonation.

Pours a deep copper ruby color. Started with a small head and went away to nothing. Aroma is toffee, caramel, alcohol, vanilla, sugar bourbon. Taste is exactly what the aroma is and leans heavy on the vanilla for me.

Appearance: deep, burnished ruby-amber; when backlit, the reddish hues are gorgeous and disturbed only slightly by very fine, nearly invisible particulates; short creamy near white head.  Aroma: 	beautiful nose of toffee, caramel, vanilla, cream, brown sugar, bourbon, cherry pipe tobacco, dark raisins. Taste: toffee and caramel are prominent, with vanilla, bourbon, and lightly toasted oak coming out prominently as it warms; a bit of smoke and cherries underneath.  Finish: a sweetness lasts, carrying the flavors through for quite a while; the alcohol is remarkably hidden, the finish is incredibly smooth. Notes: 	What can be said about this masterpiece that hasnt been said already. Sometimes the hype is just that (looking at you, Sierra Nevada Bigfoot and just about everything from the Bruery), but this time its well deserved. Darn near perfect. Bottle from Chevy Chase Wine and Liquor.

Medium/strong, bit artificial, salty licorice, licorice, vanilla, bourbon. Deep bronze/red, medium white head. Strong taste, syrup, licorice, salty licorice, vanilla, some malts, bourbon, somewhat artificial and soapy. Long aftertaste w vanilla and coffee. Wide taste spectrum. Medium/thick palate, medium/light carbonation. Overall bit artificial and lack of edge, otherwise perfect.

Appearance: clear black like a cola, off white head, thick.
Aroma: whiskey 
Taste: whiskey is strong, caramel, toast, plum , grape. Not smooth. a bit strong.
Feel: medium carbonation, acidic.

Not my cup of tea. I think barrel aging works better with thicker/darker beers.

I don't particularly go for scotch ales, but I went for this since I love KBS. Wow! Doesn't disappoint. I'll skip all the notes since I seem to find a different one every time I pop a bottle open. Well done Founders. Well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours blood red with a nice head that disappears. Taste like toasted almonds with a light finish of molasses. Overall a great beer.
Just excellent. I like Scotch ales, and aging in bourbon barrels yields outstanding results.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2015 Scotch ale is not my particular style, but I once home brewed an oak aged imperial version I never found anything close to commercially. This has gone above and beyond. Scotch on the nose with some chocolate fruity maltiness accompanied by whiffs of vanilla. A lot of bourbon barrel characteristics woven in to an oaky cherry scotch cocoa brown sugar flavor with a warm alcohol bittersweet finish. Well balanced in every way. A perfect late autumn/early winter ale.
Pours dark red with a tan head. Aroma of dark grain, dark fruit and bourbon. Taste follows aroma

Very dark, tight tan head. Fruitcake aroma - boozy, dark sugars, fruity, a little vanilla. Not quite as dense as the aroma suggests, woody, menacing ABV, chalky cocoa tones, light vanilla, moderately acidic. Darkish stone fruit, dates, some leather. Medium heavy body. Warming. Finishes cakey at first, then goes very hoppy, finally an alcohol burn. Good on a nippy evening. On tap, Baby Proof.

Pours dark brown almost black with brown tint around the edges of the glass and a tan head. Roasted malt, sweet caramel, bourbon, vanilla, and oak aroma with some alcohol vapors. Dark roasted malt smokiness with sweet caramel malt and brown sugar start. Dark chocoate flavor follows with candied sugars. Nice bourbon booziness with oak barrel flavors and vanilla. Flavors finishes out a nice melded roastiness and bourbon vanilla booziness. One word: Incredible.

Backlog rating. 12oz bottle at CBC Clerkenwell, sourced at Utobeer and shared at Gunnar tasting. It pours a brown color with a large tan head. Aroma is quite sweet and lightly roasty with notes of caramel, vanilla, burnt wood, bourbon, tobacco. Taste is again on the sweet side with some roasted matls, wood notes and alcohol to provide bitterness. More notes of toasted bread with marmalade, caramel, vanilla and leather. Alcohol presence is not overwhelming. Medium to full bodied with good carbonation and silky mouthfeel. Overall, I thought this was great, but I admit a skew to BBA beers

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Clear brown color, 1" tan head, sheets of lace. Aroma of malt, cherry wood, and bourbon. Taste is full-bodied malt that adds earthy dark cherry and charred barrel with alcohol in the palate, turning darkly sweet in a long, long finish. A huge brew in which the alcohol doesnt overwhelm, with flavors that compliment each other achieving a perfect balance. Mighty fine.

6oz pour at Yards. Diabetes, sugar up the wahoo! Poued dark cocoa brown with a foamy beige head. Boozy brown sugar bourbon nose with sweet cake like vanilla and chocolate. Wonderful carmel, oak flavors with vanilla and coconut abounding, with lots of brown sugar boubon and sweet chocolaty oak. Outstanding.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2015 12 oz bottle poured into a tulip glass..burgundy pour with an off white head..aroma of vanilla,bourbon,toffee and caramel..taste of vanilla, dark fruits,caramel,malts..outstanding.

Way too strong. Know I'm in the minority but this thing is a hot mess. Bourbon barrel dominates instead if complimenting already fine beer. Gonna let the remaining 2 from the 4 pack sit for a year or so and revisit

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a two finger, off-white head that slowly fades to a thin layer leaving some lace. Deep ruby color. Good carbonation and medium bodied. Nice oak and bourbon nose. Flavor is similar with bourbon and oak, some malty sweetness. The high ABV is hidden. $3.50 for a 12oz bottle from Berts Better Beers Hooksett, NH.

The beer pours coppery brown with a minimal white head. Fruity aroma with cherry overtones. Easy palate, but with the cherry taste. Rating a beer is necessarily subjective, and here is where I just differ with the others who have tasted this beer. I found the fruity flavor distracting and not entirely pleasant. I will probably pass on this beer in the future. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle thanks to Matt. Pours a dark amber with medium beige head that lasts. The aroma is strong dark fruit, caramel, roasted malt. Thin mouthfeel with strong caramel, dark fruit, nice booze, very nice.

Well hot damn. This beer well exceeded my expectations. Aroma of toffee, burnt sugar, oak, bourbon. Sweet at first upon tasting, but not overly so. Notes of pecan, bourbon, almond, sweet caramel. Such a complex beer. Never tasted anything like it.
Wild thang, I think I love you. Its like a soft Bourbon found on a different planet. Definitely sipper no gulper. It wants to have sex with your mouth. Let it have its way.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2016 Deep copper, cloudy, little lace. 
Full body, smooth texture, complex but moderate flavor strength, alcoholic, avg length, not a very tasty finish. 
Sweet but not cloying, moderate bitterness which is more evident in the finish.
Tropical fruit (uva de cavalo), vanilla, sherry, 
Big beer in every way.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer blew. My. Mind.

The aroma is almost coconut-y. Definitely a slow sipper as it tastes more like a liquor. The flavor is pleasing and was certainly a worthy experience.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap, poured into a belgian tulip. Dark cherry aromas are most dominant at first, but they fade quickly leaving warm caramel, wood, ash, earth and roasty notes on the nose. It pours a deep, rich, red-brown color thats nearly opaque with a tan fuzzy head that reduces to a medium thin ring with a clean surface and lacing. The taste is a medium-high sweet with a medium bitterness. The texture is viscous and sticky with a soft, fuzzy carbonation. The full malt body is filled out by notes of cherry, caramel, and oak with an earthy, ashy, and lightly spicy finish all with a light touch of alcohol warmth. The aftertaste starts of strong, but fades quickly, and cleans up nicely, echoing notes of caramel and oak, with an earthy character to it.

This one is unique. It is truly sweet and smooth. This one wasnt bottle aged as it was only bottled about a month before I opened it. Taste and smell the sweet cherries and oak barrels. This one pours really nice and again is smooth and tasty on the palate. Enjoy!

Poured from bottle. Medium brown color with half finger head that dissipates quickly. Smells malty and sweet with hints of dark cherry. Smooth on the palate with complex flavors. Tastes like scotch or bourbon with hints of oak and vanilla. Well balanced between the malts and hops.
Fantastic. Love the bourbon flavor it gets from being brewed in the barrels. The aroma is sweet and full bodied.

It's like scotch without the burning.

Rich and deep aroma just a like its promised in the splash page for the brew, lots of malt and some chocolate cherry like character with obvious oak and bourbon.

Smooth on the palate with light effervescence that does build slightly. Magical, peaty character well in balance with malts.

While this is a sipper at 10%+ ABV I could definitely enjoy this (very slowly) all night.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very low, very clean white however, head on pour. Deep red hued brown color. Very malty, warm and filling. Great presence of bourbon, malt, vanilla, oak and ripened fruit both in nose and pallet. Only detractor is heavy sweetness, if I have to be so picky.

Bottle from a 4 pack. Pours a dark maroon amber with a slight tan head. Smells like bourbon. Tastes like bourbon, malts, caramel, a little smokey, and butter. Palate is creamy with a definitively smooth booze tinge. Absolutely amazing.

Orange copper, small beige head. Nose is bourbon, vanilla, malt, alcohol, dried fruit. Flavor is malt, caramel, fruity notes, bourbon, vanilla, alcohol, sweetness. Finishes with caramel sweetness, vanilla and alcohol, slight bitterness. Fantastic stuff.

Aroma: malt , toffee, caramel, brown sugar, bourbon , and dark fruit.
Appearance: ruby hued caramel color with a quickly disappearing head.
Taste: sweet caramel, malt, dark fruit, bourbon, and toffee blended masterfully. This beer is amazing , 4 bottles isnt going to be enough !

Easily one of the best overall beers of what is out there. If this is a preview of KBS then I need to wait in line overnight to try some of that. This is a perfectly balanced ale with bourbon aging. Not overpowering, but a really nice balance between the scotch ale and boozy bourbon.
Bourbon definitely comes through. Not overpowering. Nice aftertaste. Definitely cellaring a couple of these.

Pours a dark copper body with a thin tan head. Rich oaky aroma laced with toasted nuts, ripe peaches, and raisins. Smooth buttery toffee and caramel initial taste. Warm full woody finish that lingers with a sweet honey aftertaste. Beautiful muscle-bound sipper.

12oz Bottle. Dark red pour with a nice head that disappeared fast, but laced well. Toffee nose followed with vanillas and bourbons. Malty with bourbon flavors. Mild sweet caramels and dark fruits, mild chocolates and vanillas. Finishes with some alcohol heat. One of the best.
Easily the best Scotch Ale Ive had. This one is smooth -- even with the uber ABV -- and Im loving (loving!) the toffee notes. Totally recommended.

Rich, creamy body, with aromas of vanilla bean and bourbon. Balanced and sufficient, with roasted mocha bean and powdery, bitter chocolate flavors, laced with nicely intertwined oaky bourbon notes and a creamy marshmallow finish. One of the better bourbon-aged beers Ive ever had, as the influence is balanced and doesnt overwhelm. Long, creamy finish with its massive heat hidden below its layers.

330ml bottle. Hazy dark copper color with nice red hue. Brief yellow head. Dark fruits, plums, brandy, sweet, toffee, malty notes in aroma. Nice and mellow aroma. Toffee, woody, malty, candy caramel, brandy in taste. Goes down very smoothly. Sweet malty body. Smooth, silky mothfeel. Brandy notes add some excitement. Alcohol is very well hidden. Great brew!

12 oz bottle, poured into a nonic pint at room temperature.

A: Pours looking very similar to Coke. Once in the glass, it becomes a deep, clear hickory brown with a ruddy tint. The head is thin and dissipates swiftly, leaving an off-white ring around the edge of the glass. What lacing forms, forms to stay.

S: Bourbon swirls up out of the glass, and its a bourbon type that has oak, vanilla, almonds, walnuts, and some spices I cant pick out along. I half wonder if theyre using barrels from the Heaven Hill or Buffalo Trace distilleries. Underneath the liquor smells, theres caramel and toffee, dancing around the edges.

T: This tastes of yes and victory, with hints of expletive and invective. Sweet toffee-caramel malt swirls in across the palate, bringing with it the vanilla and nuttiness from the nose, before a warm, boozy glow washes through the background with the wooden and spice notes. Theres a hint of bourbon warmth as it goes down, and the finish is pure oak-vanilla-booze. Theres just enough of an earthy tinge throughout to be noticeable.

M: Creamy, full, and rich, without a surfeit of carbonation to distract one from the abundant flavors.

O: I am a fan of bourbon, and a fan of the Dirty Bastard - as such, this makes for quite a beer for me. This 2014 bottle is the first time Ive had the pleasure of tasting this since a Founders tap takeover at Fries Cafe around 2011 or so, and that may well be too long a span to go without this in my life.
UPDATED: APR 6, 2015 Aroma of cherries, plums, raisins, bourbon, taste is bourbon, caramel, smoky, very smooth, extremely drinkable. A perfect sipper. Vintage 2014.

2014 Vintage, 12oz bottle from The Beer Store Wilson. Reddish-brown hue, murky clarity with mostly lasting creamy medium khaki head. Excellent lacing. Strong bourbon aroma, hint of chocolate malt on the nose. Heavy bourbon and malt up front with a light dark fruit and bourbon finish. Lots of boubon from start to finsih. Creamy mouthfeel.
This is a really great beer! Molasses, caramel, toffee, burnt sugar, roasted nuts, old bread, hay, banana, raisin, plums, dates, oak, bourbon... complex and smooth.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with red hues, off-white head. Aroma is strong vanilla, bourbon, sweet figs and prunes, dark fruits, wood. Taste is very smooth, lots of bourbon, silky, medium to full bodied, medium carbonation, long bourbon finish. Overall, super enjoyable. Very well made.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2015 Bottled 2014. Pours a brown chocolate color like the bottle itself. Minimal head. Some lacing that trickles down. Aroma is tons of bourbon, theres some caramel, some toffee, vanilla, maybe a little bit of fruit, and oh yea pretty boozy. Flavor is toffee, caramel, bourbon (surprise surprise), sweetness. Really good. Medium carbonation. Just a great beer.

Having the 2015 vintage now - 09/26/15 bottling - drank on 11/30/15. Bigger beer, 11.6% this time around, as opposed to 10-ish% last year. Still boozy, still amazing.

Color is a dark but somewhat coppery brown. Almost no head.

The aroma is very interesting - some breads malt aromas, but also a hint of some peaty scotch. Also some clear oak notes giving it some spice.

The taste shows some distinct sweetness and enough bitterness to provide some good balance.

Palate shows medium to full body, a bit of oiliness and carbonation. The finish is long and complex with carbonation, sweetness, oiliness and the oak and peat.

This is a quite good beer; definitely recommend it!

It pours a dark amber with a light brown head that leaves lacing as it dissipates. It has the aroma of cherries with strong scotch and a bit of caramel. The first taste that hit are those of caramel and roasted malts then the strong flavor of scotch with cherries. Its a bit potent on the kick, but other than that a n excellent scotch ale.

Pours clear caramel color with little to no head. Aroma is maple syrup and strong aroma of bourbon and booze. You feel this one. The taste is buttery and rich yet sweet and caramel with some earthy spice in the mix. Well balanced and very good.

Bottle pour. Wow. This is a wow beer! The color is a deep red/caramel tone with a thin-medium creamy head. Oaky and caramel, english toffee notes dominate the nose. The base beer, Dirty Bastard, is a classic Founders offering but this barrel aged version ramps up the flavor profile to 11. There are blended tones of vanilla, cherry/dried fruit and rich caramel all adding up to a complex, deep, woody ale. A phenomenal beer that shows incredible restraint on the booziness - this strikes me as one to enjoy fresh. Such complexity that demands your attention at each sip. Goes down smoothly, with a balanced body that has the perfect full feel without being sticky or too thick. A (single) malt lovers dream.

This is an amazing beer, a rich earthy sweet aroma of bourbon, oak, vanilla, caramel, dark fruit. Taste is deep, rich, complex and sweet. Bourbon, all kinds of malt, dark fruit, hints of spice and peat. Full bodied and just awesome.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours clear dark brown with a forthy beige head thats mostly lasting but leaves no lace. Perfumy aroma and caramel. Bold flavors of bourbon, smoke, oak and alcohol. But the bourbon and alcohol arent overpowering and are congruent together. Well balanced and nicely done.

Tap at the Oasis pub on Halloween 2014
Pours very dark brown hue with a nice tan head with good lacing. Nose is full of bourbon, caramel malts, and lite earthy notes. Flavors are sublime-lots of bourbon however, doesnt mask the beer underneath. Lots of caramel, lite cookie and earthy notes. Huge body-wish i took better notes on this one. I was having too much fun with 3 of my best hometown friends when drinking this one. I havent had this beer in 7 yrs and i never rated it back then.
Slightly sweet scotch ale with nice bourbon finish. Even at 10.2 ABV its easy to drink and well balanced. Not my favorite "100% rated beer" but def worth buying a 4 pack.
Bottle. Pours dark brown. Nose is big vanilla followed by butterscotch and wood. Taste is vanilla, caramel, wood, scotch. A little alcohol burn on the backend.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2015 Bottle. I like the name of this beer and the label artwork. Copper body, medium to small dense beige head. Aroma has sugary toffee and bourbon. Quite simplistic at first but when you explore it further it starts to reveal different aspects like barrel wood and smoke. Sweet syrupy taste with more butterscotch and notable hints of barrel wood. Finish is notably sweet and woody. Very good and memorable ale.

Aroma is fruity, floral, resiny, mildly caramelly, some slight earthy notes as well as sweet raisins to it as well. Flavour has rather similar elements, but also some berries and some slight smoked wet wooden notes with mild vanilla and spiciness kicking in as well.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2014 Pours a hazy deep red with lasting ring head and good lacing. Aroma is a bright, fresh, oak bourbon barrel. Taste is really sweet with earthy molasses. Some caramel, vanilla, peat, spices. Noticeable alcohol burn in the end. Its hard not to like barrel aged anything.  The warmer this gets the more it feels raw and hot, and the taste and palate lack the depth of the aroma.   I bet a couple of years would help this one.

Deep mahogany color. Aroma is sweet bourbon and oak with loads of caramel malts and some light spice. Taste starts light, then in comes the bourbon sweetness and alcohol yet there is no burn. A touch of caramel, light spice tickles the tongue and a touch of toast. Full bodied.

Deep mahogany brown in color... Thin foamy tan head... Aroma of caramel, bourbon, vanilla, peated malts... Mouthfeel is thinner than you'd expect, flavor of peated scotch malts, spices, caramel, vanilla... Weak spice, scotch alcohol burn on palate... Solid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2017 0,355L bottle, best by 24.08.2014. Pours copper with tan head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is sweet, malt, bourbon, caramel. Flavor is very sweet, bourbon, caramel, malt, chocolate notes, and some wood. Finish is fruity bitter with some alcohol. Overall: great brew, but the alcohol and sweetness are showing little bit too much at the moment. I would love to try an aged sample. Rating: 8:3:8:4:17=4
best by 24.08.2014, drank 06.02.2017. Massive bourbon in flavor, but more round than before. It is nicely sweet, but not sticky, noticeable caramel, and malt with dry bitterness and vanilla. Great beer, bump to overall.

One of my favorite scotch ales. Smells like a good single malt scotch. Appearance was murky brownish with a small quickly dissipating head. Taste is scotch, bourbon, caramel, and vanilla. Nice smooth finish and little alcohol burn despite the high abv. Excellent beer!

Deep black with a red tinge, reasonable light tan head. Looks really dense. The aroma is intense - big whiffs of bourbon and nut with additional leather and molasses scent. What a complex and interesting beer. I taste a slight hit of coffee initially, with a tight smack of bitterness. This is followed by a big bourbon hit, supported by woody notes and tastes - like - leather - smells flavour. The alcohol isnt well hidden, in fact this burns like a spirit would. Not as dense as Id like for the style, but still pretty heavy. No carbonation to speak of and the beer fades away on the back of a burning sensation that flows right through to the stomach.

2012 bottle. Smells slightly oxidized with some caramel, booze, and oak. Taste is very nice: warming alcohol, caramel, toasted oak, vanilla, slight soy. Nearly flat. Tasty all in all but might have aged too long

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark brown, murky and cloudy. Smells like bourbon! Taste is sweet with complex flavours  vanilla, wood, caramel, roasted malt, bourbon. Very nice indeed. A good bottle to split with a friend.

On tap at Bishops Arms Folkis, October 2014. 

A bit hazy dark amber with a medium head. Really a lot of malt in this one. Also dried fruit, caramel, some nuts, vanilla and light bourbon. Sweet and with warming alcohol. The mouthfeel was thick. A nice beer. I wonder what Gandalf would think about this one?

Keg at Bishops Arms Folkungagatan, Stockholm. Deep mahogany colour, rich creamy head. Floral hops, vanilla and caramel up front.Sweet with full body and dense mouthfeel. Caramel, cherry brandy and vanilla. Warming finish. Intense, big flavours. Very straightforward.

Tung söt doft av torkad frukt och melass. Fyllig smak av katrinplommon och russin. Vinös med små pärlande kolsyrebubblor. Fint balanserat med lätt beska. Drack ett avsmakningsglas på 15 cl från fat hos Bishop Arms, Folkungagatan i Stockholm. Det räckte länge. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Hazy amber red beer with a large beige head. Aroma is malty with notes of caramel, nuts, vanilla, chocolate and dried fruit. Flavor is malty with notes of caramel, spices, earth, chocolate and vanilla. Wow, pretty insane malty beer.
Smells amazing. Lots of scotch and bourbon. Dark brown with light caramel head. Pretty delicious stuff.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2016 "DAMN!!! Incredible aroma (9.5) of vanilla, bourbon, slight peet, sweet malt and a touch of hops. since DB is a more complex scotch ale, more flavors were present in the barreled version and the bourbon was done very very well. i LOVE this beer and will look for more! thanks John. loved it!"

18/VIII/14 - 33cl bottle from a trade @ home - BB: 24/VIII/14 (talk about timing!) (2014-928) Thanks to hackobock for the trade!
Clear purple brown beer, irregular small beige head, non adhesive, little stable. Aroma: sweet, lots of vanilla, bourbon, caramel, bit sugary, bit of dried fruits, woody, raisins. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: sweet start, lots of caramel, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, sugary, bit of alcohol. Aftertaste: some alcohol, sugary touch, lots of bourbon, vanilla, bit of chocolate. Amazing beer!

One year old poured into a snifter. Looks like a typical scotch ale, but that is the end of it. Aromas of sweet toasted malt and sugars with bourbon on it immediately after. Such a pleasure to taste. The sweetness and sticky texture are rounded out well by the boozy finish. Overall I am pretty much in love with this beer; complex malts and bourbon... whats not to love? Thank you Founders for this gift of a brew!
sampler 9/3 Unos Hamilton. Bourbon rules this rich amber pour. Strong enough to put you down for the night.

Bottle at Haket. Sampled on August 23, 2014.Clear dark brown color, small teal head. Sweet, chocolate, roasted, alcohol, wood scent. Wood, dry, sweet, lactic taste. Lactic, chocolate aftertaste. Medium to smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Peppry tongue feeling.
Muddy brown pour with a very thin off white head. Toffee, woody, bourbon aromas. Taste is fairly similar with dominant bourbon, some vanilla, some toffee, a little boozy, warm finish. Great

My Bottom Line:
Vanilla bourbon flavors are molded into a lascivious mouthfeel heated up by alcohol heat and lingering wood.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A creamy head of foam decorates the darkest ruby.
-The mouthfeel is rich, yes, but the supple carbonation makes it become an elegant dessert.
-The flavor profile is rather linear. Malts arent as deep as I like in this style (overtaken by the barrel treatment, probably?)
-Licorice-like sugared fruitiness appears after a while.

Bottle.

Poured from a bottle from 2012, so it has about 2 years of age on it. Strong aroma of bourbon and maple syrup. Rich, clear, and inviting caramel color with little to no head. Maple syrup qualities are prominent in the flavor as well. Bourbon and booziness is also there. These flavors overwhelm pretty much everything else, probably because of the age on the bottle. I really like it but think I prefer it a bit fresher.

Felreggad tidigare som Double Trouble. 
Flaska från SB. Rödbrun dimmig vätska med en fin liten brun skumkrona. Doftar Baileys med kokos. Kraftig alkoholsmak och Baileyskänslan ligget kvar. Lämnar en bedövad gom med viss sötma och beska. Ingen öl i min smak...
Bottle from Archive Beer Boutique August 2013. Great beer with a dark brown colour and a swirling mist of foam. Fills the mouth with vanilla, toffee and caramel flavours.
Draft. Pours a reddish brown. Aroma is scotch, bourbon, caramel, and vanilla. Taste is vanilla and bourbon. Wonderful beer.

Pours dark brown with thin head. This one smells like a bottle of find bourbon with a hint of malt. Taste is super smooth notes of vanilla toffee and caramel. Perfectly balance flavor. Medium body, low carbonation. Loved this one.
Bottle from Coogee Cellars. Murky brown, tan head, boozy, oaky, vanilla, sweet caramel malt, low carbonation, syrupy bitter finish. Ok.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2015

June 29, 2014. Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours murky reddish brown with a small tan head. Aroma is bourbon, wood, caramel, licorice, vanilla. Taste is medium sweet caramel with oak and bourbon notes, finish is medium bitter with a caramel and alcohol note to it. Medium bodied and average carbonation,
8-4-8-4-15=40

Pours a cloudy chestnut brown with minimal head. Aroma is figgy with dark and sweet malts. Flavor is very sweet and masks the abv very well. There is nothing to dislike about this brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from bottle to glass. Hazy brown hue with light brown fizzy head. Aroma is prunes, chocolate, oak, vanilla, plums. Mouthfeel is refreshing with a light body and zesty carbonation. Taste is sweet throughout with a wood astringency in the following and ethanol finish. Overall this is a decent brew but a bit thin for my taste.

A full body with a motor oil color for appearance with a nice liquor taste. This is a perfect desert beer that should be enjoyed and not chugged like any normal beer. Very nice oak barrel taste to and did they do a great job of aging it. The prefect beer to enjoy at the brewery
Bourbony. Wood. Oak. Light caramel brown color. Hot. Licorice? Caramel. Not my kind of thing but if you like barrels give this a go.
Fantastisk öl. Fjärde jag dricker sen den kom på SB. Underbar maltkropp och lagringen gör det lilla extra.

A sweet, boozy night-cap of the kind I find hard to resist, even though this tests my sugar tolerance. Bottle-brown with thick head. The aroma has strong molasses, turpentine, burnt brown sugars, ginger and spice. Slick mouthfeel. Very sweet and treacly on the tongue with some heat in the swallow. Burnt malts and prominent alcohol with a lingering herbal finish that Im not sure I like. Ultimately a bit too sweet and one-dimensional to rate it any higher. (355ml bottle from Leura Cellars)
355 ml bottle. Mahogany, thin white head. Malty, alcoholic, bready, woody aroma. Flavor has barrel all over it, vanilla, oak, berry sweetness. Very very sweet.

Bottle. Red dark deep amber. Vanilla scotch aley caramel malty. Quite a bit of herbals. Thickish body, vanilla sweet caramel. Sort of ok scotch. Not too sweet, but almost.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Flaska, ebest SB. Mörkbrun med smutsvitt skum. Dofter av vanilj, nötter, marsipan, karamell och röda bär. Smakinslag av vanilj, rom, karamell, körsbär och rågbröd. Något spritig eftersmak. Mjuk och len munkänsla.

The best scotch ale Ive had yet and this being a fairly regular offering is amazing. Pours a dark brown with a small beige ring. Aroma is sweet bourbon and oak with loads of caramel malts and some light spice. Like opening up a bourbon barrel and sticking your head inside. Taste starts light, then in comes the bourbon sweetness and alcohol yet there is no burn. A touch of caramel, light spice tickles the tongue and a touch of toast. So divine. Should have bought more.

Pours a dark brown body with a medium head. Aroma of wood and tar. Warm and rich taste full of lovely flavours.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours brown with light beige head. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla and burnt sugar. Flavour is bourbon, vanilla, heavy sweet and fruity.
Bottled. Pours dark amber with a small white head. Smells very nutty, caramell malt, a bit cheese. Tastes very nutty malty, sweet caramell malt, alcohol with a mild bitter finish.

On tap at World of Beer-Arlington, TX. Deep brown with a decent tan head. Aroma is of bourbon, spices, chocolate, heavy toffee, oak, vanilla, earth. Taste is of oak, bourbon, toffee, earth, moss, toast, vanilla, light fig, and smoke.

Chocolate, coffee, alcohol, licorice, raisin, woody. 
Marrom escura com pouca espuma. 
O amargor e o corpo são médio-alto. 
O álcool só aparece pelo aquecimento, muito bem inserido.
Pours a nice brown color with off-white head. Oak, scotch, bourbon, and caramel, and toffee on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes sweet. Very nice.

shared bottle. poured a dark ruby / brown colour with a off white head. incredible aroma of vanilla, toffee, oak, butterscotch, bourbon, raisins, maple syrup, with a smooth balanced aftertate. taste is more like a barleywine. but a great brew!

bourbon, sweet, smokey aroma. pours clear copper. taste is sweet, then caramel, smokey, plum and bourbon, faint maltiness. light on palate with moderate lingering aftertaste. Really sweet. Nice taster... dont know that i could drink a full pint, except to sip for a long while.

Transfer from BA review from 2-7-12 

Poured from bottle into tulip shaped glass

Appearance  Pours a mahogany-deep red color. There is a very mild off white head formed upon pouring with only a bit of lacing upon the heads dissipation. 

Smell  Sweeter aromas first meet the nose of dark fruits mixed with a little bit of caramel. A slight amount of bourbon works its way in the middle with a little bit of alcohol mixing with the bourbon and fruit; rounding out the smell profile at the very end.

Taste  Up front a nice complex dark fruit flavor, composed mainly of a cherry base (yet mixed in with some prune and raisin as well), is mixed with a slight amount of caramel malt flavor. There is an ever so slight bourbon that works its way into the taste profile. The alcohol then comes into play and mixing with the light bourbon and finishes out the taste profile. A nice flavor but a bit lacking in the barrel flavor that I desire.

Mouthfeel  For the high abv of the brew it is quite thin in body. The carbonation is just right, and this combined with the thinner body make it easy to drink. The one thing that holds one back, however, from downing this beer, is the slight tingle one gets from the alcohol, which helps keep you in check. Actually it all works together surprisingly well.

Overall - It is a good beer, but in some ways unbalanced for its style in my mind (i.e. thin body and lack of great bourbon flavor vs. its high abv and alcohol flavor). Good, but not great.
Looks at tastes of flat vanilla cola. Its a nice beer but not lingering on the oak burbon taste.
Pre pale ale tasting/Dolle und Halling Maters of the Universe tasting. Unclear brown body with a small white head. Dark fruit, ripe fruit, caramel, wood.

14-MAY-2014, draft @Churchkey Washington DC.
Hazy, dark, dark, mahogany with lasitng off-white head.
Aroma is like: I am in Bourbon Heaven. Loads of bread and bourbon.
Taste the same. With Caramel, nuts, alcohol, dried fruit. Full sweet body with medium carbonation. This is wonderfull. Very malty and very Bourbony.
I love it.

Bottle, Beer Moth, Manchester. Drunk on New Years Eve 2013. One of the great beer names. Dense reddy brown pour with a thin off-white head. Aroma had notes of caramel, booze, smoke, wood, bourbon and vanilla. A decent smorgasboard in fact. More of the same in the fullish flavour, but the bourbon in the taste is maybe just a bit too much for me. Warmed up pretty well. Good but didnt knock me off my seat. Its fine, but maybe a bit overrated.
Draught (gorwler). This is a big warm serious brew with lots of malt, alcohol, and wamth. If you see it get it.

Bottled. Slightly hazy brown color, thin lacy head. Heavy milk chocolate and syrupy caramel nose, vanilla, raisins, woody notes. Sweet, rummy and raisiny, almost extract-like, wood and, herbal notes, wood, and some alcohol in the finish. Medium body, slick and slightly sugary texture, low carbonation. Intense, sweet beer, more like a dessert.

Bottle at Savor. Second to last beer of the night. My memory is a bit hazy and my taste buds for sure. From what I remember this one had big flavors and was really boozy. Need to try again when a little more lucid.
Backnote, had this beer at the zeebra extreem beer festival 2014. superb beer

Very dark brown pour, with a large beige head. Loads of oak, caramel malts with some roast. Notes of vanilla, cherries, plums, and earthy hops. The barrel doesnt overpower, but compliments. Incredibly balanced, and a great sipper. Loved it.
Scotch immediatley hits youre pallet! Dark fruit some good notes of smokey flavors! If your a fan of scotch ales then this is all you! Wasnt to impressed! Little strong with the scotch!
Bottle at home. Sticky toffee and fruits on nose, taste is rich caramel and toffee, light dry smoke, sweet fruit.
Solid chotch ale. Malty, bit fruity and with some sweet notes of oak and caramel. Nice, but a bit too much on the sweet side.

At Zeebra Beer Festival, THX for sharing todays beers!
APPEARANCE: clouded amber beer, small unstable off white head.
NOSE: quite sweet, but alcohol clearly noticeable.
TASTE: really sweet, some vanilla and alcohol.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2017 From a 355ml bottle on 4/5/2014 (shared by Butz with thanks). Pours a dark cloudy amber with a small head. The aroma features stewed and dark fruit, caramel and a touch of booze. The bourbon really hits you immediately but this gives way to sticky sweetness, with caramel, toffee, dates and raisins all featuring. Theres more than a touch of cherry sour, roasty bitterness and warming alcohol in there, but the sweetness dominates. The palate is quite creamy and the carbonation relatively lively. A nice, quite complex winter dessert sipper, but not a 100 beer for mine.
0,33l bottle @ Cosmic Comic Cafe. Aroma is roasted malts and whiskey. Flavor is roasted malts, whiskey and alcohol. Nice palate. Awesome.
Excellent bourbon aroma without a huge amount of heat but still solid bourbon flavor too. This is a good'un!

Pours dark mahogany colored with a thin tan head. Aroma is vanilla, toasted oak, sweet caramel. Taste is more of the same. Not too sweet. Toasty with vanilla , malts with the slightest of dark fruit. This beer is a delicious treat! Body is right where it should be, medium full.

Keg @ Beer Run. Deep brown, hazy with a tight head. big bourbon and chocolate nose, plenty of toffee. Taste is supremely malty. More chocolate, ice cream sundae. Some heat on the finish. Full body, oily. Quality.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2014 From bottle. Deep ruby red with almost no head. Full aroma of vanilla, burnt sugar, cherries and, of course, bourbon. Inviting and boozy. Taste starts with oak and vanilla, blended with malty sweetness. The middle brings out rum soaked biscuits. Finish is black cherries and booze. Viscous. The flavors pair perfectly here. No hard edges. Despite all the dessert flavors this ale is never too sweet. Another barrel aged winner from Founders.

BottledEye: Deep, clear ruby color. Small head.Nose:Lots of Bourbon, some marzipan, toffee and booze. Mouth: Surprisingly thin.Tongue: Lots of Bourbon, toffee, licorice and booze.Brain: Too thin, too boozy, quite over rated.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2014 355ml bottle (Kittys, Helsinki)
Beautiful buttery bourbon barrel aroma. Black, small tan head settles to a ring. Smooth soft palate, gently carbonated. Lovely soft smooth roast, nothing aggressive to it. I could fault it by saying its over sweet, but its not, its correctly sweet for the style. Finish continues the butter bourbon theme. Pure liquid pleasure. So easy to drink, no booze at all. Basically, Im a sucker for bourbon when presented as such a beautiful decoration to a lovely solid otherwise-gimmick-free stout.
Rerate: 355ml bottle (Koht, Tallinn)
Lovely sweet buttery aroma. Buttery bourbon vanilla and tons of caramel. Not quite as good as I remember, but to be honest this isnt cool enough, so its a bit heavy.

Bottle 355ml.
Pours very deep amber/burgundy/brownish with low beige head. Some lacing. Aroma is of caramel, malt, sugar, alcohol, molasses. Taste is of sugar, bourbon, caramel, alcohol, some bitterness, slight oak, molasses, fruits, citrus. Palate: Full bodied. Soft carbonation. Overall: Good. Not really drinkable, but not cloying either. Would not seek out this one, but its a nice offering.
För att vara en scotch-Ale var jag väldigt nöjd. Väldigt whisky aktiv med malten och ekfatslagring.

Poured from 12 oz bottle.

Appearance - 4/5 - nice looking beer. dark brown/red color, nice tan head on it that leaves lacing coating the glass.
Smell/Aroma - 9/10 - nice vanilla/scotch/caramel/ toffee/butterscotch.
Taste - 10/10 - great. Vanilla, caramel, toffee, butterscotch, booze, scotch/peat flavors. Raisins and plums. Oak. 
Palate/ Mouth feel - 5/5 - nice medium-heavy mouth feel. Creamy. Alc present but should be at 10.2 % Aftertaste is boozy scotch w vanilla , cream, caramel flavors. 
O - 4.75 - great beer, would love to put it up against the other wee heavys
Draft - Sweet caramel and some barrel notes. Cloudy amber with a thin beige head. Nice oaky caramel notes with sweet vanilla and a bit of booze.

frothy, white foam, great lacing, muddy dark brown appearance. Toasted coffee, bourbon, smoky, and light hops aromas. Full body, light carbonation, with an interesting finish. It was Founders day at Hopcat in East Lansing, MI. This Backwoods Bastard was special because it had been aged for a year. They tagged the 2013 at the end of the label on the menu. Very intense flavor rush.
Caramel, roasted malt, alcohol, hint of vanilla. Dark brown, tiny head. Tulip.

355ml bottle. Pours a dark slightly hazy reddish brown with a thin orangish-tan head, and some serious lacing. Aromas of caramel, butterscotch, oak, and a light smell of raw pumpkin. So much caramelly goodness, the bourbon oak really comes through. Up front, the taste is raisin, dates, caramel, alcohol, buttery oak, and light molasses that lead into MORE oak, butterscotch, maple syrup, pecan, light hops, and roasty malt/coffee notes in the big finish. Its a complex beast of a beer, and you notice new things with every sip. It really does live up to the hype. Well done Founders.
Carmel, nutty and chocolaty. No strong after taste. Clean finish in the end notes.....

Bottle thanks to Hammy78, thanks Adam! Pours a really dark red with a really small head that still leave good lacing. Nose is of buttery caramel, bourbon and coconut, nice. Taste is moderately sweet, offers some nice caramel and smoke. Bourbon is definitely part of the experience but it doesnt take all the place. Body is full, carbonation on the lower side and mouthfeel syrupy. Some alcohol can be felt but I would never have guessed that this is 10+% ABV. Nice if not just a touch too sweet.

Wow, the aroma from this is sensational, I dont wear aftershave, but if i could take this aroma and put it on my neck I would! Smokey scotch , dark chocolate, boozy cherries. Almost a shame to drink it! The taste is brilliantly balanced, sweet but still very drinkable. A slight carbonation would have made me score it even higher . World class.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2015 Bottle at konttori, tampere. Hazy dark reddish brown color, tanned head. Aroma is rich malty, sweet, cherries, rye. Full body, sweet, cherries, rye, malty, oak. Hint of alcohol doesnt bother.

Rerated at ølfestival 2015.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks DSG. Pours red to brown with a beige head, aroma of bourbon, vanilla, coconut, toffee, wood and cake, flavor of malt, toffee, vanilla, wood and bourbon, malt acidity, medium to full bodied. Great

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2014 On tap at Brewery. Reddish brown. Bourbon smell is good times. Taste is butterscotch and bourbon - very nice - yet very thin on the palate. Some vanilla and bitterness on the finish - nice drinkable ten percenter.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2014 Tasted in a face off with Tempest Old Parochial. 

Superb sweet complex bourbon and malt nose. Little head though what is there leaves some good lacing. Deep orangish brown colour.Medium to full bodied and somewhat supple. Very good and tasty. But its mercilessly steamrolled by the bigger deeper and more Scotch Old Parochial.

Bottle @home. Pours brown, thin tan head. Slight whisky on the nose with some vanilla. taste wise, sweet but also a bit of smoke, creme brulee and a touch of licorice. This is both warming and wonderful.

@Basunen: tydlig söt och maltig doft. Stor fishermansmak av fat, malt och alkohol. Tydlig bourbon i eftersmaken. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle.Dark Brown colour with small head.Aroma of Vanilla oak and borbon,smooth and nice Warming with sweet taste of dried berries and caramel,sweet and strong flavor, with good well balanced finish.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2014 355 ml bottle @ UkkometsoRuby reddish brown clear beer with dense blonde head. Aroma and flavor have cocoa, creamy toffee, vanilla, dark fruits and some alcohol. Flavor adds some dry wood as well. Finish has a bite of bitterness and ends with alcohol. Mouthfeel is quite oily and thick with medium carbonation. Nice for slow sipping but the flavors are not the most enjoyable to my taste. Also the alcohol is annoyingly strong.
2013 vintage. Pours dark brown/maroon with thin tan head from bottle. Sediment throughout. Sweet oak and vanilla nose. Taste is caramel smoke barrel and vanilla. Thick molasses type feel.
Bottle. Reddish brown colour with a beige head. Malty, sweet, boozy, vanilla, sweet licorice, bourbon, oak, dark fruit.
UPDATED: FEB 2, 2015 Pours a dark brown color with a thin white head. Has a strong, delicious scotch and caramel aroma. Flavor is sweet caramel and scotch. Goes down smooth. Perfection.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2014 Bottle from The Bottle Shop, Cardiff. Pours reddish brown, a little tan head with good lacing. Aromas of dark fruits, caramel, smoke, the bourbon and oak give a sweet, boozey touch. Warmth in the finish, resin too. Sweet and a little bitterness, alcohol and a touch of spice. Medium-full body. Nice stuff.

12 oz bottle. BB 24/08/2014. Konttori, Tampere, Finland.
Dark reddish brown colour with a tiny off-white head.
Dark fruits, sweet malt, dark hops and barley wine in the aroma. 
The flavour is not as barley wine as the aroma is. Dark fruits, dates, figs and sweetness in the flavours. Very sweet and dark fruity flavour. 10.2% very well hidden. Dark fruity aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours very dark brown with a large fading head.
Nose shows caramel, vanilla, woody oak, bourbon, chocolate and a port note.
Very rich flavours, more bourbon and chocolate, some harsh booze and a woody note.
Carbonation could be a bit higher.

Bottle from Beermoth, Manchester. Clear, but lumpy, very dark, reddy brown. Halo and film of light tan head. In a nutshell, its thick, unctuous, creamy, woody, boozy and smoky. And its one of my Missus favourites. And who am I to argue?

A strong alcohol scent is the first thing that strikes me. The flavor of oak, alcohol and maybe some butterscotch. The aftertaste fills the mouth very well of smokiness and maybe a little caramel. Bitterness is weak but good. Does the alcohol disappears the more you drink this beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

12oz bottle from Breeze Thru, cellared for 5 months; shared with ck1 and my other brother. Pours cola colored with a tan spongey head. Aroma has vanilla, caramel, light peat and some syrup. Taste is of sweet vanilla, caramel and brown sugar. Medium bodied with alcohol. Finishes sweet and long, with some alcohol in the back of the throat. A very nice adaption of a scotch ale!
Dark brown color with a creamy head. Aroma of raisins chocolate and vanilla. Taste of dried fruits, rye bread.

(Bottle, 0.355 l - BB 24/08/2014, at Oluttupa Viisi Penniä, 20140404) The beer poured dark brown and clear. Its head was medium sized, lightly brown and it lasted long. Aroma had vanilla, caramel, toffee and wood. Palate was full bodied and dryish with medium carbonation. Flavours were sweetness, vanilla, wood, malts, banana, caramel and bitterness. Afterrtaste had vanilla, sweetness and bitterness. The vanilla was a bit too heavy but otherwise very good beer.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2017 355ml bottle @ Oluttupa Viisi Penniä, Helsinki
BBE 28/08/14 - 
Pours dark reddish brown with a smooth light brown head. Nice aroma of strong bourbon notes, wood, oak, vanilla, malts and syrup. Taste is smooth, woody and heavy on bourbon notes with some syrupy notes, oak and vanilla. Finish is sweet, a bit thin and malty with some syrupy and bourbony notes. Quite good, but feels like that special something is missing. Still quite enjoyable slow sipper. 9-4-8-3-14. 
Re-tasted on 3.2.2017, 2015 vintage bottle. Loads of berries here, and massive amounts of bourbon. Quite smooth and sweet, slightly earthy and oxidized. Easily drinkable for 11,6%.

Bottle 0.335l at Oluttupa Viisi Penniä, Helsinki. Colour is deep reddish brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Dark fruits, raisins, smoke, wood, bourbon, hints of sweetness and roasted malts. Supersoft but lacks something.

Pours ruby with small beige head. Aroma is liquorice, bourbon, dark fruit, raisins, cocoa, oak, alcohol and some sweet molasses. Quite a melange of competing scents. 
Beautifully smooth. Roasted malt, raisins and some brown sugar in the taste. Alcohol is discernible but not invasive. Growing warm-Scotch bitterness on the back-end. Leaves a dry residue in its wake.

How: Bottle.
Where: From Systembolaget, had at home.
Appearance: Murky brown colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Fruit, caramel, alcohol.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, plums, dried fruit, alcohol. The alcohol dominates a bit too much.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks DSG. Hazy red with beige head. soy, some sea salt and vanilla aroma, sweet, lots of vanilla in the mouth, some chocolate and as it opens - bitter. Smooth, full-bodied, syrupy, long, lingering finish.

Bottle at Beer Hunters. 
Deep clear ruby color, small off-white head. Strong toffee aroma with vanilla. Touch of spicey ginger bread. Medium-bodied. Toffee, vanilla, rye bread, ginger bread, touch of bourbon. Soft palate. Not alcoholic at all. Great.
One of my favorite beers. So good it's damn scary. So high in ABV for the smooth taste that it's hard to believe.

At a tasting, thanks DSG, hazy lightish brown colour, aroma of soy and caramel, hints of dark fruit and cocoa, flavour of dark bread and dried fruits, a bit flat medium bitterness. Quite interesting but nothing more,

A black body with red high lights. A brown head about a few centimeters thick that had some retention. Aroma had a strong bourbon and oak presence initially. Caramel malts and hints of molasses and alcohol. Flavor was true to its bourbon profile. Subtle vanilla and oak complemented the bourbon. Sweet caramel malts balanced out the boozy flavors. Alcohol was a warming sense in the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks troganmi for this bottle! Bottles 9/28/12. Lovely clear deep reddish amber color with a beige head. Lovely aroma of malt, chocolate, cookies, vanilla, some peat, bourbon and some wood. Sweet malty flavor with caramel, some cookies, vanilla, some chocolate, liqueur, bourbon and a finish with a bit of alcohol. Rather full and rounded body.

Woody, bourbon aroma and taste. A bit too boozy for me. Fudge and something very sweet in the taste. Interesting but a bit like the "black ops", its too much at the moment. Forgot posting this, had it beginning of march.
Nice dark reddish colour. Smells slightly smoky whisky. Tastes kind of chocolate and caramel and whisky. Quite soft palate, allots no gas in it. Definitely not my kind of beer
Dark reddish amber with a medium tan head. Fruity and malty tones. malt, fruit, vanilla and woof. Full body with a long bitter sweet finish.
On tap at the KBS release. Had this at the same time as a KBS, but still enjoyed it. Very malty with hints of caramel and oak. Good whiskey touch. Definitely a beer I would try again.
Ooops här var det doft så det räcker! Mycket smörkola, vanilj, sötma o lång fin smak. Beskan finns där men kommer riktigt smygande. Bra avslutningsöl!
Smell of scotch, bourbon, wood. Taste of booz, and barrel char, pepper and malt
Bottle. Rich malty nose with a whiff if bourbon. Whiskey is more apparent in flavour but there is an underlying complexity with brown sugar, vanilla, choc and smoke.
Bourbon Comes through, malty, vanilla, caramel, light hoppiness, ABV evident but well integrated, lovely balance and the aging has really elevated this beer!
bottle. Deep amber with small head. Caramel malt, bourbon, lots of booze and hint of smoke. Intense flavors. Delicious.
Complex aroma of vanilla, bourbon, caramel and figs. The taste is similar. Sweet and soft finish. Great beer!
On tap. Unsure on the age of this one, but last release was about four months ago. Just a fantastic beer in one of my favorite styles. Also great for cellaring.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark clear chestnut pour with thin beige head, aroma has roast along with caramel and a hint of wood, taste had subtle bourbon, spice, vanilla, some earthy roast, cherry, viscous mouthfeel, ABV present, but a decent example of BBA.

12oz bottle (10/05/12). Pours a dirty dark amber color with no head and lots of sediment. Aroma of sweet caramel, bourbon, wood, and dark fruit. Taste of bourbon, oak, caramel, tart cherry, toasted grain, and dark fruit.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2014 Flaska från Systembolaget. Mörkt Brun vätska med lågt ljusbrunt skum. Doftar söt karamellmalt och cocos. Mjuk smak av malt och söt likör typ cocos/kaffe. Fatkaraktär och styrkan finns där också.
Flaska från systembolaget. Vacker mörk kopparfärgad med lite skum. Karamell, ekfat, lite whiskey smak. Mums.

Medium beige head dark misty brown pour strong carbonation aromas honey toffee rich chocolate earthy notes nut rich fruity notes the flavours alcohol the oak and bourbon pleasing vanilla touch resin taste dried fruit honey caramel oak is very nice mild to medium bitter sweetness for balance is a lovely ale mild crispness earthy spice notes the finish very enjoyable best notes the bourbon and oak come in well rich malt earthy tastes creamy note very good ale

330ml brown bottle, pours a clear dark copper colored with a small tan head, that dissipated quickly. Aroma of scotch whiskey, toffee and caramel. Taste of scotch whiskey, butterscotch, muscovado, caramel and faint wooden notes. Taste is light-medium sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied, smooth texture and soft carbonation. Overall a great well balanced beer for the style, with a dominating smooth scotch flavour.

One of the most wonderful beers I was ever allowed to witness. This one is the puriest milk brew with the sweetest and smoothest ending you can imagine. 10 abv going down like the first chocolate you ever tried when you were a kid. Awesome. Just awesome.

Bottle from trade with BenH - many thanks to you! The beer pours out very beautiful in a deep dark colour with steady low head and smooth body. Wonderful aroma of intense chocolate and coffee. Taste of bittersweet chocolate, really good coffee, cake, toffee and woods. Coffee and cake in the finish. Great, absolutely superb and perfect beer. Enjoyed it a lot.

Pours a bloddy mahogany red with small head which diminished right away. Aroma is berries and malts with a lingerinng Scotch. Taste is amazing. Liquid Gold. Berries...Scotch...malts...deliciousness. the alcohol is hidden so well. I wanted to sip this only to make it last longer. Delicious beer.

From a 12 oz. bottle, pours a extremely dark blood-red amber with a quickly dissipating khaki head. Earthly, boozey, and cherry notes are prevalent among the roasted malts. A medium amount of bitterness is consistent throughout the experience, while the booziness is heavily masked, but still noticeable. A somewhat medium body for such a strong ale, finishes with the taste still lingering on your tongue. Overall, a nice Scotch Ale that will keep your mouth engaged throughout the entire experience. Highly recommended.

355mL bottle. BB 24/8/14
Deep mahogany body, holds a dense creamy beige head.
Oak upfront and prominent - notes of butter, vanilla, toasty caramel, charred Bourbon barrel, combining with dried fruits, vinous plum, rich toffee malt, with a hint of roast & fortified wine-like booziness.
Full body, rich & sticky without being overtly sweet or cloying. Low carbonation, long smooth finish.
Palate continues with spiced dried fruits, toasted & charred oak notes, rich toffee malts, dark fruits, vanilla and whisky undertones. Long warm finish, good hit of bitterness, very satisfying. Great balance & flavour!

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Pours ruby-mahogany with a beige head. Aromas of light smoke, vanilla, oak, caramel and bourbon. oak, bourbon, vanilla, caramel, light smoke, and some dark fruits. Tastes of nutty caramel, inputs of dark fruits and oak, some chocolate with a finish of bourbon. I would call this a barley wine.
roasty, leather, alcohol, butterscotch, licorice,red, brown, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, medium body, sticky, soft carbonation,
Oh my, this is a very special beer. Pours dark red/brown with a tiny white head. So smooth, rich deep malt and Bourbon flavours. You must try this!

Wow! This is truly a masterpiece! 

Clear dark amber-red with a beige, fluffy head. 
Nose: Honey, vanilla, single malt whisky, oak, dried fruit, toffee, caramel malt, bourbon and licorice. Oh! Its so complex! I love it! 
Taste: Butter, fudge, bourbon, oak, vanilla, caramel, alcohol, nuts and brown sugar. 

A full body with a great complex texture. Little carbonation. 

As a lover of great single malt whisky and a good bourbon I naturally fall as a rock for this. Its heaven on earth...
Ap: dark ruby, small head. Ar:Loads of bourbon, malt sweetness. T: caramel, bourbon. Very nice!

Not a fan of Scoth Ale/Wee Heavies usually, but this beer is amazing! This may be one of my top 5 beers I've ever had. The amazingly complex bourbonesque-scotch greatness leaves the most awesome lingering taste in your mouth. Must try for any beer lover!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours like murky dirty water, thick, brown and hazy, very little to no head.
Earthy nose, strong malt whiskey aromas and spicy hops, caramel and licorice.
Hits hard with alcohol, lots of smooth vanilla bourbon and a harshness for malted scotch. Thick and chewy, big caramels and cola, but not sure if its beer or whiskey liquor, so much depth.
The finish is sweet and smooth, with a nice spice to tingle on the tongue.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a cloudy burgundy brown with barely any head. Smells of oak, vanilla, hint of smoke or peat. Taste is sweet and bitter with some burn and a bit of spices - oak, vanilla, cherry, peat.

Bouteille 330ml, gracieuseté de BlogueDeBieres, merci! Couleur acajou foncé présentant des reflets rouges, mousse moka riche et crémeuse laissant une dentelle savonneuse. Arôme de noisette grillée, beaucoup de boisé, malt grillé, caramel foncé, bourbon. Goût de caramel, alcool, boisé, tire dérable, légère amertume de caramel brûlé en arrière-goût. Carbonatation moyenne, corps dense, collante.

Pours black with small head. Purest, richest vanilla and burnt caramel. Caramel and oak on the taste with a bit of roast and definite alcohol sweetness. Lingering, warming sweet finish. Simply fantastic.

Dark fruit, vanilla and bourbon on the nose. Taste is more of the same with just a hint of chocolate on the finish. Mouthfeel is full and almost creamy. Finishes dry with just enough bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
If I could have one flavor in my mouth for the rest of my life, this would be it. Perfect blend of bourbon and wee heavy flavor profiles. Absolutely amazing beer.

Bottle from Beerhive. Dark, deep deep dark ruby. Head went fairy quickly. Big aroma of Scotch whiskey, peat & molasses, rich malts, pine cones and caramel. Perfect carbonation for this style. Medium body.Tastes great - Bourbon/Whiskey, raisins, prunes, dark chocolates with a hint of orange. Devine!

Poured lightly hazy nut brown with a thin, 1-finger bone-colored head. Aroma of vanilla and wood, with a slight charred note and a sweet, fruity note too. Medium body, very slightly oily. The finish has a light boozy astringency to it. Nutty malt flavor, maybe a touch of stone fruit. Notes of vanilla and wood underneath, with a touch of heat from the bourbon in the finish. Damned good.

Two brothers beer tasting night 2. Red colour shorlived head. Aroma is vanilla malts bourbon wood. Taste is similar very creamy just like drinking a glass of Jim beam/ jack Daniels. Great body smooth mouthfeel soft carbonated. A great drink to savour and drink steadily.

2 brothers tasting day 2. Ruby beer with no head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla and malts. Taste is bourbon, oak, vanilla, figs, caramel and dark berries. Sticky on the palate. Good stuff, but slightly overpowered by the bourbon for my taste.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
Very caramelly and creamy aroma and somewhat buttery 
Dark red/brown colour with beige head 
Very caramelly taste with elements of woody whisky like tones, probably from the wood aging 
Medium body, low carbonation and creamy texture 
Nice and caramelly scotch ale with nice contributions from the barrel aging

Seriously creamy from the body and the smooth, rich spirit-like alcohol warmth. Deep mature fruit and toffeeish malts add depth and broad anchoring of the barrel flavors - sweet vanilla, wood. Will seek out again, such a class act it was easy to sip.

Bottle shared at CBC Clerkenwell during the Gunnar Tasting. Thanks, Matteo! Pours clear ruby with a lightly creamy, beige head. The nose is all ripe fruits with suggestions of alcohol. Medium to big sweet flavor with fruit cake, bubblegum, ripe fruits. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Warming finish with more cake sweetness, rich and well-ripened fruits, toffee. Very nice.

2013 Bottle, poured into mini snifters. Aroma is dark caramel, toffee, raisins, oak, earth, bourbon and cognac, light booze alcohol spice. Pours a pale brown that is a little clear with small ring of lace on the sides of the glass. Taste is raison, caramelized brown sugar, charred oak, bourbon and molasses. Lingering taste of raisins and oak. Body is a little thin with medium carbonation. Alcohol spice is present on the finish with pretty nice warmth after a few sips. Surprisingly not at all tannic, but the bourbon aroma and taste is pretty clear. Overall a pretty nice barrel aged scotch ale. The notes of charred oak work well with the dark syrupy molasses and caramelized sugars.

Draught > Flying Saucer. I didnt get any of the dark cherry or sweet caramel or oaky bourbon barrel flavor bullshit thats fluffed in the description. I tasted a beer that is considering the ABV, an easy sipper w/ some boozy flavors. Thats it, thats the list.

355ml bottle. Pours an opaque very deep ruby, with a small light beige head, which does not last all that well or leave much lacing. Savoury, meaty notes mix with a little nuttiness, raisin and bourbon to create the aroma. Mild spice hops and a little nuttiness up front give way to meaty savoury flavour in the mid-palate. Mild oak and plenty of smooth bourbon sweetness make up the finish. It?s odd - I really do not enjoy bourbon, but I love the effect its barrels can have on beer, and this is a classic example of that.
Aromas of sweet caramel, roasted malts and bourdon. The aromas flow into the beer with a long slightly bitter finish. The 10.2 abv does not play into the beer. Enjoyable
A masterpiece! Beautiful dark maroon color. Plum, cherry, and oak very present in the aroma. Can definitely taste the bourbon, but its not overwhelming. Nicely balanced.
Pours a very brown with a brown head. Aroma is malt, caramel, chocolate, whisky and woody notes. Taste is medium to high sweet leading to a big woody finish.

355ml bottle 
10.2% ABV 
King/Spadina LCBO Outlet (Toronto, Ontario, Canada)
December 13, 2013 
Part of the Founders Release at the LCBO. The beer pours a translucent dark brown with a thin tan ring for a head that laces well. Aroma is dark fruit, molasses, and bourbon. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with average carbonation. Flavour is strong on the bourbon with the caramel and roasted notes in the background.

Bottle. Cellared since late 2011. Pours very dark brown with a thin, fizzy, beige head. Tastes sweet and strong, like caramel, toffee, raisins, plums, booze. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like very strong alcohol, raisins, and toffee sweetness.

Bottle, about 6 months old, into a tulip.  Pours a dark red with no head forming, still, no lacing.  Looks like red wine.  Aroma - sl bourbon, chocolate, blackberry, slightly metallic.  Body is medium to full, slightly foamy, carbonation is low.  Taste is initially chocolatey, mild buttery bourbon, some vanilla, malted milk biscuits, finishes with some vibrant fruity notes.  I agree with the earthy spice and cherry description. Alcohol doesnt come through at all.   Im pretty impressed with this one.  Very nice.
Bottle. Creamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Red amber colour. Heavy malty and hoppy aroma. Heavy btter flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. Wonderfull.
sweet malty bread aroma,red/golden,light brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, soft carbonation, creamy, nice whisky finish.

Dark amber and clear. Has an off-white head, medium duration: Aroma is sweet, yeasty, some coconut, faint vanilla. Sweet flavor, notes of the barrel, light smoke too, harmonic bitter finish. Creamy texture.

2013. Bottle (DOB 10/3/2013) poured into a snifter, consumed on 2/14/2014. Pours a dark ruby brown color with about a finger of off-white head. Aromas of big bourbon, coconut, vanilla, slight dark fruit, caramel Tasting notes of big bourbon, scotch, caramel, dark fruit, oak, toffee. Medium body with a semi-dry finish. Very nice bourbon barrel aged scotch ale.

2012. Bottle (No bottle date but purchased in December 2012) poured into a snifter, consumed on 2/14/2014. Pours a dark ruby brown color with about a finger of off-white head. Aromas of scotch, faded bourbon, dark fruit, oak. Tasting notes of dark fruit, light bourbon, scotch, caramel. Medium body with a semi-dry finish. Prefer this fresh, with a year on it there seems to be less bourbon and more sweet, dark fruit notes.
(StLCoB tasting) brown with off white head. Aroma of sweetish malt. Flavor is sweet malt, dark fruits, whisky

Bottle. Almost clear brown/copper liquid with small off-white head. Aroma of raw sugar, raisins, raw sugar, toffee, vanilla, coconut, oak and bread. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of raw sugar, toffee, raisins, vanilla and coconut. Medium to full bodied with low carbonation. Really good.

Bottle, 02/09/2014. Pours deep earthy brown, ruby highlights, white head fades to a swirly haze on the surface, medium lacing built up around the glass. Aroma is buttery dark caramel, fruity overtones, touch of spices with vanilla cream and oak. Taste is caramel, moderately sweet with roasted bitterness to balance, lingering vanilla bourbon notes. Medium body, drinks nicely. An annual favorite release of mine, nice.

Poured from the bottle. Smells of oak and bourbon. malty goodness. maybe a little dark fruit. the oak is pretty much the main characteristic. A nice dark brown color with little head. The taste is very good. Oaky, lots of bourbon, very malty. Just like the smell. One of the better scotch ales I have had.
Sweet toffee, butterscotch, bourbon, and oak. The flavors are smooth and oaky, candied orange peel with spice, delicious. A little one note but still a fantastic big olmalt monster.
Bottle. Ruby with a thin head. Aroma is toffee malt. Flavor is toffee, wood, spice on a warming peppery caramel finish.

Bottle at home. Pours a dark browny red colour with a thin off white head. Aroma has a lot of dark fruit and toffee. Full body, medium carbonation. Lovely - big sticky, yet smooth with lovely dark fruits, a little veg, grass, leaves, bark. Lovely.
Sample at a tasting. Orange-ish body with a tainted medium head. Roasted and sweet malts, a hint of oak and alcohol.
Light brown pour with a beige head. Malty caramel, booze, hints of chocolate, berries, citrus, bread, oak. Full bodied ale and very nicely balanced. Doesnt seem 10.2% abv so be careful. Dont quaff.

Smells of vanilla maybe some oaky wood and boozy. Sweet aroma. Taste is not boozy at all, get some sweet, oak, and vanilla. Carbonation dies fast, but the flavors are great!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
January 12, 2014. 355mL bottle from LCBO at Queens Quay and Yonge. Caramel colour. Oak nose, with a hint of smoke. Very prominent toffee flavour while sipping. Very nice beer.

Bottle, 13C. Clear dark brown with a fine beige head that fades to a coat that lasts. Boozy, fruity aroma with raisins, prunes, bread, toffee. Slightly syrupy, lowish carbonation. Really not that heavy for >10%. Plenty of bourbon in the taste too (Im not much of a fan) but it doesnt overwhelm the beer: firm, slightly spicy and tobacco bitterness at the end helps hold things in check. Raisins, prunes, molasses, some mocha. Dangerously drinkable. Not all that complex really but the beer more than holds its own. Well priced for Australia too.

Pours an amber-brown with a light beige head. Aroma is caramel, toffee, and light bourbon notes. Flavor is malt, caramel, toffee, chocolate with plenty of bourbon and some sweet alcohol with a slightly fruity finish. Full body with light carbonation and a chewy mouthful. Not too boozy either for the ABV. Very tasty sipper here.

Toffee colour with a dirty white head. Some nice bourbon on the nose, not overpowering though. Big sticky mouthfeel, loads of body. Nice bitterness but quickly cut by alcohol and rich caramel flavours. When this thing warms up the bourbon comes out to play. Sick beer. Such balance so taste wow beer.
Bottle to snifter. Pours a rich brown with no sediment and a nice cream colored head. Smells of yeast, bourbon, and malt. Tastes of butterscotch, alcohol, caramel and raisins. Sweet!
355ml bottle. Pours dark caramel with a medium head. Aroma is bourbon and toffee. Taste is mostly soft bourbon with a little wood and toffee in the finish.
