bottle from jarrod. thanks brother. hazed not quite opaque brown. smells of cinnamon and sweet bourbon with some lingering caramel. sweet caramel flavor with some rich chocolate. eat from the booze starts to emerge as it warms. bourbon notes play along throughout and leave a lingering easy touch on all other flavors. lemon meringue flavor with the sugar daddy flavor of the finish all bourbon kissed. good times.

Poured from a tap. Medium amber color, light off white head. Malt and bourbon aroma. Sweet bourbon malt flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle from Appellation Wines.
Appearance - chestnut brown with a chink of reddish-brown. A decent cream head. 
Nose - nuts and going into marzipan a little. 
Taste - cherries, amaretto biscuits
Palate - medium to full bodied with a big creamy texture and a relatively refreshing finish.
Overall - a lovely complex beer.

Bottle share at CBC clerkenwell at the Gunnar Tasting. Thanks to whoever brought this gem. Ruby red coloured pour with a thin off white head. Aroma is sweet complex caramel, honey. Flavour is tasty rich caramel honey, wood and touch of toast. Medium full body.

Caramel, oak and smoke aromas come off the dark, dark brown body. Tints of Ruby when its held up to the light. The oak and caramel malts really come across in the flavour. There some scotch notes present as well and just at the end a touch of smoke to round it of. There is a sweetness and bitterness that lingers in the finish. Tasty. Will be interesting to try this with some age on it.
On tap at Links taproom. Aroma is sweet bourbon. Flavor is sweet with considerable Bourbon barrel flavour. Noticeable vanilla notes. Good but a bit one note.
Everything about this beer works. The bourbon nose, the caramel and oak flavor, and the cherry bourbon finish. Definitly a sipper.

355ml bottle, pours dark brown with an off-white head, caramel, fudge, biscuit malt goodness, raisin, sultana, the alcohol is hidden well but adds flavour in the finish, carbonation starts out lively but calms to be quite soft. Finish is balanced and the finish is short leaving a lingering toffee and pecan after flavour. Sweet and short.

Appearance is brown with dissipating head but good lacing. Taste is wonderful vanilla and bourbon with little alcohol burn. Mouth feel is nice and lasting but not too thick. Founders beers have some of the best mouth feel around. This is a definite goto beer when Im looking for something I know will put me in a good mood.

On tap at founders into tulip. Grand Rapids. 

Appearance: deep brown with a rim of tan head. 

Aroma: molasses, caramel, strong oak, vanilla, whiskey notes. Very nice. 

Taste: sweet up front. Slight bitterness in the finish. Warning alcohol.

Palate: full body. Thick texture and mouthfeel. Mild carbonation. 

Overall: complex and delicious. Great flavor and body. Excellent strength.
Smokey and woody flavors with a distinct whiskey/ scotch addition. Very smooth and drinkable so this is a beer youll have to be careful with. A sipping beer that goes down a little too well.

Bottle. Brown with tan head. Malty aroma, chocolate and vanilla. Flavour is quite bourbon dominated but very nice, lots of vanilla with some chocklate and a roasty oak flavour, sweeties. Some sweetness and alcohol well hidden. Very tasty

At cellar temperature and into a stumpy tulip. Ruby hued, deep, muddied by yeast and lacking a crown. Poignant, olfactory retarding, mousy, vanillin and Chinese lactic candy on the nose. Rancid butter, Ovaltines, MILO, cheap chocolate biscuits - a strangely, non-welcoming musk and the palate is much the same. SO much diacetyl - slick and like licking the real thing. Booze, vodka-like burn; did I miss something - this is not good at all. Roasted chestnut and hazelnut, chocolate coated hazelnut even; the only favourable character. Squeamish! Just yuk, to be brutally honest. (35,5cL, no date stamp, Thirsty Camel, The Quarie, Hammond Park)

355ml bottle from Appellation Wines, Dalry. Pours clear chestnut brown, thin off-white head. Aromas mostly dark sugars, light bourbon. Taste has vanilla and hazelnut. Thin texture. Bit disappointing after the breakfast stout, but still good.
Pours a deep red brown, with minimal head. Taste is caramel, honey, maple syrup, giving way to oak and plum fruits with a drier alcoholic finish. Taste is complex and evolving. A superb scotch ale.

Bouteille 12oz. 10.5% Couleur brune foncée, reflet rougeâtre, mousse beige foncée fugace. Arôme de sucre dorge, caramel, chêne et un peu de fumée. En bouche, une rondeur divine, notes de chêne, alcool, tourbe, un peu de fruits confits et un peu damertume en finale avec le chêne sucrée qui sétend. Excellente beer.
Pours a dark brown-amber with no head. Has a strong scotch, malt and hard alcohol aroma. Taste is really strong with hard liquors, malt and dark fruits. Has a hard alcohol aftertaste.

Bottle from Mane Liquor Warehouse of Peculiar Pleasures. Pours near-black redish brown with a creamy khaki lacing and receding head. Upfront aroma of freshly fallen coconut from the mid to upper littoral zone from Ko Phi Phi, mixed with a 9 year, 3 week, 2 day and 49 minute old Bourbon from the Kentucky border. What a nose. Taste is lots of coconut, bourbon and butterscotch. Phenom. Big chewy mouthfeel, killer drop.

Clear and deep ruby red body. Hints of caramel on the aroma but replaced quickly by dark fruits. Taste is smooth, alcohol is noticeable but very pleasant, dark fruits once again come through in the taste. Excellent.

12oz bottle. Cloudy mahogany with a thin tan head. Aroma is dark fruits, vanilla, bourbon, oak and coconut. Taste is brown sugar, caramel, molasses, bourbon, dark fruits, spices and smoke with earthy notes. Nice alcohol warmth. Medium to full body, soft but prickly carbonation, oily and creamy texture. Nice sipper.
An absolutely amazing barrel aged option. Their scotch ale aged to perfection ... and you gotta love the marketing. A Grand Rapids favorite!

Darker burnt cherry wood to brown colour with a tan head. Huge aroma with big flavours and as it opens up it gets even more intense. Malty, scotch, caramel, molasses, vanillin and some dark fruit. On the palate it is rich and warming, great length with a sweet finish. It just gets better with each sip! Love it!

Deep mahogany pour with a short, tan head that leaves a ring of lace. Theres so much going on in the nose here and its all really nicely integrated. Vanilla, bourbon, wood, honey, big nuts, something floral, cooked red/purple fruits, peat. Just as interesting on the palate although the flavours are more condensed than they are on the nose. Still lots of whisky and vanilla, light wood notes, full bodied, sweet and warm. Excellent.

355 mL bottle. Pours dark mahogany with a khaki cap of head. Massive nose of bourbon, oak, vanilla, char, and deep caramel malt. Smoke and cherry cough drop like phenolics. Moderate sweetness offset by the heavy oak and a nice hop bite. Full bodied with average carbonation; warming alcohol. An absolute monster of a brew. Prefer this many times over the original.

Poured from bottle, dark brown very small head. Smell of dark raisins and whiskey. Huge oak and whiskey/alcohol flavors , with some nice sweetness to balance it out. Smooth all around. Great scotch ale.

OK...I admit that I had this after drinking several Bells Hopslam pints (on tap) at Tree Tops in Gaylord,MI, but man does this hold its own. Sticky and complexly sweet this Scotch ale is silky smooth with amazing whiskey flavors and aroma. Beautiful swamp fire funk from what I assume is peat smoked barley. A scotch ale to be reckoned with...
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text: Shared bottle at CBC, Clerkenwell. Pours clear dark brown with a tiny tanned head. Aroma of whisky and raisins. Taste is sour/sweet malts, lots of raisins and soft toffee, some wood as well, lingering caramel and toffee.

Ive tried to get my hands on this for a while now and finally managed to get a 4 pack of it recently. It pours a nice deep brown/mahogany color and has very little head. The aroma is reminiscent of quality whiskey. The taste is all up front whiskey, wood and alcohol but in a very balanced way that is quite appealing. I will definitely be looking for this again next year.

Draft at railroad. Pours fairly translucent reddish brown with no real sustainable head. The aroma has huge caramel, immense vanilla, some bourbon, pretty sweet. The taste has a ton of caramel sweetness followed by vanilla bean and extract, a tad bit of alcohol, not overly bourbon but present. Not a mind blower but a very enjoyable sipper.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2014 Bottle at CBC Clerkenwell share thanks to Teorne. Pours dark brown with clear edges and small but firm khaki head. Nose is very raisin and date forward with bourbon spice, milk chocolate and maple syrup. Sweet and dark fruit focus. Taste is sweet vanilla, big raisin and prunes, honey, bourbon spice, big oak and caramel. Sticky and silky sweetness. Fair heat but works and is quite pleasing. Very nice stuff

2011 bottle. Somewhat mellow aroma of heavy caramel, syrupy malt, light bread dough, and old oak. Gorgeous dark amber color with golden highlights at the edges, and no head. Smooth bourbon taste (without any boozy heat) and heavy oak are the dominant flavors early, with the typical scotch ale notes of light caramel and toasted malt in the background. The dry woody tone grows midway through the brew, and is joined by a flour-heavy, raw dough flavor, and a hint of peanut butter and raspberries. The beer is pretty darn close to still and oxidation is fairly apparent throughout. I think this one is a bit past its prime.

355 mL bottle from LCBO served cool in a tulip glass. Deep ruby mahogany with a thin reddish-tan rim. So big and rich and sweet, ruins if brown sugar, a little molasses, dark dried fruits, vanilla, chocolate notes, a little brown liquor/bourbon, very rich, slightly boozy...amazingly restrained considering the alcohol content. Medium-full body with reasonable, pillowy carbonation. Tons of sweet, rich malts, a lot of brown sugar, a little molasses, more barrel character than the nose, dark dried fruits, more alcohol too, but not too much...a sipper, vanilla and chocolate as well, big, rich, lovely; sweet with sufficient bitterness and a long, thick, very malty and somewhat boozy finish. A masterpiece.

Bottle from Total Wine in Boca Raton, FL. Pours a dark reddish brown with very little head. No real lacing to be seen in the snifter. Aroma of caramel malts, scotch, wood, sweet dark sugars, and roasted malts. The taste was quite the same with the thick malty presence making caramel, toffee, and roasted characteristics shine through. The sugars and spices made an almost molasses cookie taste and finish. It had the scotch ale punch at the end as well. Full body, solid finish. Very well done.

Bottle in a snifter 2.5 months old on the coldest night in recent NJ history -- P: no head, dark dark ruby A: bourbon, scotch, smoke, toffee T: sweet molasses, dark cherry, vanilla oak, perfect warm alcohol aftertaste, big barrel notes, a touch of bitterness. M: medium body, syrupy, warm. Overall, amazing! The epitome of a barrel aged scotch ale. A big beer, definitely a sipper. -- note: I've had one that was aged a year and it was a little better.

Bottle from Stirchley Wines, Birmingham. Smells like a classic Scotch Ale, all sticky malt and raisins. Taste is similarly to style but with added moments of vanilla, perhaps cinnamon and also the Bourbon. Brief finish and didnt really twig the streeeeeength, but who cares - I liked this nice.
Brown tinted red. No memorable head. Molasses, feel, body, aroma. Good, but sweet. Has a tobacco quality. You need to take your time with this one.

Wow! Pours mahogany with limited head and some clumpy lacing. Nose is toffee and raisins. Notes of toffee, raisins, brown bread.
Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Awesome balance everything works together so well. Creamy body with light/medium carbonation. Incredibly drinkable for 10pct!!

355ml bottle from the LCBO. Pours a murky dark ruby with a thick film of a head that fades to a ring almost immediately. Slight sediment floating throughout. Aroma is slightly sweet with big barrel notes. Vanilla, booze, dark fruits, wood, cherries. Smells really good. Taste starts off slightly sweet but not cloying then moves into big barrel notes. Oak and bourbon blended with dark fruits and cherries with a warm, alcohol aftertaste.
Medium-full body with a medium carbonation. Slight syrupy texture in the mouth but not overly thick. A sipper for sure but easy to drink as far as sippers go. Overall this is a supurb beer to have on a -24°c night like tonight. Big aroma and taste notes from the barreling makes this a great beer for anyone interested in barrel aged beer. Well worth seeking out and trying. Would but again. Cheers!

From a bottle. Pours very dark brown with a thin, fizzy, beige head. Tastes sweet and strong, like caramel, toffee, raisins, plums, booze. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like very strong alcohol, raisins, and toffee sweetness.

Bottle thanks to jheath99. Pours deep, dark brown with a ruby tint and creamy beige head. Aroma is raisins, prunes, light alcoholism spice, floral notes, caramel and bready malts, and faint woody notes. Flavor is semi-sweet malts, caramel, dark fruit esters, light booze, tobacco, faint vanilla, and light woody notes; semisweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Bottle at home from drinkstore
Black with tan head collapsing to lacing. Vanilla and coconut nose. Full bodied, medium carbonatiob, sweet oaky vanilla, warming booze, sticky malt, brief finish. Pretty good but a bit heavy for me.

Vibrant mahogany light with brulee head fading. Neat wholesome biscuity sweet nose, Bourbon dripped Twiglets. Sweet, oaty, smoky, Cola, caramel... All in the one gush. Mouthfeel is slick, hum of carbonation fading leads to an uneasy treacle vibe so get this down ye if you get a chance. Finish is bright and dirty mackerel, brulee bitterness and brown sugar coating on the linger. Bottle, Friends Of Ham, Leeds

(355ml bottle from the LCBO) Pours a a very deep mahogany, slightly hazy with a thick creamy off-white head and lots of lace. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, oak, slightly smoky, caramel and brown sugar sweetness, some stewed or candied dark fruit. Flavour is sweet, malty and mouth-filling, toffee/butterscotch, bourbon, some vanilla, a little woody and earthy. Almost creamy in the middle, it dries down with alcohol towards the end along with some slightly chocolate roast, a bit of hop bitterness and a fruity, preserved cherry flavour to add to tastes lingering from earlier. Mouthfeel is moderately full and slightly sticky, carb quite soft, alcohol not hidden but not interfering at all either. Save maybe for more restrained hopping, this is a bourbon barrel barley wine, and a complex, layered and delicious one at that. Lovely.

Bottle from the LCBO. Pours a dark hazy reddish brown with a small tan head. Nose is predominantly bourbon with brown sugar and vanilla and wood. Taste is sweet malts and dark fruits with a vanilla notes that linger. Alcohol content is obvious but not overbearing. Mouth is medium slick with moderate carbonation and a long lingering finish. Excellent sipper.

I live a good bourbon stout. But this fella was way too boozy for me. I could taste a lot of quality brewed into it, but that bourbon feeling once it got deep in the gut wasn't what I was after. One and done.

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Heavy sweet bourbon nose. Candied pecans too. Appearance is dark brown, hazy , reddish. Thick mouthfeel feels great and lush, then turns sweet, then boozy, with a touch of warmth. Palate is sweet, mellow, some vanilla, smokiness. Somewhat nutty, no attempt to hide the alcohol, just an attempt to integrate it. Also, the alcohol is not hot but warm and pleasant. This all works together in a perfect package. A work of art really.

Big flavor of butterscotch with perfectly integrated bourbon. Very well balanced and incredibly easy to drink for its strength. Aroma is slightly muted compared to the taste, but overall a great beer.

The near perfect score is for the drafts I had at Yardhouse. I had a bottle for breakfast the same day and would give the bottle a 4.2 - a different beastie altogether - but still very good! Maybe I need to age the bottles I have left. The best example of one of my favorite styles Ive had, and one of the few beers I will drink all night long due to its delightful complexity and perfect balance. I had three drafts at Yardhouse and could have kept going if it werent for the whole driving home thing.

Murky dark brown, not quite black, with a thin light tan head. Nose is deep and sugary and boozy, with rum raisin and brown sugar, a touch of vanilla and oak, and toasted marshmallows. The flavor is big and malty sweet with earthy toffee and nutty tones of oak, vanilla, dates, brown sugar, ending on a lightly boozy warm note. A wee touch of tobacco throughout, and an almost cocoa tone.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2014 Dark copper pour with an off white head that fades down to a ring. Aroma is strong caramel and ripe fruits with some wood and plenty of bourbon. Taste is sweet overall with caramel, vanilla, wood, and bourbon. Slick sticky palate and some warmth. Fantastic.
Pours murky brown with low head. Aroma is sweet malts and boozy oak, taste is nice sweet malts and light booze finish, tasty!

Faint vanilla and oak on the nose.

Deep ruby red in appearance with a thin slightly tan head.

Tastes sweet; vanilla, caramel, slightly spicy, smokey with hints of dark fruits. Lingering aftertaste.

Very thick, chewy and viscous beer but probably expected for such a high ABV.

Overall a very, very nice beer. Just starting to get Founders distribution in Ireland and Ive yet to be let down by one of their offerings.

Bottle at Taco Mac. Pours brownish ruby red with tan head. Aroma is caramel, oak, raisin and a touch of bourbon. Very sweet, like drinking liquid butterscotch. Medium mouthfeel, smooth and silky. Exceptional beer.

Bottle. Pour is a true scotch ale dark brown/ruby, khaki head, loads of bubbly lace. Nose is pure vanilla, very sweet. Tastes really sweet, roasted malt, caramel, toffee, dark fruits, bitter bite, soft on the mouth, alcohol bite.

Diolch JoeMcPhee. Dirty ruby colour with a thin lace. Chocolate malt, treacle, malassis and liquorice aroma. Fruity melon and raisin flavour. Very surprising liquorice malt and treacle finish. The alcohol is very well hidden. Very nice tasty brew.

Dark toffee colored beer with a thin beige head that disappears almost immediately. Nose is redolent of oak, cream soda, caramel, vanilla, and almonds. Flavor is ridiculous with deep, rich butterscotch, candied nuts, burnt wood, creme anglaise, and port-soaked raisins. Seriously, this is like drinking dessert, but for those without a sweet tooth (like me) it is not something that grows old quickly. Rather, it develops nuances with each sip that keep it new and refreshing. Sick beer.

12 ounce bottle. Pours a translucent dark mahogany brown. Small beige head disappears rather quickly. Lovely roasted malt aroma with notes of oak, burnt caramel, dark fruits and greasy fried chicken. Rich, creamy roasted malt flavor has a big toffee-like character that drifts into a rich butterscotch silky mouthfeel. Very complex and flavorful. Finish is very bourbon-like and earthy. A tremendous brew worthy of traveling many miles to procure.

Ar: Boozy oak, cocoa - brown sugar, caramel, vanilla.
Ap: Hazy brown-red - no head, but a thin ring of foam.
T: Medium sweetness, bourbon, vanilla - graham cracker, cinnamon, toasted coconut - clean alcohol - yellow cake, cocoa, a very slight hint of astringent smoke - low bitterness.
P: Medium-full body, low carbonation - finish is medium-dry.
O: Excellent balance, wonderful oak-bourbon character - sweetness, booze, and malt are in delicious harmony - really a stellar beer.
Best scotch ale I have had. The barrel aging really comes through. Nice hints of funk and candi sugar. Great depth of flavor

355 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a murky amber-brown with thin off-white head. Aroma is rich, juicy dark fruit, candy sugar, bread and oak. Flavour is on the sweet side with candy notes, although does not cross the line into sickliness, with juicy plum, caramel, bread and a gentle oakiness. Oily mouthfeel. A little alcohol warmth in finish. Quite impressive in every respect.

Translucent reddish brown, dense frothy beige head. Nutty, malty, caramel, oak, a little vanilla, raisin, and earth. Sweet, but not as much as in the aroma. Creamy and smooth, a little lighter in body than expected. Long whiskey finish with a mild alcohol presence.

A interesting scoth ale from founders. Really sweet and not very bitter. Pours a dark brown almost black like all stouts. Had at acre. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 2013: Huge nose of mainly vanilla. Some hints of oak, slight bourbon, some molasses, tiny hints of dried fruits and hops. Stunning. Appearance is dark copper red with a tiny film of a head and laces around the glass. Sweet is pure oak and vanilla, some cocoa, sticky sweetness, bourbon, american hops and some slight maltiness. Long sticky finish with the oak running wild. Simply stunning.  4.6
2014: Nose is malty, with some peat and vanilla. Hot and heavy mouthfeel. Slight hint of bourbon, again peat. 2013 was much better. 3.7

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2013 12 oz bottle. Pour is a deep mahogany, dense and a bit murky. A khaki head that diminishes but leaves lacing. Beautiful looking beer. Smell is crazy, big notes if caramel and bourbon, molasses, chocolate, vanilla, faint hops and a slight hint of oak. Definitely a booze note on the nose to let you know its big. Taste is very complex, lots of caramel, roasted malt sweetness, bourbon, chocolate, brown sugar, vanilla, even a sweet citrus note like pineapple maybe. I get some spice notes as well which I cant quite identify. Syrupy slick mouthfeel, like a big beer should be. Huge malt bomb with the bourbon barrel aging to add to the complexity. Alcohol content is only noticeable on the way down which warms your bones just a bit, which is a good thing in December when you live in New England! Awesome brew! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I dont taste the oak at all in this one. I tasted the bourbon only when it really warmed up. Really sweet and syrupy. Booziness is strong. I am not really a fan of scotch ales in general. This one was pretty good, but did not do the trick for me. Tasted medicinal and boozy at times without being able to find the oak flavor. Maybe it was the bottle I got? IDK I can tell it has a lot of flavor, but not necessarily the kind I like.

2011 Bottling.

Aroma: Bourbon, Vanilla, Caramel, Mildly Boozy

Appearance: Dark Brown Hue, Passes Mild Light, Off White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Vanilla, Caramel, Dark Fruits, Mild Bourbon, Mildly Boozy

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Boozy, Mildly Sweet

I should have rated this before now. Pours dark red or amber with some light red to brown head. Nose is bad ass. Complex. Darker stone fruits, sweet, sugary, oak, sweet bourbon, spicy, bready malty bourbon, sticky malts, light booze. Flavor is sweet fruity, bready, and oaky bourbons. Really rich and velvety. medium sweet finish and medium full body. This is quite the awesome beer.
Not an overpowering barrel-aged taste. Nice ale base, good color, aroma. Worth trying.
I wouldnt have expected this to be classified as a Scotch Ale. It has a crazy pungency, lots of dark fruit, an almost sour finish.

Pours a dark brown with a slight purple hue to it. Very thin ring of white head that leaves very little lacing. Aroma is very sweet and malty with some alcohol. Not nearly as hot as I was expecting. A lot of dark fruits. Some fig, plum and cherry. Mouth is very creamy. A ton of vanilla and caramel with some dark fruits. Raisin is very prominent. The alcohol has a stronger presence, but still very subtle. Delicious beer.
Redbownish clouty. Malt fruity alcohohol in the aroma. Raisins, nuts, malt chockolate, vanilla. Nice candy aftertaste.

Amazing nose on this one, full of creamy butterscotch, bourbon notes, vanilla and sweet malt. Could smell this one all day. Fairly clear but dark mahogany color, with a quickly dissipating head. Tastes quite nice, buttery, vanilla, cherry, bourbon on the front end with a slightly hoppy hot aftertaste. Medium bodied and average carbonation. Seems like a great candidate for aging.

Murky medium brown with a very thin tan head, subtle aromas of oak, chocolate, vanilla, smoke. On the tongue a get a huge hit of vanilla and coconut, then followed up by oak, milk chocolate, hazelnuts, a little smoke. As sipper, but great barrel aged beer, big bourbon characteristics. Really great stuff.
Pint on tap came out a clear dark mahogany with not much head. Taste is layered and earthy. Sometimes the scotch comes through then the bourbon. Very nice big sipper on a cold winter night.

Bottle into snifter glass, hard pour yields dark muddy brown color with dark tan head. Aroma of cream, heavy malt, chocolate, smoke, vanilla, maple and slightest hint of oak. Taste adds notes of liquorice, strong vanilla, more oak, brown sugar, marshmallow, bourbon, char, nuttiness and earthy hop bitterness. Heavy body, low carbonation, creamy, rich with malty warm finish. "Malt bourbon" is what comes to mind drinking this, best scotch ale Ive ever had.

First taste is baileys irish cream, bourbon, oak, vanillia, caramel, sweet, malty and absolutely, awesome. Balance is perfect. I love this style of beer: cross between scotch ale and old ale. Great job Founders.

As close to perfect as Ive tasted. The dense, smokey-chocolate-caramel thickness drew me in on scent alone, and the sweetness, oh lord it caressed my tongue in ways I cannot speak of here. You could taste the barrel it was aged in, you could taste the bourbon, even. It was so good I couldnt even take notes, my mind was so consumed with the complexities in this brew.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 Sample at Örebro Öl & Whisky 2013. Sweet malty smell with cyrup. Similar taste with caramel, lots of sugar, cyrup and roasted sugar. Nice beer. Re-rated at a Systembolaget tasting, upping the score by 0,2

Bottle to glass. Pours a deep nut brown color with a think off-white head. Aroma is magnificent with scotch, bourbon, vanilla, caramel, nutty. Flavor is right there with it, with sweet boozy oaky bourbony goodness. Medium creamy body with a lingering bourbon oak character. Alcohol is well hidden. Another Founders gem.

12oz bottle. Murky reddish brown, not much head. Heavy oak and bourbon on the nose - really sweet vanilla and caramel come through. Big bourbon in the taste: oak and vanilla pod. Sweet caramel, biscuit, red fruits. Lingering bourbon and caramel. Big, boozy and great for the price (rare to find an import this good in Ireland at this price). In my mind this is a bit of a 1D bourbon fest, a tasty one nevertheless.

Pours dark amber with small tan head. Aroma of oak, fruits, and malt. Very smooth beer with taste of bourbon. Excellent finish of cherry. Great beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle from Drinkstore. Chesnut brown, big creamy off white head. Looks great. Wood, oak, bourbon, dark fruits - cherries and prunes, smoky peated notes and some liquorice in the aroma. Incredibly complex flavour - sweet cherry, warming alcohol notes, bourbon whiskey, sweet caramel, woody notes, toasted malt all in there. Light body, forward carbonation, finish is long and complex - lots of sweetness and warming alcohol. Really incredible.
Bottle. Dark amber. Aroma of burbon and vanilla. Taste is very similar, with strong flavors of vanilla, burbon and oak. Sweet vanilla aftertaste. A fantastic beer.
Bottle. Pours a dark ruby red. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, oak. Taste is much of the same. Smooth, vanilla takes over at end. Nice beer.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a very dark brown with beige head that quickly dissipates leaving some good lacing. Great looking beer. Aroma is huge. Robust caramel and sweet notes mixed with bourbon. Some roasted earthy notes. Taste definitely does not disappoint. Starts off sweet with big caramel and toffee taste. Followed by bourbon whiskey tastes that blends so well with the sweet caramel taste. Just a hint of bitterness. Very well balanced and complex beer. Really hides the alcohol well. A lot of times I'm not a fan of bourbon barrel aged beers because I think the bourbon dominates the taste too much. Founders has done it incredibly well. Excellent beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

sweet woody aroma with caramel,smoke,maple and whisky in there as well..very dark brown liquid with dissipating head..taste ..wow..BIG beer my first impression is it tastes like marshmallow ambrosia salad if youre familiar.,vanilla,caramel,cream and plenty of unusual fruits (pineapple? coconut?)smoke and whiskey if youre not.,balanced by tingly hops and carbonation.yet slick,creamy and sticky also...very tasty and very unusual..fruity maple aftertaste lasts..overall I hate scotch ales  in general but the other flavors balancing this one makes it very satisfying
Tasty, full on flavours, full bodied, hints of bourbon on the nose same on palate, alcohol very well masked, good length

2013 bottle. Cloudy, murky barrel; sticky tan lace. 

Smells like an open cigar box, and much more barrel than in last year's batch. Can't get over how different this is from the 2012. Oaky, mild boozy sweetness, plenty of bourbon character, quick tinge from the alcohol at the end. Improves significantly as it warms. 

Mouthfeel is reasonably creamy, carbonation is dialed in nicely. This is a tasty beverage, though the 2011 vintage (when fresh) is still tops for me.
UPDATED: JAN 11, 2015 Bottles.  2014.  Very good as long as you like bourbon.  Big fan.  Going to see how it ages. Ages well. 6 months on. Big fan

The aroma is malt forward. Roasted malts, caramel, bourbon and subtle hints of dark red fruit. Pours a ruby brown with an off-whithe ring and no lacing. The taste is rich and malty. Roasted malts, caramel, bourbon, dark fruit notes, with an alcohol finish and lingering aftertaste. Medium body with medium carbonation. The mouthfeel is somewhat creamy initially, but is curtailed by a "warm" alcohol finish. Overall, this is a great sit-by-the-fire-on-a-winters-night-sipper. Well, crafted and enjoyable. Should age well. (I, sadly, missed the smokieness.)

Dark brown pour with minimal head. So much going on with the nose! Big aromas of smokey scotch and roasted malt with bourbon and oak notes. Flavor is big smokey malts upfront, with notes of caramel. The bourbon barrel comes through in the finish wonderfully. Very complex. The abv is extremely well hidden too. Really great beer!

Strong bourbon aroma and flavor from beginning to end. Surprisingly smooth for 10.2% alcohol. One of my favorite scotch ales. Malty bourbon flavor from start to finish. A truly great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: DEC 21, 2013 Has a nice woody scotch nose. Nice smooth sipping beer with strong oak , vannila and bourbon taste. Excellent beer overall.

Had this last year and remembered loving it. Poured into a snifter..
A: Oaky. Boozy. Molasis note. yes..... not bad but not very complex.
A: Pours decently thick especially watching the bubbles rise. Little head. Nice semi transparent brown color.
T: First thought is something like oh my god this is amazing. As the beer finishes the thought continues only more so. If ever a beer was a 10 in taste this is it. Molasses sweetness. Dates. Alcohol cuts through but is more warming and surprising that aggressive. Oaky. Boozy. Finish has a huge bit of malt which is crazy for a beer this strong. Goes down with almost a brandy-like warmth. Just insane. yeah theres some carmel in there as well when the beer warms.
P: Feels smooth on the palate. Carbonation is on the money. Flavor development is also amazing. Goes through many different stages. As mentioned before the alcohol cuts though but not in a bad way, more to remind you that its there.

This beer is simply amazing. The tastes is complex, the palate is great. The weird thing is it doesnt smell that great. Oak and boozy are really the big smell notes. But this one hits where it counts: a must try. (How can it be an overall 20 when the smell is a 7? IDK the sum of the parts is less than the whole?)

I had this at Global Brew. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Taste bourbon, smokey, a touch of sweetness. I thought this was so so. I would skip this down the road.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Oaky bourbon aroma. Dark dark brown in color. Sweet taste with some bitterness at the end. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is bourbon, malt, and some carmel. Pours a copperish brown with little or no head. Taste is bourbon and malts with very little carbonation. There is a little warmth that makes for a smooth drink.
Aromas of oak, bourbon, and vanilla, maybe some cherries. Dark brown with slight tan head. Tastes oakey in a good way, very smooth. Wow, this is a treat.

Tap sample at source 09/2013 and bottle 11/2013. Sweet stuff, Werthers Echte meets coupe brésilienne, old bubble gum hops, stale vintage ale - and yet this is enjoyable and none too heavy. Vegetable, leafy, ashen, smoky hints. All poured next and on top of each other, compared to a few Belgian trappist yeasts this does not have much hypotactic depth, more like paratactic complexity.

aroma is powerful. sweet malt and some smoky scotch aromas as soon as i pour this bottle. appearance is clean & pretty, almost a ruby bronze. Taste follows the sweet scotchy aromas. sweeter than i recall prior tastes. maybe a tinge of alcohol heat on the finish but otherwise very well hidden. palate is lighter than you might expect from such a complex brew but not offensive or disappointing. overall outstanding. I enjoy the hunt more than the actual consumption - but that happens with these type beers (the ones that trend on social media when released). Also - this is a style i dont often drink, so it is refreshingly different to try a malty beer when i tend to pick the hoppy option.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2013 An incredibly complex beer. Aromas of rich woods, caramel and autumn spices. Rich caramel is most present, followed by an infinite array of other flavors. Oak, nutmeg, cider, mixed grains, dark fruits, hints of chocolate, bourbon... The list goes on. It all blends perfectly into a smooth, complex and delicious brew.

Can?t believe I haven?t rated this yet.  May have a scrap of paper with it on it somewhere.  Barrel aged fo sho! Great scotch/whiskey aroma with notes of brown sugar, vanilla, and some awesomeness. Great beer.

10/15/2011. From bottle. Pours deep amber to copper color with a tan head. Aromas of bourbon mostly but with malt, caramel and hints of smoke showing through. Near perfect balance and very complex. Spicy flavors with bourbon, caramel and hops. Definitely a keeper.

Bourbon, bourbon everywhere! And a little sugar. Alcohol is certainly evident on the tongue. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark brown with red tints that has a very nice head and lingering lacing. Nose is of bourbon against a molasses, dark malt and chocolate background. Carbonation is average and the mouthfeel is a light medium. I was expecting a full medium body, but the lightness helps bring the bourbon flavor forward. The 10.2% alcohol is well hidden in this very well balanced beer. Bourbon against the molasses and dark malt backbone is the taste profile. Finishes with bourbon and malt sweetness with a touch of oak and a nice alcohol burn that lingers along with the oak. Another outstanding Founders offering that takes Old Ale brewing to a new level.

Draft. Holy crap! Im not a fan of scotch ales but this is insane! Nice dark rust color with almost ne head. Dark fruit in the nose. Nice thick feel with dark fruit and raisins. As it warms you get a big vanilla and alcohol flavor. Really good.
Draft at Happy Gnome on Sunday. Yummy stuff! Nice bourbon nose. Almost no head. Sweet but complex and nicely warming.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2013 12 oz bottle pours molasses colored with thin off white head mild lacing. Smells strongly of the malt and a little smokey bourbon barrel. Tastes real strong of the bourbon woth some smokey vanilla and nuttiness. Sweet whiskey flavor sticks to the palate. Best consumed at a moderately warm temp...50-55 degrees.

Deep ruby and toffee colored pour. Big light tan head. Plenty of lacing. Bourbony malt aroma. Some notes of raisin and vanilla. Taste of big malt. Some smooth peppery bourbon notes. Sweet finish. Pretty tasty.

Bottle from bytemesis, big thanks. Not much foam from the pour to go with a deep molasses brown color. Terrific aroma combining the sweet malty characteristics of a scotch ale with cherry bourbon. My knock would be that the aroma is not very strong. The flavor adds wood, walnuts, char, vanilla. Noticeable whiskey but it never forgets to be a beer first, which is a problem i often encounter.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2014 Bottle - thanks, J! Pours cola brown with minimal white head. Nice legs on this one, too. Aroma full of sweet dark fruits, vanilla, oak, and maple syrup. Taste: whoa - this is cool. Taste is sweet, following the nose to start, but follows through with a really nice smoky, charred, vanilla / oak character. Alcohol present as well, but in a way that is wholly pleasant. Lingering alcohol warmth. Palate: full body, slick, coating texture. Overall: this does indeed excite the palate. Damned nice beer.

  
After side by side with AleSmith BA/Regular Wee Heavies, this was a close 3rd to the others.  Im dropping it down just a smidge to preserve the appropriate order.
Nice beer overall. Tyranenas "Shaggin In The Wood" is a good equal and may surpass it.
Although its good, its not stunning, so I dont understand the hype. Nose is pleasant and its quite warming in the tummy.

Pours a deep brown, rich, gnarly red. Thin tan head. Fat aroma of dark fruit, bourbon, and dough. Hits of wood, bread, and cherries ride a magical Scotch Ale sweetness. Little punch of bourbon, warming alcohol. Thick and smooth, sticky by the end. Delicious.

Holy cow, this is one mindblowing beer! Poured from the bottle a rich hazy caramel brown with light brown head. The aroma is huge and deserves a long time to enjoy just that - bourbon and caramel and toffee and dark fruits and sweetness. Flavors match. The 50 IBUs are just to keep the sweetness almost in check, but the flavor is definitely sweet and full and huge. This is one to be sipped and enjoyed slowly. Its all the more special as I sought it out and found it on a trip to Michigan, and was only able to bring four back to Oregon - its not available within 1000 miles of home. Man. Founders has a winner with this one and its a shame they dont distribute out west.

Tallahassee, Fl. - New Leaf Market - 12 oz bottle. Dark copper pour, thin mocha colored head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla and molasses. Bold flavor with some molasses sweetness, some over the top bourbon notes, a touch of cherries and vanilla. Mouthfeel has a nice thickness to it. A little too boozy for my taste, but in small doses sits well. A bomber of this would have been too much.
This is one the best beers I have had in a while, pours a darker brown color with a small head. Taste of bourbon, vanilla, scotch prevail throughout the beer. Very enjoyable
Great dark beer that packed quite a punch. Poured supper dark with malt, vanilla, oak, and alcohol notes. Sweet nose and long finish.

Drinking the 2012 batch, cellared for a year. Pours a rich cloudy reddish brown with a minimal head. Aromas are creamy butterscotch, vanilla, milk chocolate, hints of berries, & wood. Flavours of mellow bourbon, and maple added on smooth palate; Excellent!

Poured into tulip. More of a dark amber color with thin lacing. Oak, caramel and roasty notes with a very slight bourbon scent. Very little carbonation and smooth. Slight alcohol warmth in the taste. Vanilla, caramel and oak also come through. Good scotch ale

This beer pours a beautiful cloudy brownish red color with a thick yet small tan head, and the aroma is pure heaven: a mixture of toffee, leather, booze, roasted and caramel malts, and a hint of cherries. The taste is mildly sweet, slightly umami, and a touch sour, mixing together in such a way that toffee is the flavor at the front with a robustness easily taking over. However, the palate is so much more seductive as a result of the full body, boozy yet malty finish, average carbonation, and creamy texture, which seems odd but is actually the perfect combination.

Wow this is good. Huge flavors of vanilla, oak, and a great finish. Mouthfeel is great as well, smooth and not to carbonated. Definitely gets better as it warms and opens up a little bit. Very easy to drink, almost dangerously easy to drink. Wish I could find a lot more of this in my area.

10-12 oz draught, around $5.75, Barley Hopsters (new location), Delaware, OH; served in a Widmer Brothers snifter. Immediately clear that this is chilled too cold. Cola color but thicker; thick, frothy light brown head dissipates into a thin covering. Aroma is the best part; HUGE oaky bourbon smell, dark fruits, dark malt, caramel. Flavor was surprisingly less than huge, but certain big and round, full, and present, however more typical of a very good Scotch while less mind-splattering than the aroma. Frothy, full, heavy mouthfeel; no hint of 10% abv. Very very nice.
This is one of my favorite beers of any style. Its big an boozy, but it works. The bourbon comes through early, but the complexity of the beer balances it out.

Bottle Courtesy of HawkerB. Pours a dark caramel brown. Like a flat coke. Nose is wonderful. Notes of subtle bourbon and sweet toffee. Predominant flavor notes are bourbon and toffee with a bit of alcohol warmth. The 10% isnt hiding anywhere, but its definitely not front and center either. Good Stuff

12oz bottle into nonic. Clear dark ruby/amber with two finger khaki foamy head. Lacing all the way down. Smells of coconut, dark fruits, vanilla, and wood. No obvious bourbon notes. Flavor is malty and sweet with more coconut, vanilla, booze, caramel, and wood. Slight hop bitterness on the swallow. Medium bodied, creamy, low carbonation, and a touch thin.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2014 Bottle: had 2010 - 2013. This review based on the 2013 release (the best of them all, IMO)... thanks, Jeff! Deep mahogany body with a creamy, khaki layer of foam that rests as a thin layer, leaving moderate lacing behind. Aroma is full of toffee, butterscotch, vanilla, very subtle & smooth bourbon, light oak, & a faint hint of dark fruit sweetness in the back-end. It tastes like a caramel & toffee truffle drizzled in warm vanilla. Light woody bourbon hints, but extremely smooth overall. Sweet, sticky, but controlled. A touch of grape & prune, though the flavor is dominated with vanilla & caramel cake. A delectable treat... 2013 release was far better than previous ones in my opinion.
Taste strongly of bourbon and vanilla. Pours dark with a strong bourbon cent. Very subtle taste of chocalate and cherries.

Bottle from Brewfest. Deep copper amber pour with a bubbly white head. Aroma of vanilla, oak, toffee and caramel, brown sugar, bitter chocolate and bourbon. Thick, sweet flavor without being cloying, wonderful blending and hints of chocolate and spice. Damn tasty.
omg!! one of the best beers i ever had!! i have died and went to heaven!! so hapy i tried it

Bottle. Bottle date 09/27/13. Poured black, with little to no head and lacing. Taste is dark bitter chocolate, cocoa, vanilla, big bourbon presence. Taste is big bourbon, boozy, sweet chocolate, vanilla, and oak. Good, would like to see how more age treats this.

Pours brown with a tan head. Aroma is creamy, smooth (almost chocolatey) malts and bourbon. Taste is a perfect blend of the above with a nice bourbon background. The palate slowly moves to an easy malty bitterness. The 10.2% ABV is only noticeable in that it adds to the viscocity. Nothing boozy about this one. Awesome!

Pours a deep dark reddish brown color with light tan head. Big smooth oak aroma, vanilla, dark fruits. A lot of woody oak character in the flavor as well. Vanilla oak notes, toasty, some dark fruit character in the back. Big on the oak throughout but smooth.

Bottle. Pours a beautiful ruby color with minimal head or lacing. Aroma of oak, scotch, caramel, vanilla. Nice thick mouthfeel and taste of a true bourbon barrel aged scotch ale. Definitely more complex the closer to room temp this delicious beer is at!!

----Hophaze out

Pours a dark reddish brown from the bottle with little to no head or lacing. Aroma is big on the bourbon, hints of sweet vanilla and oak. Taste follows, definitely a bourbon barrel aged beer. Nice and thick, sweet and sticky. Very nice.

Pours a deep ruby brown. Medium creamy beige head, partially lasting with lace. Deep complex aroma. Rich malty, caramel, beautiful integrated sweetish bourbon, vanilla, touch of peat/smoke, some dark fruit. Medium body. Flawlessly balanced. Alcohol warmth is just right, as is the level of sweetness. smooth luscious and creamy. Excellent.

Strong oak, smoke, alcohol (bourbon) aroma. Sweet. vanilla.
Tastes similar but a little sweeter and smoother than the aroma. Caramel, malt, smooth bourbon, a little smoky, a little alcohol warmth.
Awesome beer. Definitely want to drink this at room temperature. Hint of vanilla, sweet bourbon and smooth finish.
This brew could get a person in trouble if not sipped. Color is darker brown with a smaller head. The brew shines in hiding the alcohol. Very smooth and easy to drink. Sweat bourbon flavor.

Dark reddish-brownish in color with a dense tan head. Scents of vanilla and oak wood. Instant excitement on the palate with Carmel sweetness followed by a scotch whiskey bite. As the flavors marinate you get the perfect balance of oak and vanilla. Well done brew indeed!

It was hard to give my first five, but I can find no fault with this masterpiece. It is worth the price just to smell this. Make sure you drink this room temp, because it can have a medicinal sharpness when cold. Smoother than margerine on a muffin, with full but not thick mouthfeel. Oak, butterscotch, cinnamon, bourbon, toffee, caramel...wow. Badass and articulate at the same time. This is the scotch ale all others wish they could be.
Sweet caramel, roasty malts, and bourbon aroma. Thin tan head and dark red body. Sweet warm carmel and bourbon flavors with a peaty malt. Smooth and a little alc heat on the palate.

Malty bourbon oaky smell that is enough for two beers in 12oz bottle.
Tiny slight head of soft beige bubbles that belie a fair amount of carbonation; greater retention with warming
Deep peaty malt chocolate carmel cake dipped in a bourbon barrel with a cherry on top.
YUUUmmm. Good thing I hate cake, pass the BB please.
user_location: Armpit of the Panhandle, Florida, USA

text: Bottle. Pours a dark ruby brown with a beige head. Caramel and bourbon on the nose. Very flavorful with brown sugar, caramel, butterscotch, and a bourbon finish. Smooth and complex - an excellent brew for slow sipping!

Sip and enjoy you Founders lovin bastards because this brew has character. Full, sweet, and full of barrel aged Scotch love. Not for kids, when Bam Bam grew up he drank this. I suggest pairing this beer with Sling Blade. 5 stars, I reckon....

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From 12oz Bottle. Pours deep orange brown with a thin tan head. Smells of carmel, cinnamon, raisins and dates. Lightly carbonated with a slick mouthfeel. Taste is carmel sweet with bourbon overtones balancing some orange peel bitterness. The finish has bourbon and the lingering flavors of dark fruit, carmel and toffee balanced be a slight hoppiness. This is a very complex scotch ale with lots if evolving flavors as it sits in your palate. The bourbon barrel aging is done perfectly. One of the best scotch ales I have had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours opaque dark brown. Aroma of dark fruit and wood. Taste of booze and raisins with vanilla hints.

Poured into a Founders pint glass a gorgeous deep burgundy brown with a thin beige head.
Aroma is sweet bourbon caramel.
Flavor of bourbon just flat assaults you with a sweet vanilla caramel cherry finish. Balanced of roasted malt lts is excellent. 
A well done wee heavy although the bourbon booziness is slightly over the top for me. Always love getting a 4 pack each year. Consume a couple & lay a couple down is the way to play.

2013 bottle. Pours a bit darker than the regular (Dirty Bastard), blackish ruby red. Thin to no head. Sweet bourbon aroma, maybe a little smoke, cherries and slight alcohol. Taste is outstanding. Vanilla, caramel, mild bourbon and cherries, dark fruits. The bourbon is not overpowering. I was never a huge fan of Dirty Bastard, but the addition of infused bourbon really does wonders, great beer. I like this beer much better than KBS. Glad I was able to try it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2013 bottle poured at about 50 degrees in a goblet glass. Pour is dark brown, nearly clear, with a hint of blood red. Small off white head that quickly settles to a nice lacing that lingers around the rim. Bourbon, vanilla, slight cherry, and oak up front on the nose, good bit of alcohol noticeable, caramel, toffee, a nice dark fruit character, and a wonderful sweet malty note throughout. Tastes excellent, there’s a nice very subtle smokiness, little bit of caramel, the dark cherry note and nice syrupy sweetness are prevalent, and the bourbon, vanilla and oak flavors bring up the rear. There’s a fair amount of alcohol there too. I’m loving this, the bourbon doesn’t smack you in the face, it just kind of rounds out the beer a little.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Wow! Rich, boozy, nice notes of vanilla and a lot of butterscotch. Somehow it all comes together to make a great beer.

bottle of current release (2013). poured into duvel glass. nose is full of vanilla and burnt sugar, dried fruits, cherry, awesomeberry. small tan head dissipated quickly. fairly clear light brown color. flavor is sweet and a touch of booze. vanilla. slightly smokey. very clean and flat finish, not cloying. Not as sticky on my lips as I recall this beer being, but still great stuff.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2013 Yup, this is my almost perfect beer. Pours dark brown, tan 1" head. Aroma is big oak, burnt caramel, and hints of bourbon. Taste is bourbon soaked in caramel vanilla and them heads like dark chocolate. Medium body medium carbonation for the perfect mouth feel. So damn good. Sipper? Not when its this good.

Hello, how arrrre yah, smells sweet caramel, scotch and malt, with a hint of vanilla, that livens up as the beer oxidates.

Color is dark but a bit off cherry when you look through light. Small head that dissipates quickly and leaves a nice lacing. 

Served in a snifter at a cool room temp, delicious. Nice mellow vanilla flavor at first with a perfectly sweet maltiness. One after flavor the scotch reqlly comes through.

I got the last 4 at hop city but if you find it, try it!
Im a scotch ale fan but this didnt hit me for whatever reason. Good vanilla flavor and in the nose but it fell a little flat. Perhaps a bad bottle. Will try again.

Poured a dark brown with a small tan, cream head. Sweet high alcohol aroma with notes of vanilla and oak. The taste is what makes this beer, even with a high alcohol presence. The vanilla and oak come through as well as a little caramel. WOW this is a good beer.

2013 bottle. Pour is a dark brown with a little red coming through on the edge, and a foamy tan head. Lots of bourbon, oak and vanilla up front on the nose, good bit of alcohol noticeable, caramel, toffee, a nice dark fruit character, and a wonderful sweet malty note throughout. Tastes excellent, theres a nice very subtle smokiness, little bit of caramel, the dark cherry note and nice syrupy sweetness are prevalent, and the bourbon, vanilla and oak flavors bring up the rear. Theres a fair amount of alcohol there too. Im loving this, the bourbon doesnt smack you in the face, it just kind of rounds out the beer a little.

on tla at the Three Penny Taproom in Montpelier. 

What a delicious surprise. Despite it mildly boozy smell and description, this beer has a surprisingly soft, fluffy mouthfeel with a semi sweet deliciousness as if the perfect cupcake and stout had a baby. I know that sounds horrible, but its the first thing it made me think. Beautiful lacing that lingers on the glass; soft and full on the palate, not to sweet, and I must repeat that it was a totally pleasant surprise. Yum.

12oz bottle , pours deep amber , aromas of sweet bourbon vanilla , moderate carbonation , sweet caramel , bourbon and vanilla flavors . Love to age this one but prefer it fresh . Easily in my top 5 Founders beers . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle poured into a tulip glass, 2013 vintage. Dark brown with a small white head. Nose is scotch, vanilla, burnt caramel. Medium heavy carbonation. I really like this one. Had it once on tap and thought it was way too thick. I dont get the same texture from the bottled version. Great beer! Cant wait to get a little age on these.

aroma: vanilla, bourbon, peanut brittle. appearance: dark ruby/auburn, semi-opaque. minimal and quickly dissipating white head. very few carbo bubbles. spotty lacing. taste: sweet dark fruit and caramel quickly give way to hot and intense bourbon. palate: thin but not really dry. bitter finish.

On draft at Founders. Pours into a snifter with a gorgeous ruby color. The thin head dissipates quickly and leaves minimal lacing. The aroma is gorgeous. There are some hints of licorice and dark fruits, but the caramel, hints of vanilla, and the bourbon mixes delightfully. The flavor is equally as good. A prefect maltiness, with the caramel and the bourbon meshing into the fruitiness. This is substantially better than the first one I'd tried. Amazing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. bottle poured into a snifter. Appearance is a hazy ruby-brown color, much like cola. Aroma is incredibly rich malts, caramel, dark fruits (plums and raisins), toffee, warm booze, and a hint of vanilla. There arent enough words to describe how rich this smells. At first, the taste is similar to the scent, but less rich and with more prominent vanilla. However, the aftertaste is very much smooth, warm bourbon and vanilla. That lingering aftertaste is just incredible. Its definitely a sipper, though. I didnt know what to expect from Founders on this one, but Im not disappointed.
UPDATED: MAR 9, 2015 Pours dark with hints of ruby... great bourbon aroma, amazing taste bourbon and dark fruits.. this is a wonderful top of the line beer!

Pours a rich brown. Mahogany with hues and highlights of ruby. Hazy cola color. Nose is rich and sweet. Leaves a thin ring and alcohol legs behind. Bourbon and oak. Earthy grain and dark fruit. This beer has every malt sweetness on the nose. Caramel, toffee, sugar. Fragrant vanilla and dark fruits. The taste is charming. Smooth and creamy body that boasts a sweet richness. The fruits are dried dates, raisins and figs. The vanilla adds smoothness and the bourbon enhances the lush sweetness. It finishes dry and pleasantly boozy. Has an earthy peat character underneath that offsets all the sweetness so it is not cloying. 

Wonderful! Drinks big with an intense malt character that is deep and full.

Bottle to pint. Appearance is a dark brown with slight redness, little to no head. Aroma is pretty wonderful, scotch and caramel. Took a sip when cold but realized this will taste way better slightly warmed, gave it a half hour to come around. Taste is sweet caramel, vanilla, scotch, oak, a bit of dark fruit. Dangerously smooth. Very good.

Reddish brown in color with a yellowish/cream head, this is very much a Scotch ale. But awesomerer. It has an amazingly delicious nose of dark, sweet fruits (figs, maybe dates) and perfect malty brown malts. Godly aroma. its really delectable in the mouth, sweet and darkly fruity with notes of wood and Scotland. Its almost like candy, but more like candied fruit. Apples maybe. pears maybe. Figs and dates definitely.
An amazing beer. And the finish is just enough of a tease that you really have to watch yourself when you drink this. Its like candy for burly Scotsmen. And my belly.

12oz bottle. Poured a clear very dark amber color with a two finger foamy off white head. Aroma of dark fruit, plum and cherry with toasty caramel and a light smoky element beside a hint of fresh cut wood. Taste has earthy woodiness and sweet dark fruits, toasted caramel, with a touch of bourbon and oak. The smokiness is very light and not overpowering at all letting the sweetness dominate through the finish. It is creamy and smooth with a medium body and light alcohol heat.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2013 12oz. Pours deep amber with a small ring of off white lace. Atoms of vanilla, toffee, caramel, oak, bourbon, booze, and a touch of earth hop. The flavor is somewhat astringent and brash. Bourbon takes the show with a huge malt body behind it. A little too much for me so I gave it to my girlfriend who drinks Coors light....she loved it. Who knew?

Re-rate! Much better this time around. Loads of wood, bourbon, malt, and hops. Just much better fresh IMO...

On-tap at the World Expo of Beer in Frankenmuth, Michigan.

Appearance: Darkness. A few bubbles on top, no lacing, and just a pitch black beer -- about what I expected this beer to look like.

Smell: Huge scotch and oak aromas... maybe some dark sort of chocolate malt notes, but mainly oaky scotch.

Taste: A couple people I was with claimed it tasted like liquid smoke and dumped it out, but I quite enjoyed this one -- it tastes almost exactly like it smells. It drinks almost like straight scotch with some warming on the finish, but there isnt a HUGE alcohol sort of flavor. The finish is also woody with some dark chocolate and malt to round it all out.

Quite good, and I think its awesome that Founders chose to put some truly great stuff on-tap at the World Expo of Beer.

I love this beer. From the firs time I accidentally discovered it at a rockabilly show to now, this is just a great beer. Currently it is on tap, too cold, so waiting for it to warm up. Does have a strong bourbon taste, but realizing I am a scotch ale fan and this balances nicely. Only American beer in my top five favorites. It can hit you like a sledgehammer though.

Trade from umich43jm, thanks! Pours deep amber with little head or carbonation. Aroma is earthy with caramel malt, oak, a touch of smoke. Smells delicious! Flavor follows the scent... Caramel malt and oak dominating. Smooth brew, the 10% alcohol is well hidden. This is my favorite "Scotch Ale" to date!

Heavy hitting beer with dark flavorful notes of chocolate and cinnamon to start. Pours with a thick multicolor head. Easy drinking. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

CBC - Red Session, Østerbro, Copenhagen, DK.
Tap, 050513.
Brown with beige head. Aroma of malt. Flavor with caramel, smoke and fruit

Bottle from DeCiccos Market. Sweet heavy oak aroma. Pours dark copper with minimal head. Strong hints of rum. Smooth with a slightly bitter finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 341 cc bottle. Pours medium-dark brown. Off-white head that fades quickly leaving nice lace. Aroma is gorgeous oaky bourbon and sweet malts with notes of vanilla, citrus, and spice. Flavour is bourbon-forward with sweet malt and well balanced hops spiking towards the finish. Beautiful aftertaste. The bourbon barrel aging takes an already great Scotch Ale to the next level.

Wow! Incredibly light, smooth, & complex! Love the aroma which is sweet & seemingly dominated by the bourbon flavor yet quite unique. The taste is so light on the palate but finishes w/ a huge flavor explosion. Love the originality & how easy this goes down at 10%. Another masterpiece from founders!!

Bottle @ Christers. Pours dark amber with a small offwhite head. Aroma of rich sweet malt, wood, caramel, earth. peat, bourbon. Flavor is sweet with malt, caramel, vanilla, wood, peat, earthy, bourbon, dark fruits. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, lightly warming alcohol in the finish. 030713

Bottle poured a dark brown hue w/ a small tan head w/ great lacing. Big aromas of brown sugar, molasses, whiskey barrel, prune, and cherries. Initial flavor is a bold sweet w/ a boozy finish. Tastes are heavy whiskey, prune, molasses, chocolate. Full bodied, flat carbonation, heavy alcoholic feel in the finish.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy deep ruby with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dried fruit, wood and bourbon. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish with lots of warming alcohol. 030713

Bottle. Clear dark amber/brown with small beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, toffee, toasted and wood. Flavour is malt, caramel, toffee, sweet, bourbon, vanilla, dark fruits, notes of alcohol, oak and wood.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is dark amber. Aroma and taste are bourbon, vanilla, wood, caramel, little smoke, fruits and hops. Nice and smooth.
Pours a murky brown with a minimal, thin off white head. Aromas of caramel, roasted malts, and mild bourbon. Flavors of the bourbon come through with some sweet, roasted malt.

Thick maple syrup brown with a yellowish hue. Peaty bourbon and scary sweet caramel on the nose. Indeed, it tastes dangerously sweet, but packs a punch that develops throughout an extensive change from sip to palate. Spice, alcohol, wood, old dark candied fruit!. A particularly hot mouthfeel, but doesnt diminish the beers complexity. This is the one I bring to Thanksgiving dinner every year (the prior years batch). Nothing beats it to wash down turkey, mashed potatoes, and every sort of pie.
On tap at Unos Hamilton during Philly Beer Week. I have always felt that this one of the best Scotch Ales around, and this batch did nothing to change my mind.
a scotch ale that lives up to its name, lots of early herbs, leather but no real alcohol burn and not heavy or oily on the tongue. Founders does it again.

Founders Backwards Bastard, aged 6 months in my fridge (yes, I am drinking it fresh), 10.2% ABV, a 12oz bottle and poured into a snifter glass.
Appearance: Poured deep ruby brown with a very little head and lacing.
Smell:  Sweet caramel and smoky malt with a hint of vanilla, no pronounced hop presence, no obvious off flavors.
Taste:  Candied dates and baking chocolate.  There is also a spicy and earthy aftertaste that I attribute to the oak bourbon barrels used in the aging process and the 50 IBUs of hop flavor.
Mouth feel:  Medium to full body and low carbonation.  The bitter sweetness clings to the upper palette.  There is definitely an umami effect as I keep running my tongue along my upper palette.  Also a nice warming alcohol finish.
Overall: Founders has been making great beer for over 20 years.  Backwards Bastard is an amazingly subtle yet complex beer.  You will find the flavor change with each sip as the beer warms and the taste lingers.  You can drink this with almost any rich food and meal course; from roasted garlic Portobello mushrooms, to a medium-rare rib eye, or a flourless chocolate raspberry cake.  But why wait for the food.  As my favorite late night talk show host would exclaim, This is a beverage.

Looks and tastes like a fine bourbon. Caramel in color. I can see this in a snifter to sip on all evening.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Color is deep red. Smells earthy, sweet, wood and more. Taste is really sweet (maybe too much for me) but complex. Wood, fruits, slight caramel.
A little sticky on the finish but the bourbon character really plays well with the caramel sweetness of what is already a good scotch ale.

Sample at CBC 2013.

Dark amber colour with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of bourbon, wood, dark dried fruit, malt, caramel and licorice.

Pours brown, with a smallish tan head. Smells of wood, brown sugar, bourbon, and dark fruit. Taste is bourbon, wood, malt, and brown sugar. A little thinner mouthfeel than I expected. Overall a great beer.

On tap @ Acre, Chicago. Deep amber color, minimal head, but left some lacing in glass. Raisin/plum, malty/toffee and vanilla nose. Light smokey notes with vanilla and raisin taste blend into alcoholic warm finish. Surprisingly light in body for such heavy flavors. The intensity of flavor/alcohol to body mismatch was jarring. I thought this tasted more like a watery barleywine than scotch ale.

Tap at Blind Tiger.  My lips were still burning from that horrendous habanero beer but this delicious gem got me back on track.  Pours very murky deep brownish red.  Nose of smoke and dark fruits.  Tastes of malt, earth, caramel, oak, peat, smoke, scotch, and some spices.  very creamy mouthfeel
Chopp. Amber red colour, small off-white head. Sweet pleasantly fruity malty woody caramel chocolate aroma. Good mouthfeel. Sweet fruity caramel flavour with dark malts and some wood.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade. Pours clear, deep red with a small, staying, creamy, beige head. Aroma has alcohol, malts, caramel. Medium carbonation, fine dry and very creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good malty sweetness, caramel, light toasted, a hint of liqourice, a bit of the same burning alcohol. Not that balanced.
On tap @CBC13. Hazy dark ruby with small tan head. Aroma and taste of fruit and perfume, bisquits, whisky, vanilla, oak, caramel and chocolate with smoke notes

Draught @ CBC 2013. Amber coloured. Dense beige head. Aroma: Ripe fruits, sweetness, caramel, vanilla, some smoke and destinct bourbon barrel. Flavour: Caramel, ripe fruits, vanilla, smoke, some berries. Medium to full bodied. Ends sweet and caramelly.

Draught at CBC 2013.
Clear orange-brown coloured with a small off-white head.
Sweeta nd fruity aroma of caramel, dried fruits and oak.
Sweet and fruity flavour of caramel, dried fruits, chocolate and oak.
Sweet finish.
These CBC ratings are basically a joke because I didnt write any notes. In any event, CBC2013 on tap. I discovered I dislike Scotch Ale intensely. Hence the 1 for taste.
One of the best scotch ale I have ever had. Rich flavors of scotch and  oak.  A must try if you are fond of scotch ale.

Wow, wish I had more of this beer on hand but also pretty glad I gave my extras away so I could spread the love. Pours reddish brown with a finger of white head. Aromas are caramel, booze, peat, and just a tiny bit of wood. Flavors are boozy barrel, smoke and caramel and some wet forest floor-like notes. The palate is quite nice with limited carbonation so the thickness of this beer really comes through; it coats the tongue nicely and has a definite warmth. Overall this is a really good beer. It reminds me more of a Barleywine than a Scotch Ale though this is a barrel aged version of a Scotch ale and the only in the form I have tried. Regardless this is killer!

Sample from tap, CBC 2013. Hazy, dark, ruby colour with a small, creamy, tan head. Fruity aroma with whisky, vanilla, oak, rich caramel and chocolate malts. A light hint of smoke. Taste ís sweet. Full body with a slick, oily mouthfeel and a lively carbonation.   Finishes bitter with sweet, vinous malt and a hint of alcohol. Very rich and full-bodied.

355 ml bottle from my secret santa. Thank you joeneugs. Pours amberish chestnut brown with a thin brownish beige head that quickly dissipates without leaving any trace worth mentioning. Smell is sweet and malty with biscuits, bourbon, charred wood, roasted nuts, vanilla fudge, alcohol, coconut, hay, caramel and hints of peat, sundried sugary fruits and pencil shavings. Taste is sweet, tiny bitter and malty with biscuits, caramel, fresh oak, vnilla fudge, cookie dough, coconut, bourbon, raisins, roasted nuts, charred wood, lemon zest and hints of resin, pine needles, peat and Islay whisky. Mouthfeel is rich, round, slightly boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet, bitter and malty with biscuits, hay, resinous wood, roasted coconut, vanilla fudge, bourbon, raisins, fresh oak and hints of peat. A great rich sipper

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2013 Pours deep red, one finger off white this foamy head light lacing. Huge bready, doughy, caramel, toffee malt aroma up front, vanilla, bourbon and slight oak, slight fruity yeast ester. Taste is bready doughy malt and bourbon up front, slight alcohol and toffee mid mouth, bourbon, vanilla and oak at the slightly dry finish.  Low carbonation, medium full body, alcohol heat. Overall excellent for the style, very big beer, perfect balance, an extremely complex beer.

Pours dark amber with low white head. Aroma of butterscotch, caramel malt, oak barrel, vanilla. Taste is booze and muscovado sweet, smooth and balanced. Body is full and creamy with low carbonation.

Pours dark amber with low off white head
Aromas of butterscotch, bourbon, 
Great taste of vanilla, caramel, butterscotch, low med ending

Nose is caramel, figs, dates, dark sugars. Taste is fantastic: caramel, raidins, figs, muscovado sugars, toffee. Sublime!

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2013 Reddish brown with an off white head. Aroma is caramel sweet, grainy and bourbon. Taste follows nose, but adds a bitter finish.
Nice dark red pour from the bottle.  No head but chewy mouth feel.   Deep Carmel/bourbon aroma and taste.  Toffee sweet taste.   Nice beer.

On tap at Beermuda. Drank this after a BA Batch 9000 so in comparison I may be a bit skewed. Bourbon aroma with some dark fruits. A bit thin in the feel. No heat.

Belíssima breja da Founders. Scotch/wood aged ale, com amadurecimento em barris de bourbon. Cor escura, tinto, com pouca formacao de espuma e surpreendente aroma de bourbon, amadeirado. No paladar, corpo rico, com sabor intenso de bourbon, madeira, bastante malte. Ainda, notas de frutas secas, ameixas, especiarias. Final longo, alcoólico, duradouro. Excelente breja!
