TAP: Deep red/brownish. Aroma and taste of bourbon, vanilla, oak, alcohol, dark chocolate, cherry and caramel. THICK but smooth.

It poured a red color with a light tan head. The aroma was notes of malt, caramel, some wood, and whiskey. The taste was sweet with strong notes of bourbon as well as medium notes of caramel and wood with a slightly burnt edge.

Tap in a snifter.  Chestnut brown pour with a short lived light beige head.  Small bubbles cling to,the sides of the glass.  Bourbon vanilla nose that is very pleasing.  The taste has that same vanilla sweetness propped up by bourbon booze.  The beer itself is malty as expected with a balancing hop bitterness (if you stop and look for it).  Very flavorful, balanced, and well crafted.  A treat for bourbon barrels aged beer lovers!

Bottle... Murky ruddy pour, thin tan head,no lace. Sweet vanilla and bourbon aroma.  Sweet malty flavor,notes of vanilla,fruit and wood. Medium bodied,carbonation is low. Finish is sweet  bourbon. Good.

Pours a murky copper color. No head. Bourbon invades the nose also very sweet as well almost like caramel and a hint of dark fruit. The bourbon strikes when you take a sip but does not over power the beer. Sweeter than expected . Not a bad brew I would certainly drink it again. Bottle date: 11/16/09

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2014 09/14 re rate. Bumped up from 3.8.  The aroma and taste when cold are higher than a 4.0.  Too much f an aftertaste when it warms but outstanding colder. More rates to come!!!!................09/12 - lowered slightly; maybe an older bottle but aroma not a 9 as in first rate; all else still applies...  recd in trade.  rated this with Rhar iron Thistle - rated both a 4 but they were very different for being the same style...  This beer is a 9 on aroma - bourbon, some, wood, malt, and vanilla? wow!  creamy med thick palate.  beer from glass to bottle; hazy amber/brown colow with big head with long lasting lacing.  Taste - very sweet, roasted stuff, bourbon  taste not is good as aroma (which is almost impossible) proabley liked iron thistle taste more but this had a better aroma...

certinly a world class beer but not for me, far too sweet. murky deep drown little head that fades taste is sweet dark fruits and candied bourbon. i respect it, but will leave it for others for now on.

Draught at Jerrys Sandwitches (Oak And Iron). Almost black - offwhite head.
Bourbon. Nutty oakey. Vanilla. High malty. Light smokey. Dried fruits. Dark berries.Coconut. Sweetness. Ok bitterness.

Poured a medium brown color with a small amount of haze. Sweet caramel malt mixes well with a strong bourbon woodsy aroma. Strong bourbon and oak taste. very slight aftertaste. the alcohol isnt that well hidden. earth, peat, cherries, vanilla. Very smooth and creamy.

355 ml bottle.
Rated on 20110618.
Pours copper color with light, quickly dissipating head. Aroma of barley wine -like sweetness and some alcohol notes. Flavor of vanilla, sweet plums and ripe fruits. Like Tom Hardys ale in some ways.. 
5324

12 oz. bottle, sent from BigTomz (thanks a lot Tom!), pours a beautiful dark mahogany / ruby red with a small ring of beige head. Aroma of brown sugar, bourbon, vanilla, butterscotch / toffee malt, and wood - exquisite on the nose. Flavour of scotch whiskey and bourbon barrels upfront, followed by vanilla, a high booze factor, some candy floss, and more alcohol burn - the alcohol is a bit overburdening to be honest. Medium complexity with a big warming effect, though too much heat. Very enjoyable slow sipper, but loses points for the unmasked ABV.

Received in trade from barak316, thanks for the opportunity.
Pours a slightly murky reddish brown with a tiny off white head that never really musters, but never fully dissipates either. Smells of sweet caramel and brown sugar with lots of dark fruit and oak and bourbon. The smell is heavenly really. Taste is as sweet as advertised but have enough bourbon warmth to keep is slightly balanced. Lots of dark sugars and dark fruits round out the flavor nicely. Medium to thick body with a light level of carbonation and a sweet sugary almost syrupy mouthfeel. I enjoyed the heck out of this beer! I only wish it were a little easier to obtain.

Good overall taste but not as much as one would think for a barrel aged brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

deep amber. Two finger white frothy head. Decent retention with sticky lacing through out. Strong vanilla aroma with noticeable bourbon and woodiness. Barrel notes mask most of the other smells.  Roasted malt and smoke flavors. Definite woodiness. Sweet vanilla and bourbon flavors. Drinks smooth and creamy. Light carbonation.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2015 12oz bottle.
Clear deep amber brew with a bit of off-white head.  Nose of bourbon, caramel, and some smoke.   Flavors of malt, dark fruit, wood, and peat.  Slight sweetness as it warms.

Aroma was somewhat subtle,dark Scottish carmels and just a touch of the whiskey, wow,nothing subtle about the taste,big bold smooth sweet bourbon,mixed with carmel,toffee, and hints of dark fruit, the silky palate is wonderful. As good as any barrel aged Ive had

Pours a deep ruby with rust around the edges. You can get a slight khaki-beige head with a good swirl, but it settles to a ring. Nose has a lot going on...you get that bourbon barrel up front, full of wood and whiskey. Lots of caramel sweetness, some of that mossy smokiness. Taste is a lot of sweet with a fair amount of bitter and some alcohol bite. Palate is really smooth, coating, slightly thick, and a little sticky, with very low carbonation and nice alcohol warmth going down. The quintessential beer for special occasions, imagined or otherwise.

Poured from 12oz bottle into small taster glass.
Aroma:  Hard to put my finger on the aroma.  A little fruity and a little bit of alcohol.  Maybe some vanilla.
Appearance:  dark carmel brown and very little head.  Soft carbonation.
Taste:  Sweet, whiskey, vanilla, and cream soda
Palate:  Very creamy.  reminds me of a cream soda with a shot of whiskey in it.  The alcohol isnt too overpowering though but you can tell its there.
Overall:  Very good beer.  High alcohol %.  Its definitely a sipper.  Probably wont have this again but enjoyed it.

On tap at Founders brewpub.  Hazy brown in a snifter.  Earthy aroma of bourbon, alcohol, smoke, and caramel.  All that same stuff is in the taste as well.  It is high on the sweet side, but it works well here.  Love it!
12 ounce bottle that pours a cloudy amber color, aroma of sweet malt, oak, and booze.  Flavors of malt, spicey oak, and a twinge of boozey aftertaste.  Was a great night cap that I would want mor of.
Very good beer easily drinkable. Strong flavor great pour. Tried at a beer taste and wished there was more.
UPDATED: FEB 10, 2012 12 oz Bottle pours deep red color.  Smells of vanilla, toasted coconut, oak, caramel syrup, and alcohol.  Great bourbon taste with a hint of fruit

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2017 Refrigerated bottle poured into a shaker.  Pours really dark hazy amber with tan finger head that disspates fast.  Some lacing, heavy body, sticky texture, low carbonation, and nice sweet aroma.  Taste is malty oak, bourbon, hint of alcohol, and a hint of vanilla in the finish.  Based on the rating I really expected more.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2014 On tap at mad mex in Robinson.  Nice foamy head and light cola color, with great whiskey and malt aromas.  Usually I dont like wiskey ain but tey ave tis rit wit full mout of malt and vanilla.  Just a very slitbitter taste at end.
4/16 on TAP the Pit in Raleigh.  Still great.
11/14 On tap at Stokes, still one of the few barrel aged beers I like

12oz bottle, at the Jackie-Os bar. Almost not-clear brown color, minimal tan head, leaving good lace. Big body, crisp light carbonation, smooth, aged texture. Nice sweet taste, but kinda boozy, spicy, dark fruit and a heavier bourbon aroma. Really good, assertive, but not repulsive like a lot of barrel-aged beers I try. Delightful hop bitterness. Awesome looking suspended dark particles, inside. Awesome, strong, but not-too-strong aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2013 A: Dark brownish red body. Just a coating of off white head. Very little lacing.

S: Bourbon and all that comes with it. Vanilla, oak, alcohol... then comes the beer... dark chocolate and caramel.. not much in the way of hops, but thats ok

D: This is like jack and coke meets beer... its rather nice... the aromas in the nose are well positioned in the taste profile.. nice bourbon finish

M: Smooth. Slightly carbonated. Slightly alcoholic burn too.

O: I dont know. For as much as I enjoyed the beer I just didnt want another. I like bourbon aged beers (including KBS/oaked aged yeti/etc) and this is the first one I wasnt willing and ready to have another.

Bottle. The scotch overpowers the aroma, but once it settled, I could pick up the oaky caramel scents with malt notes. The appearance was a bit underwhelming, a chocolate brown after a silky pour with no head and zero lacing. The palate was a smooth textured medium to light body and the taste just exploded. The taste was a scotch alcohol assault similar to the scent. However, a sweet, cream and caramel persisted that reminded me of those cow tail candies gas stations all seem to sell (which I liked). The taste then settled warmly to the tongue. Overall, Im hooked. Ill be cellaring some of this.
Dark amber in color, clear with a thin head.  Super malt and oak barrel aroma . Light hops and super malts flavor.  Bready and thick.  Light fruit flavor and super dry finish.
Deep amber, almost no head. Bourbon malt and caramel.  Lots of bourbon and chocolate in the finish.  Fantastic

12 ounce bottle courtesy of scray24, poured into a pint glass. Deep dark amber with a small eggshell head. Im basically getting bourbon on the nose, without much scotchy influence. Malty caramel with oodles of toasted coconut. Not an alcoholic   smell though, very smooth. Flavor is very similar. The main   note here is woody bourbon, heavy on coconut, light on booze. A little vanilla and honey come through. A strong sweet beer, perfect for nightcap purposes.

Bottle given to me by Timfoolery. This beer is awesome. Easily the best scotch ale Ive ever had. Pours a dark brown with a small head. Smelled of molasses and oak barrel. Sweet malt goodness. Let me say that again, sweet malt goodness. WOW!!

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2016 27 Feb 2016, bottle. brown. nose is faintly woody and sweet caramel. tastes amazing! boozy bourbon but not strong or harsh, vanilla, granola. great!

(Original rating - 8 3 8 2 16 = 3.7)
12 jan 2012, bottle. Light caramel color, clear. Alcohol, caramel and oak. Thin body and mostly flat. Meh. Tastes like slightly watered down bourbon stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle.  Red, thick, syrupy, sweet aroma of caramel and malt.  Light bourbon in the taste that lingers in the finish.  A definite sipper that is very fit for purpose.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2012 Bottle from beergod1 trade. Intense aromas of single-malt scotch, caramel, dark fruit, and light spice. Flavor is savory, thick malt with an alcohol presence with essence of fine scotch. Little head, but perfect, limited carbonation to enhance flavors. I loved this! Excellent beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle care of TimE. Colour is dark brown, reddish edges and thin off white head. Nose is big bold bourbon barrel, malty and lots of caramel. I have to declare now that I am not a fan of barrel aged stuff. However, this seems to work. First up its a big mouthful of bourbon, bag loads of vanilla and everything else is drowning, but as it lingers the flavours of the beer underneath it all start to come through and theres some nice orange marmalade, fruity and sweet caramel. So not bad after all and great on a cold night.
one of my favorite Michigan brews. Taste like how it sounds. Rivaled only by Scotty Karate.

Dark brown with a red touch, the head is light brown. This is a big beer, tonnes of aroma and flavor. The first you notice is the barrel notes of vanillia wood and bourbon. But there is also a sweet caramel base with figs ans prunes. Im usually not that fond of beers that are this sweet with a lot of barrel notes, but this is a lovely beer that is well balanced.

Wow - just wow. One of the best use of booze barrels in beer Ive come across.(and thanks to mi amigo Jaime for sending it my way).  Lotsa complex layers going together perfectly and all that jazz. Wish I could get this all the time out here.

Such a fantastic sipper. Not too sure why it comes out in November, as it would be good to sip by a midnight bonfire for sure. Take the Dirty Bastard and add a little vanilla and bourbon notes, some warm & fuzzy and this is what you get. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Big time barrel ager here. Clear brown in a with a small head. Nose is sherry like aged notes and vanilla. Sweet and a touch sticky which works for a big slow sipper like this. The barrel character is really dominant here but its well put together overall. Honestly, this stuff is tasty but Id rather have something a bit more beery.
Bottle - pours deep red (almost black) with a tan head. Has a smooth chocolate flavor to it with a definite bourbon presence. A good on to sip.

Bourbon you say!!  Bourbon on the nose, big blast in the first few sips and then it becomes a beer of beauty!  Im certainly not going to pound these, but once in a short while, this is certainly a brew to turn to!
Strongly malty in aroma in taste, with hints of caramel, cherry, vanilla, and woodiness. Smooth but full bodied, strong but not overly heavy. Not a favorite style, but not bad at all.

Bottled. A deep red beer with a thin light tan head. The aroma has notes of malt, caramel, wood, and whiskey. The flavor is sweet with strong notes of bourbon as well as medium notes of caramel and wood, and a slightly burnt edge.

Aroma- oak, cinnamon, other spices, whiskey, big bready malts
Appearance- deep dark oak brown, borderline mahogany, thin white head, nice alcohol coating
Taste- mild spices, cinnamon, oak, bourbon, vanilla, super smooth, actually incredibly smooth
Palate- low carbonation, mouthcoatingly awesome
Overall- Founders does it again.  Dirty Bastard, their scotch ale, is an incredible brew as is.  When aged on bourbon, this beer manifests into a real smooth monster.  Great frickin brew!
UPDATED: NOV 8, 2014 Pours reddish brown with brown head.  Aroma of scotch malts, grapes, and cream.  The taste is awesome.  Scotch, malts, vanilla, and cherries.  Great beer.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2011 Aroma of molasses and whiskey. Pours a brown/dark red looking color. Very little head - tan colored. Heavy raisin, whiskey, oak, and some vanilla flavors..I can taste the alcohol in this beer on the finish and it comes through strong. Not getting much fruit flavors of any kind. Small amount of carbonation. Overall a great beer and I would get this again.

12 oz. bottle from A Southern Season, Chapel Hill, NC.

Ar: Complex aroma with dominant notes of pit fruit, cherries, slight smokiness, and vanilla.
Ap:  Pours a deep brown-red, a beautiful ruby hue when held to the light.  Small manila head leaves great lace.
T:  Sweet, complex flavors going on here.  Lots of date, dried black fig, and a bit of cherry.  Booze on the finish brings to mind Irish whiskey.  A touch of toffee and chocolate on the finish as well.
P:  Thick, creamy body with pretty mild carbonation.  

O:  I had been wanting to try this for some time, and it certainly doesnt disappoint.  Big, burly, maybe a bit cloying in its richness but damned good nonetheless.
12oz bottle. The nose is bourbon heavy, vanilla, woody, malty. Flavor was full of dark stone fruits, vanilla, woody, bourbon, malty. A great beer, a little to much Bourbon.

Bottle. Pours a dark ruby red color with a beige head. Aroma is super malty, with tons of dark fruits, some molasses, sugary notes, oak, bourbon, vanilla, subtle smoke and a buttery note. The flavor is nice and complex and really malty, with notes of caramel, dark fruits like a raisins and figs, brown sugar, bourbon, oak, vanilla, subtle smoke, buttery notes, syrupy notes and some toasted malt. The body is medium with a dry mouthfeel. Overall a really tasty Scotch Ale, probably my favorite in the style!

Pretty damn good beer.  It is exactly what you would think if they took an already great beer in Dirty Bastard, and aged it in bourbon barrels.  The aroma has a nice bourbon smell.  The taste gives nice hints of bourbon, but not overpowering, with subtle smoke and cherry.  One of the better beers I have had lately and understand why it was in such high demand.  As usual, another winner from Founders!

This brew will make you walk sidewaysbackwards... What a kick-ass beer, way underrated IMO.. Oaky bourbon flavor, lovely vanilla undertones, a faint touch of some unidentified fruit with a slight warming of abv... Nicccee Wee Heavy....Founders top notch...

Fan-freakin-tastic! Of the Scotch Ales (a.k.a. Wee Heavy) that I have tasted, this one is one of the best!! My thanks to Larry for the gift of this fine brew as I cant find it in my area and we need to start carrying it! Wonderful scents of robust bourbon, dark fruits and vanilla. Gimme a case of these and leave me alone! Go easy on this brew as the alcohol is so well hidden. Some smoked venison or wild boar fajitas would pair oh so well!

Had on draught at 44 Stone.  Went into it only with the expectation that Founders rarely misses.

Pours dark, rich and heavy with a very inviting nose.  Tastes of Bourbon, Scotch, smoke, peat and toasted malt.

Simply put, a must try.  Ive had many a wee heavy/scotch ale in my days; most of them in Scotland.  This now sets my standard for the style.

Incredible.  Well done again, Founders.

Aroma is super fruity right away. Some pineapple/coconut smells. Not what I was expecting. Pour is deep red with a head that fades quick. Fruity flavor is in there as well. Pineapples and strawberries. Some sweet cherry in there too. Palate kind of burns and is pretty slick. Aftertaste is cherries. This isnt bad, just not the best Ive had in this style.

Was extremely pleased to find this tonight on tap at Ervs Mug in Oak Creek, WI. Dirty Bastard is excellent, and aging it in bourbon barrels adds extra dimensions to an already complex product. Backwoods Bastard has a woody, mossy sort of thick scent. The bourbon-alcohol scent is there, too. It has a medium body and sweet taste. Another superior ale from Founders.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2014 Not normal for me to re-rate something, but I think I had this too early on in my beer exploration to really enjoy. Plus, I feel like bourbon barrel aging beers has gone over the edge, and some beers dont respond very well to it, but this isnt true here. Founders Scotch Ale already has the buttery and sweet flavors that are wonderfully enhanced by the barrel aging process making this an incredibly smooth, caramel, butter, and sometimes spicy scotch ale.
UPDATED: JAN 11, 2017 Strong aroma and flavor of bourbon. Smokey but not so much a peat smokiness. Very malty and slightly syrupy. Quite nice. Serving: Bottle

12 ounce bottle

With two of these in the cellar I was glad to open one now and save the other for later. This is a very strong beer with lots of depth. Id expect nothing less from a quality brewery like Founders. While I would not go out of my way to get more once they gone I also would consider picking up another if it was on the shelf.

Aroma / Appearance - The dense head collapses over time into a yellowed paper crust. Slick spindly legs also provide depth for the ruby red body. The nose contains strong vanilla, malt balls, wood ready for the final clear coat, and a definite base of ethanol. It is strong but not of character for a 10% ABV release.

Flavor / Palate - Creamy from start to finish the mouthfeel is thick. The bitter base holds up vanilla, oak, and rosy floral aspects. Warm with an alcoholic aftertaste this feels like the amped up Scotch ale it is. Unless you have a reason not to take your time and savor a well rounded beer from one of Americas best breweries.

12oz bottle from Picks Liquors poured into a snifter. Pours a dark ruby color with minimal head. Aroma of cherry, oak, whiskey, a little caramel and chocolate. Aroma is light sweet and light bitter. Strong boozy notes with a good bit of vanilla and oak. Medium bodied with a thick texture. Lively carbonation and a long finish. Overall, this beer is great. As someone who loves bourbon as much as I do beer, this is a great combination.

12 oz. Bottle to glass. Bourbon on the nose, start and finish. Great malt flavor that shines through in the middle. I bought one bottle to try, then went back the next day to buy the remaining 3 the store had. Im planning on sharing 2 with my beer loving family members, and aging the last bottle for next year. I already cant wait till next year!
bottle to glass. notes of booze, vanilla and caramel. deep caramel color with white head. sweet taste with a slight heat from the barrel. Really good beer. definitely one to enjoy slowly.

12oz bottle. Mahogany with a creamy biege head.  Vanilla, oak and booze are most prominent, caramel with a bit of molasses, roasted malts. Very hot and prickly, somewhat sweet, booze is very upfront and overwhelms the palate, good carbonation and body, some bitterness at the end along with sweetness from the vanilla and oak. I think this would be much better with a bit of age on it so that it could mellow and balance.

this beer is only availible for one month a year, so when i saw it on the shelf of my local Bottle King, I bought every 4 pack. Wow, i love this beer. Strong and syrupy, this beer will warm you up and knock you out. Has a hint of bourbon in the finish. If you see it , buy it.

Purchased at West Lakeview Liquors in Chicago, IL; enjoyed at home watching week 11 Thursday night football.  Appearance a dirty ruby / brown with a very thin white head that rims around the glass.  Aroma of bourbon, cherries, sweetness, oak, booze, doesnt smell overtly alcoholic but its obviously apparent.  Taste is really nice, vanilla, cherry, bourbon, roasted malt, and it all balances together very well.  Nice oak/wood flavor too, it goes down smooth, much smoother than other brews of this high ABV caliber.  Im really enjoying this one, highly recommend it.
Dark brown with ruby hints. Tan head. Nose is vanilla, oak and bourbon. Sweet malts. Taste is sweet, then boozy. Overall a great brew for bourbon lovers.
Bottled. Poured a medium opaque brown, mild head. Strong bourbon notes obviously, lots of cherries and some vanilla. Good enough.

12 ounce bottle from Garden City Beverage Barn.  Dark brown burgundy with ring and some lace.  Smoky peaty dark cherry woody herbal aroma with slight burn.  Toasted caramel dark fruity sweetness smoky woody spicy herbal hot vanilla finish.  A little hot for my tastes, but very complex and huge.  An excellent sipper for a cold evening.

Pours brownish red with a tan head that fades quickly. I smell booze, cherry, vanilla, toffee and some chocolate. Bourbon, vanilla, oak, cherry, chocolate and toffee. Medium thick on the palate with a semi sweet and bourbon finish.

Pours a dark brownish red color with thin tan head, strong oak/bourbon aromas, very malty hints of vanilla and dark fruits. Flavor is full of bourbon, almost like I took a dirty bastard and poured some in, a sure sipper.
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2012 The Backwoods Bastard has a strong bourbon taste and aroma.  Very dark dark red-tinted color.  Very nice taste that almost falls too close to bourbon...maybe too much.

Bottle, thanks to mrDeath5493.  Pours a murky brown with a small lazy head.  Aroma of sweet malts and peat smoked scotch.  Tastes slightly astringent but the alcohol is balanced by a hefty body with plenty of sweetness.  Finishes with pepper and cinnamon, slightly bitter.  Really really tasty.

Bottle. Pours mahogany with a tight off white head that fades to a thin tight ring. Aroma is bourbon and chocolate malt and a hint of vanilla. Taste is more chocolate roasty malt and bourbon with a woodiness and  smooth English bitters. Palate is full and slick with a chaulky dry finish. Very nice beer with a great bourbon character.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2011 On tap at Fries Cafe. Pours deep dark ruby brown with a small khaki head. Nice lacing on the glass with tightly formed small bubbles around the edges. Enormous aroma of bourbon, cherry, and vanilla. Taste is out of this world. Huge bourbon, vanilla, cherry, toasted malt, wood, caramel, and earthy hops. Medium bodied and slightly sweet, with lingering vanilla, peat, and dry hop bitterness in the aftertaste. Simply put, amazing. Drinks like a fine Scotch or Bourbon. Definitely not for everyone. Once again, Founders rules.

This beer is not too carbonated, but it is finely balanced.  Some bourbon barrel aged brews taste too much like the bourbon and nothing like beer.  Backwoods balances the bourbon with an actual beer behind it.  The nose is strongly of bourbon, but the flavor is supported by a heavy caramel and toffee malt.  Maybe a touch buttery too?
Pour looks almost like a cognac or whiskey, almost no head. Aroma of wood, vanilla, malt. Very wood driven flavor. Almost reminds me of a gentle bourbon more than a beer. Alcohol well hidden.

Strong taste of bourbon right away although it seems to mellow into a refreshing vanilla beer for me, almost like a strong hard root beer. The scent smells of bourbon but still goes down sweet. This beer taste better the second time around because you just are not expecting such a strong burst of bourbon. Overall great beer.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2013 Tap rating (same week had a one year bottle that was good but not as good as tap, about a 3.8) pours mahogany brown with off white head. Smell is very grainy, like a box of cereal, a residual grain and oaky bourbon sweetness with vanilla follows along with a touch of char. Taste is smooth, big barley wine like scotch ale with a touch of bourbon, the oak is well apparent and vanilla and barrel character is solid but so well done. This has everything you?d want in a barrel aged beer. This is one of my favorites from the malt end of the spectrum or barrel aged.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2015 12oz bottle pours dark brown with tan creamy head. dark sweet roasted malty bourbon aroma that just jumps off the page drink this a little warm or should i say sip on this one. flavors explode from the glass. strong bourbon alcohol burn that is sooooo smooth. medium bodied beer that is very very good.

This beer served chilled in a shaker pint.

Ar- The beer smells really good; however it falls just shy of fantastic. Nice earthy peat notes compete with vanilla oak bourbon, sweet smoked caramel nicely toasted and roasted malt. 

Ap- The body of the beer is mahogany. The head of the beer is shortly lived resolving to a ring of foam.

T- The beer is sweet caramel, toasted and roasted malts a flash of smoke and peat. The alcohol is a bit spicey. This beer is really nice but again just short of fantastic. 

P- The body is a little thinner than I want. The carbonation levels help this beer to be smooth and slick. Alchol is a bit player. Oddly enough I think this could be ramped up a bit more. I think  a bit more bourbonesque feel would be nice.

O- This beer is a nice sipper. Its a beer to seek out but not to go crazy seeking. This is a nicely done addition to the base beer.

12oz bottle from rozis nose is huge on this with a vast amount of aromatics, taste is big and flavorful it takes a big beer to overcome the barrel aging and the scotch style works nice and flavorful but definitively a slow sipper once in a blue moon

Bottle-to-glass at Carrboro Beverage Co. One of those "Ive never tasted something so delicious" moments. Chocolatey and caramel aroma.  Medium to dark brown. I can taste the bourbon. Its powerful stuff, pretty malty, but not too thick.
UPDATED: NOV 8, 2011 Pours brown with little to no head.  Taste of alcohol, scotch.  Average carbonation, strong finish.  Dirty Bastard on steroids.....definitely a sipper.  Awesome brew.

Deep copper, clear, pour with off-white head and average lacing.  Aromas are big: bourbon for sure, caramels, and notes of cherries.  Taste is sweet with an alcohol kick.  Little bitterness, but lots of bourbon.  Too much for me, but I can appreciate the flavors.  Palate is full bodied, slick, and a bit creamy.  Big dry, bourbony finish.  Overall, this is a big beer with the aging in the barrels.  Bourbon/whiskey styles are not my favorites, but I can appreciate the brew.  This is a good one for the style.
Wonderful aroma, rich, deep and sweet with heady alcohol, malty, caramel smell.   Beautiful dark caramel color.  Strong and sweet taste - definitely a sipper.
Poured into a pint glass.  Pours a rich copper, with some orange tint.  Nose gives you a lot of alcohol.  Rich, molasses/caramel.  Full flavored, with a strong finish.  Interesting beer.

The aroma is complex and intriguing with scotch and barrel notes, the aroma character is excellent but could be a bit more vivid overall. The only head that lingers is a tan collar around the edges over the dark mahogany hued body.  Flavors are earthy in a wet peaty manor, very scotch like, with some light smokey notes and wet wood contrasting sweet caramel malts. A very tasty beer i love to sip on, but i really think a 13% version would be spot on ;)

Aroma is super fruity right away.  Some pineapple/coconut smells.  Not what I was expecting.  Pour is deep red with a head that fades quick.  Fruity flavor is in there as well.  Pineapples and strawberries.  Some sweet cherry in there too.  Palate kind of burns and is pretty slick.  Aftertaste is cherries.  This isnt bad, just not the best Ive had in this style.

I enjoyed this fine ale outside at a sporting event in a plastic cup. Despite the lack of quality glassware, the nose showed beautifully with deep scotch/bourbon aromas. Sweet, earthy, oaky and delicious!

Bottled: difficult to read with new wax. 06/2011?

A: dark brown with a transient finger of toast foam falls to a scatteredsheet of the same. Where able, excellent clarity. Spotty lace. (4)
S: caramel, oat, leather, toffee. Hints of raisin. (4.5)
T: sweet with tones of English yeast and subtle clove and molasses. Really great tasting scotch ale. (4.5)
M: full and creamy with just a hare too much carb. Semi dry finish. (4) 
O: one of the best of the style Ive had. Yummy. (4.5)

Rusty brown with small brown head.  Aroma is interesting with bourbon, wood, caramel, cocoa, all kind of roasted.  Full body, some alcohol moderately prominent.  Flavor is pretty boozy, caramel, malt, a slightly sweet and dried fruit background.  Complex.  Borderline difficult to drink although ends up on the right side of the border.  Ended up appreciating more than enjoying it.

Bottled from Cracked kettle
Hazy dark amber. Small tan head.
Vinous oak in the aroma.
Soft and smooth.
Sweet oaky flavour; cedar.
Vinous.

Poured from a 12oz bottle into a Goose Island pint glass.

The color is a deep maroon with about finger and a half of foamy brownish head.

The smell is malty with some nice bready aroma and an interesting caramel aroma. Things seem to be well balanced even here in the nose.

The taste is sweet malts and some bourbon barrel overtones. Some oak flavor is there throughout the flavor. Some nice bitterness that goes back into a sweet malt flavor.

The feel of this beer is bold and complex with plenty of flavor to dwell over. Bitterness it countered by some sweet malt and things seem to battle back and forth but always seems to even things out toward the end.
UPDATED: MAR 9, 2014 La description faite par Founders ne pourrait pas être plus exacte. Dici à 2 ou 3 ans de maturation, jai limpression que la perfection sera atteinte.

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2011 Bottle.  A dark red beer with a thin creamy white head.  Sweet aroma of strong bourbon, some coconut, a little coffee, caramel.  Taste is sweet, with some hops; bourbon, coconut, alcohol.  Full bodied, dry finish.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a dark copper with burnt orange hues.  Aroma of scotch, cherries, smoke, oak, caramel and a touch of vanilla.  Flavor is cherry, oak, smoke, coconut, bourbon, caramel.  Wow, very flavorful without being too over the top.  Well done!

Poured into a pint glass. pours a dark amber color with a small head.

complex and deep nose with aromas of malts, dark cherries, spices, raisins, and a hint of smoke

full bodied and really smooth with real deep flavors of caramel, malts, dark cherries, a touch of roast coffee and some toffee

This is rich and big. It holds the alcohol very well and is certainly not a gulping beer. The feel is really good and deep

Woody, malty aroma has a strong overtone of bourbon - no surprise there! - and a hint of molasses. It pours a luscious clear dark caramel with a decent light tan head that leaves some good lacing. Rich, malty flavor has notes of molasses and horehound with a strong but not fierce bite from the bourbon and a woody, slightly fruity undertone. Smooth, fizzy texture has average body. Overall, delicious and recommended!

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2013 Reviewed on November 25, 2012, new review reflects score
Bottled October 8, 2012.
Appearance: The body is a clear mahogany with no head at all.
Aroma: This is very complex with oak, vanilla, dark cherries, and bourbon. I love the aroma here.
Taste: This is balanced absolutely beautifully with like smoke, oak, bourbon, dark cherries, light bourbon, and some earthy notes and peat on the finish. This is great and wonderfully complex.
Palate: Thick and syrupy with light carbonation.
Overall: This is not only an excellent beer, but it is priced very well. I dont think that theres a better value in bourbon barrel aged beers, if there is Id like to see it! This is wonderfully complex with a lot to pick apart.

Cellar Review: Bottled October 5, 2013 (10 months old).
Appearance: The body is a beautiful garnet with great clarity. The head is short and doesnt last very long. The tan coating is sparse with a thin ring.
Aroma: The aroma is huge vanilla with oak, and a touch of bourbon backing on the initial sip. Upon swirling smoke and cherries are noticed with sweet malts that remind me of toffee.
Taste: The intro is strong of black cherry, fig and hints of smoke. Vanilla and watery bourbon are noticeable from the mid-taste to the finish. The finish lingers a bit of oak and is a touch dry. This drinks like complex, but watery bourbon.
Palate: Thick with light carbonation.
Overall: Time hasnt done anything good to this. I wont age this again, it drinks about perfectly fresh.
Ratings: Ar: 7, Ap: 4, Ta: 6, Pa: 4, Ov: 14

Bottle purchased in Holland, MI.  Enjoyed at room temperature.

Phenomenal beer. Aroma is sweet malt, cherry, and oak.  Malty sweet flavors on the front end, followed by a smooth tropical coconut/pineapple oak flavor and sufficient bitterness to balance it out.  Mouthfeel is viscous and oily.  An amazingly balanced, well crafted beer.

12 oz Bottle that I got when I traded for a bottle of CBS. It pours a dark brown color with little head. It look more of a red color when it is held up to the light. The aroma is full of bourbon and vanilla notes. It tastes like a very solid, well made barrel aged old ale. I am very impressed.

12-oz bottle courtesy of James shared with James and Streets. Beautiful, deep red pour with a dark tint, especially from below. Smells like malts and booze with a bit of chocolate or vanilla coming through. Taste is somewhat complex with wood definitely making a showing. Malts, caramel, vanilla. Medium, chewy mouthfeel and the alcohol warms the stomach right off the bat. Later on, alcohol even burns the throat a little. So good.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2013 truly amazing beer. Hints of bourbon, tons of vanilla, toasty oak, toffe and caramel, slight Scottish roast. medium carbonation, almost syrup-like mouthfeel. tons of flavor. Founders makes good dark beer.

Poured a very dark reddish-brown with a minimal khaki colored head. Strong aroma of bourbon, wood, maple syrup, and sweet malt. Most obvious flavor is bourbon. The alcohol is by no means hidden but less pronounced than I was expecting. Smooth and silky palate.

Video review at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IDX8EBO3eOA

Appearance: Menacing ruby red, 1-finger head dissipates to layering, average lacing

Smell: Bourbon, vanilla bean, raw cinnamon, white oak, hint of bitter chocolate

Taste: Full body, bitter chocolate, vanilla bean, bourbon, oak, caramelized walnuts, oily resin, hint of plum, light maraschino cherry sweetness, mild carbonation

Pairings: Italian food, carbonara, pork roast

10 - 12oz bottle. Pours ruby red with a thin off-white head that sticks around leaving a little lacing. Aroma is sweet caramel, with notes of vanilla, bourbon, and oak. Flavor is malty sweet, with the same notes of caramel, vanilla, oak, and a little bourbon. Incredibly smooth, and easy to drink. Shame its my last bottle.
Pours dark brown with slight head. nose is whiskey, oak and brown mFirst sip is bourbon, vanilla, slight bitterness, finish is nice but not as good as remember.

12oz bottle from 09.  I had this one at a year old and it was fantastic, but I didnt review it.  Fantastic bourbon nose after the hiss, vanilla was rich and the woody undertones plesent.  Pours a nice dark brown with off white head.  Smooth across the palate, but what trouble me is the dropoff in the bourbon flavor, the vanilla sweetness very mild.  Balanced still, but I feel as though this one wont go another year.  I like it, but not loving it.  The year old would have gotten a 19/20.

Bottle from Bierkraft, Brooklyn, NY. A dark amber coloured pour with a small off white head on top. Pleasing aroma of scotch whiskey, vanilla and caramel. Tastes similar, whiskey, vanilla, caramel, sweet, fruity, malty. Jesus Christ this was good. Rich warming and complex. An excellent ale from Founders, wish Founders were easily obtainable here in the UK.

Ive had a few scotch ales, but this is the first one Im rating.  Pours a dark ruby brown with a nice tan head.  Aroma is almost like maple syrup - woody, sweet, dark.  Smoky characters in the flavor with the expected warm malts.  The dark fruit is a welcome note.  Alcohol is masked to perfection.  Another amazing brew from Founders.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2011 Pours a dark amber brown with a tan head.  Smell is huge on vanilla and bourbon.  Taste is sweet sugary vanilla,bourbon, a bit of bitterness from the cherries perhaps and a tad of the woodiness comes thru as it warms.  This is a super smooth and almost creamy sipper and now amongst my favorites. If you love bourbon because it is quite strong in this offering then you will love this.

Bottle.  Pours a dark red with an average, lasting beige head.  Aromas/flavors of scotch, bourbon, smoke, wood and some sweet caramel and roasted malts.  Hints of tobacco also.  Alcohol is well hidden.  A great, smooth, sipping beer for the cooler weather.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2011 Bottle. Pour is a dark ruby with an excellent light brown head. Good retention. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, cherry, oak, chocolate. Taste is nice vanilla, cherry, oak, light sweetness. Palate is on the dry side, medium body considering the abv. Sticky, oily texture, long bourbon finish. Quite nice, but nowhere near KBS level.

Re-rate: On draft: similar to the bottled version but much more chocolate in the taste and a much sweeter, fuller body on the palate. I would definitely suggest the draft version of this if you can get it.

Bottle poured into a pint glass is a chestnut brown with minimal light tan head.  The nose is bourbon, vanilla, dark fruit, and burnt sugar.  Taste is woody, bourbon, raisin, vanilla, caramel.  Wood and booze dominate this one.  Palate is medium, but the beer is boozy and the ABV being 10+, you notice.  It is not hot alcohol burn, but boozy bourbon.  Finish is medium in length, but sweet and fairly clean.  Overall, a very nice take on one of my favorite beers....like the original and would drink it more often.  This is special, and will age nicely.  Well done.
Nice dark pour with ample head. My first impression was chocolate, vanilla and malt. After reading the description, I would add scotchy. Give it a try.

had this on tap at founders today. light brown in color with small head. not a huge amount ofoak aroma but it is deffinetly in the taste very easy on the palate not over bearing on the alcohol. over a very good beer but goes down too easy for 10 percent
2009.  Pours clear dark amber with a small beige head.  Aroma is of scotch, caramel and malts.  Very clean and smooth, scotch, caramel, malts, some resin.  Lots of alcohol left in the throat.

Poured from a bottle. Deep brown in color with some head and lacing. A few floaties too. Bourbon and coconut on the nose. Dark malts and bourbon in flavor, hints of chocolate and coconut. A slight alcohol going down, nice and warming.
Bottle, thanx to tkrjukoff. Pours brown with a small, light brown head. Aroma of oak, vanilla and malt. Very oaky to the taste, alcohol, vanilla. A bit oily.

Love what Founders puts out and this one is no exception, 12 oz bottle served into a snifter. Pours a nice deep brown with a thick beige head and nice lacing. Aroma is deep and filled with vanilla and oaked whiskey and caramel. Taste is rich and toasty, with oaky flavors, chocolate covered cherries, and roasted malts. Finishes sweet. Mouthfeel is oily with a mild  carbonation. The whiskey barrel aging adds a great flavor. Yum!

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a darkness snifter. 

A- Pours a ½ finger head dissipates quickly, carbonation streaming off the bottom of the glass, dark muddy brown color, really cloudy, splotchy lacing, nice bubbly lacing around the glass.
S- Big bourbon aroma, dark fruits, vanilla, alcohol is present, malt, some spice.
T- Bourbon is definitely present, bitter sweet, vanilla, oak presence, caramel, brown sugar,  some spice, sweet malt.  
M- Big mouth feel, crisp finish, nice burn from the alcohol, well carbonated. 
O- This is a big beer, really enjoyed the big bourbon flavors, not over powering but really balanced, really impressed.

Big, tasty beer.  The barrel flavor is a simple, though, imho.  It smells great.  Big vanilla, oak, brown sugar, molasses and a lot of caramel.  Its a bit on the sweet side.  Taste is similar but the barrel flavor gets a tad harsh and isnt quite as enjoyable.  Mouthfeel is smooth and while its fairly thick, it could be even thicker.  Deep amber brown in color with a sudsy beige head.  Interesting beer.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2012 Bottle @ home, courtesy of HandsomeBrew (thanks Ben!) Dark orange/brown appearance with a tan head that disappears pretty quickly. Bourbon, caramel, toffee, and oak in the nose. Creamy, soft mouth feel. Lots of caramel, toffee, moderate bourbon, light smoke, nutty flavor with a touch of fruitiness. Toffee, bourbon aftertaste. Great brew!

12 oz bottle from fear025, thanks man. Clear deep amber brown with a small, dense head. Aroma of toffee, bourbon, oak, dark fruit and smoke. Flavor is smooth sweet caramel malt with hints of smoke, bourbon and alcohol. Medium to full body with mild carbonation and a long, smooth, malty finish. So glad I got to try this, now I need more. Lots of dark malt flavor with mild smoke and great barrel character and not overly sweet. Great beer.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours deep ruby mahogany with a small bubbly beige head leaving lace. Aroma is malty, dark fruits, madeira wine, raisins, sweet, caramel and vanilla. Flavor is like aroma, medium body, warming alcohol, lots of barrel. Finishes sweet malty and bitter.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2015 ....re rate Bottle from SB cons 2014-03-18 Göteborg
Keep old rating, but add bourbon barrells and vanilla to arom and flavour description/notes

Bottle shared thx to tkrjukoff cons 2011-07-09 Sätila
AR: scottish butter fudge, oak
AP: caramel colored body , fluffy head
F: roasted malt, plum wine, vanilla from the oak, watery, warming feeling more then alcoholic, fizzy, tutti-fruity

Bottle, thanks to tkrjukoff. Amber/brown beer with a beige head.  Oaky aroma, nicely balanced with toffe, vinous and weetish notes. Oaky malty flavor, woody, sweetish, nutty, a bit vinous, some alcohol. Lovely strong beer that really is smooth and well balanced.

Tasted on 7/6/11 from a 12oz bottle purchased at Lush West Town, this is the 2010 version, but I cant find a bottle date.  Pours a clear, dark amber with a bright red tint and a thick tan head that slowly settles down into a thin layer of even lace, leaving thick residue along the inside of the glass.  The nose is strong with vanilla, cinnamon, and oaky bourbon, along with a light cherry undertone with a ton of caramel maltiness as well.  This beer smells almost exactly like a manhattan cocktail.  The flavor is much the same with the sweeter malt up front, moving to the very oaky vanilla and cinnamon bourbon, a hint of cherry, and a bit of burnt caramel bitterness.  The body is full with light carbonation and a long vanilla bourbon, caramel malt, and lightly burnt bitter finish.

12oz bottle @Local Option Chicago.  I could tell within about half a glass of this that its definetly more than 10% alc after sitting for a few months...this got me tipsy in a single bottle.  Appearance is muddy brown with no head to speak of.  Aroma is Bourbon, vanilla, brown sugar, earthy hops.  Taste is vanilla, dried berries, warming alcohol, bourbon, a hint of chocolate and a slightly spicy finish.  Full bodied with almost no carbonation, very smooth with a not quite dry finish. Overall this is one of my top 10 barrel aged beers ever; this has everything I could want in a malt centric ale.

Pour dark amber to brown beige head. Aroma vanilla, peat, caramel, scotch, oak, toffee, and dark fruits. Taste oak, vanilla, wood, peat, caramel, dark fruits, raisins, nice boozy warmth. MF full body light carb. Tasty stuff well brewed a sipper indeed.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2014 Date: July 3, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: Beer Tasting, Bloomington, MN Appearance: Dark semi-opaque with no head Aroma: Bourbon Flavor: Sweet start with a bourbon finish.Re-rate on October 30, 2013 - bottle from Blue Max.  Dark brown pour with some head and spotty lacing.  Aroma was bourbon, oak and caramel.  Taste was dominated by the bourbon and oak with a touch of caramel sweetness and maybe some dark fruit.  A little bit of spice in the finish.  Drank it fresh - bottled 10.3.13 and have another bottle to age.

355 ml bottle.
Pours a dark, opaque, amber colour with a small, foamy, thick, slightly off-white head. Aroma of sour cream, sweet malts, syrup and raisins. Flavour of vanilla, oak, sweet malts, raisins, sweet and sour fruits. Medium/full bodied with a warming alcohol finish and some stinging oak, fruity notes. Pleasant.

Sweet caramel on the nose with hints of citrus and vanilla.  Pours a light brown with no head.  Nicely balanced and not a sugar bomb thank goodness.  Caramel malts with a great spiciness and some earthy notes with vanilla and oak.  Pretty good.
Aroma of scotch and praline pecans.  Pours deep 4c red with white lacing.  Tastes of bourbon cream.  Very smooth and dangerously quaffable.

Draft @ FoBAB 2009, Chicago, IL. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a sweetish malty toffee and dark fruit aroma with weak bourbon hints. Sweetish malty caramel and dark fruit flavor. Has a sweetish malty dark fruit finish with hints of bourbon.

Red brown color, very deep, small head. Aroma has tons of oak, vanilla, ripe dark fruits, toffee, fudge and raisins. Some bourbon but not too much and some maple syrup. Very nice. Taste has lots of oak as well; vanilla, bourbon, sweet port, red wine, some roast to the malts to provide a nice bitterness. Very good balance.
Bottle. Pours reddish brown. Tan head. Nose/taste of raisin, bourbon barrel, brown sugar, dark fruits, sweet caramel and toffee. Very smooth creamy mouth feel. Quite good.

This beer is amazing, a Scotch Ale reimagined through the eyes of an insane drunken poet.  Pours a murky, ugly burnt amber color, with a head that gurgles momentarily before disappearing.  Smells of bourbon and deep malt sweetness.  The taste starts with the classic Scottish-ale buttery malt front, but quickly grows heavy with bourbon and caramel, coating your mouth with a liquor-fueled sweetness that proves irresistible.  Straight bourbon finish, complete with tingly warmth and a sense of manliness.  Smooth and burny texture, boozy and appropriate.  Unbelievably good.  (3/11/09)

From bottle at Holiday Wine Cellars private tasting in January 2011.  Pours a nice reddish brown with a thin layer of beige head.  Aroma is fruity with notable berries, sweet caramel, lightly peaty malts, wood, and light bourbon.  Flavor has a nice fruity-berry taste along with rich caramel, peaty malts, and lightly boozy bourbon / scotch.  Lingering sweet caramel into the finish.  The high ABV for a scotch ale is hidden very well.  (683, 563)

Pours a deep mahogany with a smallish, dense off-white head.  Aroma is full of booze, bourbon, cherry, oak, roasted malt and a touch of smoke.  Flavor is that plus some vanilla, a spiciness, and some wood.  Palate is heavy and a bit creamy.  Mighty tasty.

Color is clear, flat, deep garnet. Lots of refraction. Aroma is molasses, caramel, agave, and salt. Flavor is primarily burnt toast, whole wheat, malt, and salt. Alcohol burn on the palate. Bottle from Chucks Wine and Spirits in Bowling Green, Kentucky.

Huge bourbon and sweet malt nose. Very smooth in the mouth, even if the body is a tad thin. Lots of dark fruit with a wallop of bourbon topping things off. A fantastic sipping beer, that with a bit more body would be a phenomenal beer.

Pours a dark mahogany with a small head that quickly falls to a thin ring.
Fruity rich aroma of dark caramel molasses, vanilla and bourbon.
Smooth sweet but not too heavily bodied.

The beer pours medium to dark amber with a small head. Smells a bit syrupy malty with some toffee notes and a little bourbon smoothness at  the end. The flavor is light sweet malts, a bit syurpy on the body. The end comes with bourbon that is so smooth with no boozy bite at all.

Got this as a bonus in a trade with Cornboy - thanks! Pours ruby brown with only little head. Aroma has lots of oak sweetness, vanilla, fudge, a hint of bourbon, hot chocolate, maple syrup, hints of roasted nuts. Taste is nice and oaky, notes of sweet port, walnuts roasted in syrup, nice oxidation too. Very good. The oak is very dominating, but very nicely balanced.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2014 Pours redish brown with a tiny brown head. Aroma is light oxidized with raisin, oak, ripe dark fruits, toffee fudge, bourbon and maple syrup. Taste of caramel, chocolate, barley, raisin, some warming alcohol, sweet port notes and light citrus at the end.

Got this in a trade with Baltimorebeerguy. Ive been wanting to try it for a while, as I work my way through the wee heavys. Hard to find around here.

Aggressive pour into a pint glass. 2 finger head that drips down beautfiully with complex, syrupy lacing.

Stays firm after a few minutes. Pits and valleys. Dark copper, auburn, mahogany color. Slightly cloudy. Aroma weighs heavily on the bourbon side. Nothing Scotchy here. Getting vanilla and burnt sugar.

Let warm for 5 minutes.

Hit with the bourbon boozines right off the bat. Sticky, toffee, vanilla, malty, chewy creamy,

Nothing wrong with that, I like many bourbon beers. But it seems that when you age things in b. barrels, it either marries up to the style of brew, or it doesnt. When it does, youve got amazing things like Goose Island Rare stout. When it doesnt, you get things like Kentucky Bourbon Ale that just taste like you poured bourbon in with the original beer.

This one is somewhere in between. Yeah, Im getting the malty, dark ale feel but it doesnt really say Scotch Ale to me a whole lot.

It IS delicious though and my only complaint is a slightly dry, phenolic finish. Im not grabbing this when I want a Scotch Ale, but its a wonderful sipper when you want that Bourbon feel but dont want the heaviness of a stout.

12oz bottle poured into my Darkness glass...A ruby copper, murky ugly. Little carbonation, only about half a finger rises later, falls quick, and only has a very thin film. No lacing...The aroma is really light, malty, smoke, oak and vanilla, what I get is nice. Reminds of a ba bw, wish it was stronger, could be great. Vanilla really shows off as it warms...The taste is really mostly smooth bourbon with lots of vanilla, oak shows off as well. This is really good, however on the finish there is a scotch note that I dont like. Starts to kill the drinkability.

I really enjoy this except for a split second on the finish. A non heavy handed barrel aged that displays mostly the bourbon but very enjoyable and drinkable.

Pours a kight brown colour with almost no head whatsoever.  Smells of Boubon, Vanilla and a bit of Oak with a bit of burnt brown sugar - very inviting!  Sweet taste of aged Bourbon whisky with hints of real vanilla, Oka, Scotch, and a slight hoppiness on the finish.  Boozy, this one may take several sips, but as it warms the character of this brew shines through.  Great beer to end the night with.

A - Pours a fairly clear deep red-brown color (mahogany) with a finger of off-white head. The head faded fairly quickly to a nice ring on the glass and laced very nicely.

S - Very powerful and deep smokey (bourbon) aroma. Also some sweet elements from vanilla and carmel notes. There is also booze in the nose. Excellent aroma.

T - Starts off with some sweet carmel malts and a touch of the smokiness building in the background. Also the vanilla is also mixed in. In the middle the smoky flavor really jumps out. The finish has some more of the smokey/bourbon taste, the sweet malts, some dark fruit flavors, and some booze flavor, which all blend together and linger for a while. Excellent balance in the flavor.

M - Medium to medium-full bodied with moderate carbonation. Almost a bit think and creamy without being too viscous. The smokiness really coasts the mouth well. There is some nice alcohol sting on the tongue also.

D - Fairly drinkable. Knocking in at a relatively high 10.20 % abv, this is a fairly heavy beer and is best sipped. That being said, the booze flavors stay in check for high level and the flavor is just amazingly well balanced and complex. Excellent beer.

Pours a brownish, dark maroon color.  An off white, very light tan head that was relatively small and it didnt have much retention.  Might be because of the high ABV of this beer.  Left some traces of lacing.  The beer is predominately cloudy with some burnt orange highlights at the bottom.  The aroma clearly had the characteristics of bourbon whiskey.  A nice "woody" note also.  This brew had a very pleasant burnt sugar, toffee, caramel malt smell.  Maybe even a small touch of chocolate.  It smells a little like those candy brown sugar "haystacks."  Sorghum even.  Very complex and balanced.  The flavor revealed the bourbon whiskey once again, but it also had a brown sugar taste that gave it some sweetness.  I swear it seems like Im getting a slight touch of an orange slice taste.  Small smattering of bitterness.  Again, well balanced and complex.  Medium/full mouthfeel with a significant alcohol burn and warmth.  Leaves a tremendous amount on the palate.  Well after the sip the flavor remains.  Its smoother than one might think and it is nicely dry all the way through.  This beer is very, very nice.  Lots of kick and a wonderful aroma and taste and mouthfeel.  Most definitely a beer for sipping.  The alcohol is prevelant, but it is surprisingly not distracting.  Its noticeable in the mouthfeel, but its not unbearable.  After one of these I would more than likely be done.  Not from lack of enjoyment, but lack of alcohol tolerance.

12 oz brown stubby bottle. 2010 vintage.

It pours an extremely deep and dark plum color. Just sitting there it looks black. The head is thick and tightly foamed and has a bit of creaminess. It is off-white and sticks for a nice while before receding with some nice lacing.

The bourbon and oak dominate the smell, though you can smell traces of the scotch ale underneath. It has a subtle fruitiness that provides a bit of freshness to the tried and true bourbon oak scent.

The flavor is very smooth and nice. It has a rich flavor of buttery toffee that meshes very nicely with the bourbon. There are notes of vanilla and milk chocolate caramel as well. The 50 IBUs are nice and keep this one pretty balanced. The bitterness is slightly tannic with a good deal of woodiness, hops, and a slight roasty bitterness. the fruitiness isnt as pronounced in the taste, but there is a nice bit of prune underneath it all that adds an extra layer of depth.

The mouthfeel is rich and full-bodied with an exquisite carbonation. It has an alcohoic punch but it isnt overt.

After having Dirty Bastard I didnt think this one would be this good, but this is exquisite.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-14-2010 22:01:28
Sample from bottle. Pours a clear reddish brown, off-white head.  Smoky roasted malts, sugar sweetness, chocolate, fruit, bourbon, and a touch of vanilla.  A better then average scotch ale.

Got this as an extra in a trade. Very grateful for this one!! Pours a reddish brown with very little head with some spotty lacing. Smells of wet wood, toasted malt, and a little smokey chocolate. The taste is largely of whiskey, chocolate malts, and a little pepper.  It was delicious from start to finish. Slightly over carbonated or I would have given it a 4. Very enjoyable!

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2011 Ok so there were 666 ratings on this one when I stepped up to the plate, a reason for caution?  Ah screw it!  

I love single malt scotch, and I love beer, too good to be true?  This is as close to whisky in beer that Ive seen.  mild chocolate nose, lots of whisky overtones, mild carbonation...and they stick some hops in it too!  Tough to describe, but really tasty.

Good stuff.
Wow this is bourbon aged, extremely infact, its tough to taste too much behind it, including the alcohol, alright, ill take it

Pours a dark mahagony with a nice one finger tan head.  Nose is bourbon, smoke, and sweet malts.  Taste is very malty and very good.  Some dark sugar and caramel as well.  They say it is made with cherries but I dont get that flavor just like I do not believe it is 50 ibus (which is a good thing).  I love this beer from beginning to end.

courtesy of Laurent Mousson and Kris Butler - hazy brown colour with a little beige foam; toasted biscuity and almondy aroma; full-bodied, some sweetness and very bitter, long cookie-like caramelish and hoppy finish with hints of vanilla

Poured an clear amber with very fine off white head that quickly dissipated, leaving only traces of lacing.  Caramel, nuts, and bourbon on the nose with hints of vanilla.  Light sweetness on the taste, with reflections of the aroma.  Medium body with very soft carbonation and a little stickiness.  An absolute sipper, it is a bit hot while young.  I prefer it with a year or so of age, as it mellows the bourbon and lets the vanilla out more.

Pours a dark mahogany.  Complex aroma of oak, malt and some smoke.  Taste is somewhat sweet of cheery, caramel and the scotch.  Palate is amazing, slick, medium body.  Finish stays on the tongue.  A really nice beer, better for just drinking one beer on a cold week night as opposed to a long session of craft beer drinking.

Pours thick and syrupy. Almost no head. Nose is bourbon, toffee, maybe some suede thrown in there?  Feels like it looked when poured.  Very smooth, more bourbon, toffee, tobacco, some hop/carbonation bite and a little heat in the finish.  One of my favorites.  Bet it will only get better with some age.

The Aroma is something out of this world. Dark sweet cherries and vanilla...bourbon! Dark sugars and pecan pie. A perfect balance of sweet and bitter....thick and smooth. Definitely earthy and winter spices. Its so good. A dark brown pour with a quickly fading head. Alittle hot and quite dry on the finish. Im in love.

Bottle. Ive never before had a barrel aged scotch ale... but I really liked this one! Sweet of caramel, chocolte, cream etc. And the barrel agening adds some light smokeiness, some vanilla and a lot of smoothness. Great balance. Great beer.

Bottle from Cracked Kettle.
Pours looking like cola syrup without any head.

Aroma of burbon and cola caramells and some hops. The burbon is a very nice comlement to the beer!

Nice caramell cola taste with cherries and a touch of hops in the finnish. Very well balanced!

12oz bottle, courtesy of beerisheaven. Great bourbon, sweet vanilla aroma. God I love bourbon. This has some nice subdued caramel, scotch flavor with bourbon overtones. This is quite delicious. A serious supper, warming me right up.
Phenomenal offering from Founders. Great smoky flavors combined with the scotch flavor of Dirty Bastard makes for an incredible beer. Really strong caramel flavors top it off.

From 11/7/10 @ Tylers Apex. Great aroma. Sweet, malty. Chocolate, caramel, whiskey. Brownish orange color, small to no head, spotty lace. Sweet flavor. Medium body, smooth creamy mouthfeel, dry sweet finish. Very tasty, a lot of barrel in the flavor, goes down easy. One worth seeking. Another Im surprised it took me long to rate.....
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle.  Pours a very dark dirty brown.  Minimal off white head.  Big bourbon aroma.  Taste is harsh.  I would describe it as a little of burnt alchohol.  Very thick palate.  Very dry.  Mouthfeel is bitter.  It always fun trying the big beers and this definitely qualifies.  I like a good scotch ale, but this one is too harsh for me.  Ill happily stick to the Dirty Bastard.

Poured almost black with lots of head and lacing that stuck around.  Oaky bourbon smell which was really nice.  Taste was caramel and roasted grains with a large back end of bourbon.  The after-taste was what killed it for me unless I just got a bad bottle.  I typically like anything aged in barrels but, this one just missed a bit.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2014 Nose is bourbon, caramel, dark sweet cherries, a bit of chocolate.  Taste is pretty sweet but rich melange of bourbon, caramel, cherries, plums, smokiness, slightly leathery.  All told, a really awesome take on a style Im not madly in love with.
Bierkraft. Yastes of malt, sugart, brown toffeee and bread. Tastes of toffee, sagrup and cocolatye. Excellent

Deep amber with minimal head.  Nose is dominated by bourbon.  Flavor is primarily bourbon up front, lots of bourbon.  There is some malt presence, but bourbon takes the front seat.  Very interesting beer, and even though I generally enjoy barrel aged beers, this was a bit much for me.

12oz bottle (08) from Secret Santa 
Appearance: Pours a very dark mahogany, almost black with a medium sized beige head and good lacing 
Aroma: Bourbon, oak, caramel and smokey 
Taste: Roasted malts, bourbon, vanilla. Dry finish 
Very nice scotch ale. Nice sipper beer that I could sip a few of easily.

Had on tap at Old Chicago...this beer was really unexpected. It was almost like a lightly carbonated scotch or whiskey. That might not seem appealing, but it was excellent. Very enjoyable. Was way smoother than its parent dirty bastard.

2009 bottle.  Brown in color with amber highlights.  A small white head was present upon pouring but faded fast.  This smells like boozy pancakes to me, which is coincidentally what Im gonna make for breakfast tomorrow.  Strong vanilla presence in the aroma, too.  Taste is sweet with vanilla and a slight anise note in there as well.  Stronger dark fruit presence in the taste.  Mild alcohol not with a slight warming feeling in the throat which each sip.  Another solid offering from bells*.

Poured into a pint glass. Received as part of "extras" in a HB BIF from Hogie.

3.0 A: Really dark brown and rather opaque. I couldnt get a good head (about one finger), and not good retention of that either. Head is light brown in color. Decent amount of lacing. There is a bunch of variable sized crap throughout all layers of the brew.

4.5 S: Damn good aroma. Easily makes up for the sloppy appearance. Bourbon barrels come through quite well and also a tinge of alcohol. Dark roasty malts and dark fruits.

4.0 T: Tastes a lot like it smells. Woodiness and alcohol tinge are present foremost. Lots of raisins and tobacco as well, followed by plum. Roasted malt and caramel.

4.0 M: Heavy Medium body. Except for the bite of alcohol, this is otherwise very smooth.

3.5 D: Though I enjoy a wee heavy/barleywine/olde ale now and again, I havent found one that I find very drinkable.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-01-2009 19:17:54

Tasted on tap at the brewpub.  I preferred the original Dirty Bastard to this one. Nose is big on bourbon, coconut. Pours deep amber with low tan head. Taste is overpowering of bourbon, with sweet malt. Finish is long and bitter.
Smells strongly of wood and vanilla.  Deep amber in color.  Complex dark ale, sweet an roasty with nice oaky and whiskey tones.  One of my favorites.
bottle thanks to EDA - sweet, oaky, brown sugar, toffee, butterscotch, bready malts. molasses, sugary toffee finish. bourbon and smooth. one of the best scotch ales ive had.
UPDATED: JAN 5, 2017 Lots of bourbon, oaky, brown sugar. Off sweet. Smooth and rounded. Tons of raisins,  oak and vanilla. Still a bit simplistic for what I was expecting.

A deep, hazy, brown pour with hardly any tan head. Bourbon smell mainly (go figure) and some oak, but also a hint of a sweetness I cant quite place. astes of Bourbon to start, which subsides to a sweet malt finish. ow carbonation. The medium body is just short of syrupy. The Bourbon does not take control of this, like Ive experienced before with other barrel aged beers, and it finishes quite smooth.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2011 Reddish-hued brown pour with a dense tan head that leaves plenty of lacing behind. Aroma is ripe with vanilla, oak, bourbon, toffee, caramel, and smoke. Taste is wonderfully complex. The sweetness is delightful up front, but its trailed by a warm wave of booze and oak. The booze flavor is not unpleasant, and its more scotch than bourbon. Some vanilla, smoke, and caramel. Palate is full and rich, definitely a sipper. Really fantastic stuff. Id love to drink this outside by a campfire.

Poured a dark brown with no real head.  Aroma was a touch of the bourbon, dark fruit and malt.  Flavor followed with a hint of caramel and vanilla.  Low carbonation.  Alcohol was not in the forefront.  A good brew.
Bottle.  Pours dark brown with very thin tan head that quickly disappears.  Aroma is vanilla, bourbon, and caramel.  Flavor is vanilla and bourbon.  Very nice.

Bottle  Pours a murky brown with a thin tan head.  The head leaves quickly, and leaves rings of lacing.  Has a good aroma of vanilla, caramel,and whiskey barrels.  Has a light cartbonation.  The flavor is real good.  Strong whiskey barrel but alcohol is not over bearing.  has a full body.  The texture is slick.  A real good finish with a great aftertaste.  A smooth good beer.  A big beer for sure but vwery drinkable.  Well Done.

Enjoyed on tap in a whiskey snifter.  The beer pours a semi-opaque deep brown, with essentially no head.  The aroma shows characters of the original beer, heavy caramel and toffee, less assertive chocolate; paired with the additional complexity added by the barrels, namely a subtle vanilla.  The flavor of the beer is overtly malt, perhaps too much so for some, but still avoids seeming thick or cloying.  Alcohol is hidden deftly.  Caramel, toffee, vanilla, and chocolate notes again come through.  Overall, a beer that takes its place among the great winter warmers; excellent.

From Strykzone.   This 1z-oz bottle. pours a muddy brown color with a medium sized tan head. The nose is first bourbon, with lots of sweet caramel, ripe dark fruit, chocolate, and some vanilla.  Very full body and exceptionally smooth mouthfeel for a scotch ale. The flavor is caramel malts,  chocolate, bourbon, dark fruits and more vanilla. The alcohol is under control here and does not overwhelm  the flavors.   There is a bitter finish. This is a great sipping beer and perfect for this cold January evening.  Thanks Strykzone for sending this.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2016 Sampled on draft at Smokin? Joe?s in Pittsburgh PA this beer poured a dark orange-brown color with a large creamy beige head that produced great lacing. The aroma was brown sugar, caramel and light notes of grapefruit and pineapple. The flavor was very strong bourbon, sweet brown sugar, strong pineapple and light grapefruit and pine. There were undertones of wood and honey. The finish was long with bourbon, brown sugar, wood and fruit. Thick and full bodied. Exceptional.

12 oz. bottle.  This is one of my favorites and I am just getting around to rating it.  Pours a slightly hazy brown color with a smaller beige head.  The aroma is sweet caramel and chocolate with mild bourbon, hints of dark fruit and a good shot of vanilla.  The flavor is carmelized malt and chocolate, woody, bourbon, dark fruits and more vanilla.  The alcohol is never intruding on the flavors.  Full bodied and smooth.  A great sipper, especially during these winter months.

(12oz bottle. Huge thanks to guyinchicago!).  Pours cloudy mahogany with off-white head.  Big bourbon aroma.  Taste is sweet and very much like bourbon.   Medium bodied with a smooth bourbony finish.  What a great beer! Thanks again, Chuck. You are the man!

Incredibly smooth, strong is an understatment.  taste the bourbon barrel, carmel and the malt.  This beer is 1 of three I got for myself in Charlotte back in Nov 10.  Black in color with a little carmel brown near the bottom, nice head and lacing.
Wow, these guys deliver exactly what they say...big oaked bourbon aroma & taste!  Mouthfeel is a perfect blend of the same and every sip is big.

Poured a cloudy brown color with a medium sized head.  Aroma of bourbon, wood, and malts.  Lite sweetness hits the tongue first followed by a dry bitter bourbon taste.  Palate is med to full bodied.  Sort of creamy and oily texture.  Ave carbonation.  Wow, the beer really soaked up the oak bourbon wood.  It really takes over this beer.  When you get past the oak, it is a well rounded scotch ale nice balance of malt and hops.  I would get it again.

From a growler.  The aroma is scotch, sweet caramel, oak.  The appearance is a deep opaque dark red/brown, small head.  The flavor is scotch, caramel, peat, earth, oak.  The body is medium/thick.  The finish is alcohol warming, sweeetness, pine needles.  Nice, even if the scotch is a little overpowering.

pours a dark ruby brown with almost no head. lots of wood and liquor in the nose. taste is a smoothed out scotch ale flavor with the bourbon and oak notes. kind of sweet and syrupy. i also taste a slight nutty flavor in there. well balanced for a 10% abv beer. very good and alot better than i originally thought. great beer from an amazing brewery.
bottle - meh, not what I expected - strong bourbon flavor - very smokey with strong alcohol notes.   Not really what I look for in a beer

Thanks to NBondi for the bottle. Deep murky brown pour with a thin tan head. Maple syrup, oak, bourbon in the aroma. Taste is thick and chewy malt, spicy hop bitterness, toffee, maple syrup and hints of bourbon all popping out. Extremely complex and tasty.
Initial aroma of faint spices and scotch.  Medium-thick body with a sweet, almost honey-like flavor, subsiding to the warm hint of scotch.

Reddish ruby pour light hazy off white/beige head .... aroma of bourbon and some caramel malt .... taste of sweet caramel light roasted malts and oaky/bourbon ... dry taste lots of caramel malt and just the right of bourbon kick to it .... nice to see bourbon mixed with a different style finishes dry and warm bourbon

UPDATED: APR 2, 2011 Pours brown with a red tint with a small off white head. Smells of scotch and light fruits, tastes of the same with slight chocolate notes. Taste is not as boozy as the smell however it is still present on the palate.

(bottle)  Perhaps the perfect winter evening beer.  Coffee, silky chocolate and brandy flavors with a smooth mouth feel.  Long-lasting and full flavored.  A perfect alternative to brandy.  This is what craft brewing is all about.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2014 Deep brown and red.  Nice yellow-tan head. Holy bourbon!  The mix of aroma with the bourbon barrel and the dark fruit/malt gives the aroma almost a pineapple/coconut aroma.  Great flavor depth with dark fruit, peat-smoked malt, bourbon.  Alcohol warmth.  Medium to full body.  Excellent.  Cellar 3-6 months.  Good fresh.

Pours extremely dark red with a slight brownish tint and a small off-white head. Large carbonation bubbles and nice lacing as well. Aroma is of scotch, rum, smoke, light fruits, Flavor is a wee heavy on the alcohol as to be expected and includes notes of raspberry, cherry, bitter chocolate, and a subtle roasted finish. Damn good scotch ale.

Pours muddy clay brown with a medium off-white head.  Aroma is of whisky bourbon, vanilla, and malt.  Taste is distinctly bourbon and vanilla; malt and alcohol.  Very good heavy beer with a very smooth perfect mouth feel which is only to expect from Founders.  For a scotch ale the whisky overpowers a bit, not a traditional scotch ale.  Then again they already make the perfect traditional scotch ale at Founders.  Overall wonderful, glad to have purchased, good to see founders continuing to push the envelope.

For a scotch ale this one is pretty different from any other that Ive tasted. Has a super  dark pour, not quite black, but brown. Has a nice thick head, bubbly and frothy. Has a big woody aroma to it, with slight hints of fruit to it. The taste is malty, but oaky as well. It seems really balanced and pretty easy to drink. Not too big.

Nice brown color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted smoky sweet malt, strong vanilla, caramel, licorice, & spice; Flavor of smoky sweet malt, oak, caramel, molasses, dark fruit, some chocolate, and spice; Very nicely balanced & complex; Overall, excellent brew.

odd aroma, more scotch and smoke and wood than beer, also something else, sharp mustard maybe? somehow smells like its gonna be sweet and sour and dry and spicy.
flavor is different, sweet--kinda like eating a bowl of scotch and cherries (but even more delicious).
slightly astringent, flat, and you taste the scotch cherries for like an hour.

Pours a cloudy brown hue. No head to speak of. Aroma slight hint of berries or grape, slightly sweet. Slight hints of berries and malts that blend in perfectly with the nice whiskey finish. My first scotch ale and I am very pleased.

My 100th. 2010 bottle thanks to A. Pours mahogany with thick, one-finger tan head that slowly fades. Nose of molasses, scotch, maple syrup, vanilla and caramel. Slightly hot up front (bourbon) but there is a full palate of rye, smoke, malt, bread, and oak in the middle. Long finish as the 10.2% might suggest. I am a fan. I wish I had another to cellar; I imagine this would age quite well.

Bottle. Dark ruby tinted brown with a small tan head. Malt, oak, and alcohol nose. Flavor follows suit with sweet malt, oak, alcohol, and vanilla. Its a little too bourbon for my taste. I far prefer Founders Dirty Bastard to this one.

Bottle. Dirty, murky mud puddle light brown with orange hints around, with a thinner slightly off-white head. Whisky, and lots of bourbon notes, some malt sweetness and booze in the aroma.  Bourbon come through in the flavor, with some vanilla oakiness and cherry wood sweetness.  Not getting the roasted qualities, but lots of bourbon booziness.  Medium to fuller body, with very subtle carbonation.  Lovely cold night sipping brew.

Bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy amber color with a tan head. Aroma is caramel, oak, vanilla, bourbon, some rye, and alcohol. Flavor is caramel, bourbon, oak, vanilla, rye, spicy hops and a sweet alcoholic finish.   Really good one.

Aroma is pretty amazing--lots of bourbon and vanilla. Flavor is generally sweet with a bourbony, boozy finish. Lots of vanilla to it, an alcohol warming. Im kind of torn on it--its got some amazing elements to it, but it doesnt quite come together for me--the bourbon kind of overpowers. The rating here reflects those elements, although as a whole beer Im not sure it lives up to the parts or to the cost.

brown with moderate white head.  vanilla and oak to the nose.  low carbonation for the style.  moderate bitterness for the style.  a lot of vanilla immediately comes through before some oak and a touch of malt.  alcohol is presenet but adds nice depth.  an excellently oak-aging, providing beautiful flavor, hoever, it may overdo the actual scotch ale, which is hidden in a forrest of toasted oak

12oz bottle.  Aroma very strong of roasted malts.  Its like this beer doesnt have any hops at all because the malt is so strong.  Also has a strong oak finish.  Nice rich texture.  Worth trying, but it might be a little too malty.

A: Dark brown with mahogany hues to it. Small off-white, creamy head.

S: Lots of bourbon going on here. This sits atop a fairly-strong caramel malt base with some buttered notes.

T: Again, the bourbon really comes out. It layers a nice complexity on top of the underlying notes of oak, caramel, and malt sweetness.

M: Medium mouthfeel with good carbonation. Not too hot, but a pretty good alcohol warmth to it.

D: Pretty drinkable, and sips especially quickly for a beer with so much bourbon.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-03-2009

Pours cider brown with very little head.  Aroma of sweet caramel, wood, and bourbon.  Focus on the bourbon, but cloves, apple, molasses, and hint of cherry is also apparent.  Crisp feel, with a medium body.  Wish a I had a dirty bastard tonight to compare with this, but it is quite delicious.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2010 On tap served in a snifter. Pour was a caramelized ruby with one finger of light Carmel head nose was bourbon and dates. Taste was was much like the nose but with a slight hint of wood and peat. The bourbon was bit extreme for my tastes but nun the less another great offering from founders.

Bottle, thanks to zdk for sharing.
Clear dark brown with some off white head. Aromas of vanilla, molasses,  malts, and alcohol. Full bodied with a bit of heat from the alcohol. A bit of an oaky, earthy note comes out more on the palate.

This 12 oz bottle poured red, cloudy, and almost still into a snifter. Powerful aromas of bourbon, vanilla, and maple syrup intermingled with a flavor that gave off the slightest hint of cotton candy. Its hard to imagine disliking this, but equally difficult to imagine quaffing more than one. This is a delightful aperitif or nightcap, though, and yet another treat from Founders.

Poured from 12oz bottle, pours a very dark amber/brown with a tan head, aroma is of sweet malt with wood and a hint of booze, the flavor is very sweet on the front end with an intense burnt wood flavor with booze on the finish that warms the insides.
aroma- vanilla, oak, whiskey, dark fruit, chocolate.  pours deep red/brown.  taste is chocolate, cream, whiskey, oak, coconut, caramel.  palate is creamy, full bodied, some carbonation.
